loans.name: Elenda Suyapa

texts.es:
Elenda de 37 años de edad, realizo los estudios hasta 3° grado en la ciudad, se trasladó a vivir a su actual residencia de 15 años de edad, vive aun con sus padres pues es la única que vela por ellos y por su bienestar.

Elenda se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace ya 5 años, pues quien realizaba esa labor era su padre y no pudo continuar por motivos de salud, quedando ella como encargada de la siembra. Quien antes aportaba económicamente realizando oficios domésticos en casas de sus vecinos.

El crédito que esta solicitando, es para comprar abono y así obtener una buena cosecha de maíz, pues sus recursos no le son suficientes para cubrir todos los gastos para dicho trabajo


Ella sueña tener salud para seguir en sus labores diarias, ayudando a sus padres para tener una vida más tranquila sin tantas necesidades económicas.
texts.en:
Elenda is 37 years old and studied until the third grade in the city. She moved to live in her current home at the age of 15. She still lives with her parents and is the only one that takes care of them and their well being.

Elenda has made a living cultivating corn for the last five years. Her father was the one who used to do this work, but he could not continue due to health issues. Thus she was left in charge of the sowing when before she had been helping out economically by doing household work in their neighbors' homes.

The loan she is requesting is to buy fertilizer and thus obtain a good harvest of corn since her own resources are not sufficient to cover the expense of that work.

She dreams of having good health to continue her daily work, helping her parents have a calmer life without so many economic needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and thus obtain a good harvest of corn since her own resources are not sufficient to cover the expense of that work.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is 25 years old and single. He lives with his family in Haja, Yemen. Maher has a university education. Because of a high rates of unemployment in the country, he could not find a job to look after his family. He is very respected and personal young man and knows how he can run his life well. He has a great determination to improve the living conditions of his family. He does not surrender easily to obstacles and problems. 

As a result, Maher decided to start his own business by building a store in order to open a grocery to sell all kinds of merchandise to the local residents in his area. The building expenses store cost him a lot of money. His parents supported him financially. Maher has a small amount of money, which is not enough to purchase food and other merchandise for his grocery. For this reason, Maher requested a loan from AMB for 150,000 YER, which he will use to purchase many kinds of food and other merchandise for his new grocery.

loans.use: to purchase food and other merchandise for his new grocery.

loans.name: Irum

texts.en:
Irum lives in Rawalpindi. She is 29 years old, and has one child. Her husband sells livestock in the local market. He has eight years of experience in this field. His aim is to provide a better future for his family. Therefore, he works really hard to increase his earnings. His income is not sufficient enough for him to arrange for the money needed to buy cows and buffaloes for reselling purposes. 

Therefore, Irum has applied for a loan to contribute to her husband's business. 

Their main aim is to educate their child.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Wawan

texts.en:
Wawan lives in Sukabumi, in the west of densely populated Java. Even though it rains often and there are many rivers and irrigation canals the situation is very much as in Samuel Taylor Coleridge’s Rime of the Ancient Mariner : “Water, water, everywhere, And all the boards did shrink; Water, water, everywhere, Nor any drop to drink.” 
All drinking water in Indonesia is contaminated with bacteria. That is why Wawan started to sell safe drinking water filters from Nazava so people can drink water from their well without boiling it. 
Wawan has been selling Nazava water filters for three months now and he is has been very successful. He started this business by introducing and promoting the filters to co-workers, neighbors and people he knew. 

Wawan is very optimistic about his business he plans to sell more in remote areas and also work together with community organizations. 

With this loan Wawan can buy up to 50 filters which will help him provide safe drinking water to around 250 people.

loans.use: to buy 50 filters from Nazava to provide safe drinking water to around 250 people

loans.name: Savy's Group

texts.en:
Savy’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Savy makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farm laborer and selling groceries at home to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

The daughter of Savy is pictured alongside the other group members in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: A loan of Rp10,000,000  helps Patricia to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to her community. Patricia’s parents were civil servants. She received a Bachelor in Theology and works full time as a church administrator. To supplement her income she also teaches and mentors children for a church based child advocacy ministry. To increase her income Patricia has joined Kopernik’s Tech Kiosk network to sell simple life-changing technologies. She will use the loan to buy stock and grow her business. She is excited about Kopernik’s training program to learn about these new technologies, promote them to her customers and improve her general business skills. Patricia plans to use the extra income to pay off a bank loan and make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to her community

loans.name: Set's Group

texts.en: Set’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Set makes a living cultivating rice, finding fishes and raising pigs and she also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help Set and the other members of the group to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.ru:
Надежда занимается выращиванием овощей на собственном участке в с.Водяное 14 лет. Так как родители Надежды из Водяного, сама она тоже, она с детства знакома с сельским хозяйством. Раньше она с мужем жила в Энергодаре, оба работали, но денег не хватало. Потом продали квартиру и купили  дом в селе Водяное. Надежда с мужем вместе построили теплицы, стараются постоянно развиваться. У нее есть 4 теплицы для помидор с отоплением, 10 маленьких для редискми и две теплицы для рассады. Еще одну теплицу поставили в этом году, осталось ее только накрыть. 
Надежда хочет поставить еще одну теплицу, для чего ей нужно 40 000 гривен. У Надежды есть около гектара земли, то есть ей есть куда развиваться. Она хочется расширять бизнес и строить еще теплицы. Пока на свободной земле выращивают пшеницу для животноводства, но в планах строить там теплицы и развиваться.
texts.en:
Nadezhda has been involved in growing vegetables on her own plot of land in the Vodyanoye village for 14 years. Because Nadezhda's parents are from Vodyanoye, she too has been familiar with agriculture since childhood. She and her husband used to live in Energodar, both of them worked, but did not have enough money. Then, they sold their apartment and purchased a house in the Vodyanoye village. Nadezhda and her husband built greenhouses together and continue to develop their business. They have 4 heated greenhouses for tomatoes, 10 small ones for radishes and two greenhouses for seedlings. They installed another greenhouse this year and need to cover it.

Nadezhda hopes to install another greenhouse and needs 40 000 hryvnia for this purpose. Nadezhda has about a hectare of land, so she has space to grow her business. She wants to expand her business and build more greenhouses. In the meantime, they grow wheat for their animal husbandry business, but plan to build greenhouses there and expand more.

loans.use: to build a new greenhouse and expand her business

loans.name: Mkombozi Mwenge Group

texts.en:
Levina, who is in her late 20s, is married with two children who are still at school. She has been running a beauty salon business for three years now.  She works from 08 am to 10 pm daily, and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Levina's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy up-to-date salon equipment and meet her customer's requirements.  She dreams of building her own house.

Levina will share this loan with her loan group, "Mkombozi Mwenge", with five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date salon equipment

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business, where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a vibrant location, and her customers are of all types. She says her biggest business challenge is a lack of capital.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to own a boutique, within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will build a permanent house. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She repaid her previous loan successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business further.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Magarita

texts.en:
Magarita is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be optimistic. 

She operates a retail business where she sells groceries. She has been involved in this business for six years. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of groceries. 

Her business goal is to open a shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy a cow. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of groceries

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as obedient and honest. She operates a retail business, where she sells beauty products. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located in a suitable location. She says her biggest business challenge is insecurity.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products. She hopes that in the future, she will have an improved business and live a good life.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products.

loans.name: Dúo Crisalida Group

texts.es:
Dúo: Crisalida

Este dúo está formado por Carlos Humberto originario del área de san Martin Jilotepeque,Carlos Humberto se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de belleza, luchan diariamente por darle lo mejor a sus hijos y solicita el crédito para comprar productos para surtir mas su negocio y así obtener mejores ganancias, esperan que se le pueda ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
Duo Crisalida

This duo was formed by Carlos Humberto who originates from the San Marin Jilotepeque area. Carlos Humberto sells cosmetics. They put effort daily to give their children the best and requests the loan to buy products to supply his business and in this way get better earnings. They hope that they can get help with the requested loan.

loans.use: to buy beauty products to sell

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia works hard to support her family. Cresencia is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Cresencia requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, milk and fruits.

Cresencia has been in this business for years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Cresencia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, milk and fruits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Nato

texts.en:
Nato is 45 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and 12-year-old son in Ozurgeti district. Nato works as a baker at a local bakery and gets a small monthly income. Her husband is unemployed. 

Nato decided to start her business and get additional income. The start up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $2,300 to begin a trading business. With the received credit she will purchase a stock of used clothes and will sell among her villagers. 

This will increase her income and she will provide better living conditions to her family. Nato awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To begin selling used clothes

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is forty years old and a dedicated mother of three children. She is always supportive of her family. 

Her husband is a taxi driver. He has been driving a taxi for more than 15 years. The main source of income comes from driving the taxi. As they have a big family, it is very difficult for them to meet their daily expenses.  

Due to regular driving, the taxi needs to be repaired so that it drives smoothly. As the entire family depends on this single source of income, its proper maintenance is very necessary. Their current income is not sufficient enough to help them pay for the maintenance charges of the taxi. 

Therefore Shahnazz has applied for a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva partner. She is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva for helping her with the loan.

loans.use: The loan helps her husband repair his taxi

loans.name: Seema

texts.en:
Seema is the age of 37; she is the mother of two children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. 

Her elder son works in dairy products like milk, curd, and butter, for sale. He owns a small dairy farm that consists of buffalos and cows. He daily sells milk to different tea stalls. He is an honest young man. He manages his household necessities from his earnings from milk sales.  He speaks with an even tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of his clients. 

He was in need of one buffalo to increase his income through the milk sale business, so Seema asked for a loan. In this way she can support her son’s milk sale business.  She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her son's milk sale business

loans.name: Zeenat

texts.en: Zeenat is a responsible mother of five children. She is living in Rawalpindi and is 35 years old. Her husband has a construction business. He has 20 years of experience in this business. He is a hardworking person and wants to provide his family with a good standard of living. Therefore, he wants to increase his business in order to increase his income. For this purpose, his wife has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva partner. She is thankful and hopes that her husband will be able to generate more income for their family, and they would be able to educate their children well.

loans.use: To help her husband increase his construction business

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en: Mao’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Mao makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Mao to safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба родилась в 1976 году. Она вдова и одна воспитывает 2 детей. Ее дети не совершеннолетние. Они учатся в средней школе. Махбуба имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Она работает учительницей в средней школе. Она преподает младшим классам. Махбуба очень любит свою работу и старается дать максимум знаний своим ученикам. Она очень нуждается финансовой поддержке, так как ее дочь больна, и она должна купить лекарства для ее лечения. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони с такой целью. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mahbuba was born in 1976. She is a widow and raising 2 children alone. All of her children are underage. They attend a secondary school. Mahbuba has a higher pedagogical education. She works as a teacher at a secondary school. She teaches primary grades. Mahbuba loves her work very much and tries to give her students the maximum amount of knowledge. She really needs financial support because her daughter is ill, and Mahbuba needs to purchase medicine for her treatment. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1000 somoni for this goal. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase medicine for her daughter's treatment

loans.name: Kelvin

texts.en:
Kelvin is a male Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be determined. 

He operates a retail business where he sells eggs and sausages. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more eggs for sell. He hopes that in the future, he will have increased income and improved standards of living. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 19-year-old single young man from Attel, a village near Tulkarm city. he lives with his parents and 5 brothers in a small house. His father is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income is barely enough to cover all the family's needs. Ali decided to work to help his family and support them with part of their expenses.

Ali works in distributing cooking gas for the locals. It is a good business and the demand is high. 

Ali took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more gas jars for his business. By taking this loan, Ali will be able to increase his sales and also his income.

Ali appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more gas jars for his business.

loans.name: Safaniah

texts.en:
Safaniah is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be honest and intelligent. 

He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a strategic location and his primary customers are regular. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to repair his motorcycle. His business goal is to buy more motorcycles within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a comfortable business. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is married and has eight children, four of whom attend school. His major source of income is from farming, which he has been doing since 2004. He started farming to earn a steady source of income to be able to pay school fees for his children. John is a hard working man and has seen the business grow steadily. To supplement his income, he trades in cattle. His major challenge is competition from other farmers

John requested a loan for 1,500,000 UGX, which he will use to buy mulches and manure and pay labor costs. With the loan, he will be able to harvest more than the usual quantities and earn more income providing financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase mulch

loans.name: Snezana

texts.en:
Snezana lives only with her husband in a small village in one of the minority communities of Kosovo. In order to earn a living, she and her husband are involved in agriculture together, keeping cows and pigs and planting corn and wheat. This type of work is based on family and cultural tradition, and they their products in neighborhoods and markets. 

At this time, she is in need of new tools to help her and her husband to work more effectively and efficiently long term, as she has been borrowing from someone else lately. Snezana has realized how much more profit she can make with the proper tools and is eager to purchase her own now. She is confident that new tools will help her greatly. She hopes that with the additional income from her loan, she will be able to save for her future. She is very grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy new agricultural tools for long-term use.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy welding machines

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman. She has three children. She operates a retail business where she sells groceries. 

She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a strategic location and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy  more stock of groceries. She hopes that in the future, she will improve the social and economic well-being of her family. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy  more stock of groceries

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam is 32 years old and a married father of two. In order to earn a living, he is working in a gas station, but because his salary is very low, he is also involved in agricultural work. He owns and cares for cows to use the milk for selling and for his family’s consumption.  

Unfortunately at this time, he has no cows because he had to sell his for money to provide for his family. He knows that selling the dairy products is profitable and was able to make money from it, so he is requesting a loan to purchase two cows. He hopes and is confident that this loan will help to improve his financial situation, since he will be able to double his previous income selling the milk and products. 

He is very happy to have this opportunity. His goal is to be able to offer his children a better education and a better future. He is also actively seeking new employment for a larger income. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, he would like to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase two cows.

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz lives in Rawalpindi. She is married and had four children. 

Her husband owns an auto tyre shop. He has been running this business for the last ten years. He is a hardworking and honest man. He has a good reputation; that is why he is able to attract more customers. But he has figured out that he must avoid any stock-out situation or lack of availability of a certain item; he may lose customers and his earnings. 

That is why he has decided to increase his business for which he needs to buy more items. His income only covers their regular expenses and he does not have savings to increase. Therefore his wife has applied for this loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva partner, to help her husband arrange financing for his business.

loans.use: To help her husband increase his tyre shop business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy CD's, VCD's, Tigo Pesa, and M-Pesa (electronic money transfers).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional poultry

loans.name: Mwawaisha

texts.en:
Mwawaisha is a 37-year-old married woman with four children, all  attend school. Her house is without electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a home-based retail shop business. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of changing weather conditions in her business.  She wants to purchase  wheat flour, maize flour, and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. 

 Mwawaisha dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, and beans.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es: María De Jesús tiene una librería desde hace más de cinco años, en el lugar donde está ubicada es la única librería que hay y está cerca de una escuela. Y por lo mismo necesita surtir más. Esta muy feliz porque gracias a sus ingresos ha podido pagar bien su crédito y ayudando a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Solicita el crédito para la compra de resmas de hojas, y materiales de escritura.
texts.en:
María De Jesús has had a bookstore for more than five years. It is the only bookstore in the area and is near a school. Because of this she needs to stock the store more. She is very happy because thanks to her earnings she has been able to pay off her loan and help her husband with the household expenses.

She is applying for a loan to buy reams of paper and writing materials.

loans.use: to buy goods for her bookstore.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is 41 years old. She lives in the Akhmeta district with her pensioner parents and two children. 

Lia is unemployed at the moment. The family doesn't have enough income to cover all daily costs and live in a normal condition. They need some investment to satisfy even basic needs. Because of this, Lia requested a loan from local financial institutions, but was rejected several times because of her family's poor living condition. 

Finally, Lia's requested was approved within the start up program, that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. She plans to open a shop and run it. This will give her a chance to have her own stable income and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to open a shop and get income

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es: Jemny de 29 años de edad, es separada. El grupo “Dios Es Amor” está conformada por 07 mujeres trabajadoras y luchadoras que han ido mejorando con el transcurso del tiempo. Jemny se dedica a la venta de limones en un puesto de mercado. Con mucho esfuerzo y perseverancia ha logrado salir adelante e incrementar sus productos. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de limones, ajís y Kion. El deseo de Jemny  es contar con un local propio ya que hasta el momento lo viene alquilando. El grupo “Dios Es Amor” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Jemny se encuentra sentada, es la primera del lado derecho y viste polo plomo.
texts.en:
The "Dios Es Amor" (God is Love) group consists of seven hard-working and determined women, who have been improving their lives over time.

Jemny is 29 years old and separated. She makes a living selling limes at a market stall. Through great effort and perseverance, she has managed to get ahead and increase her range of products. She will use her latest loan to buy limes, chili peppers, and ginger. Jemny's wish is to own a market stall because she currently rents the one she has.

The "Dios Es Amor" group is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support.

In the photo, Jemny is the first to the far right, sitting down, and wearing a dark grey T-shirt.

loans.use: to buy limes, chili peppers, and ginger.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Chhon

texts.en:
Chhon is 38 years old, a garment worker and a married woman, living with her husband and a child in Kampong Chhnang Province of Cambodia. 

She has been a garment worker since 2008. Her husband is 49, a staff member in an organization. Her child is a student. Together, they can earn approximately $10 per day. 

Now Chhon would like to request a loan to build a bathroom. This loan will provide her and her family with hygienic living. In the future, she is going to dig a pond for feeding fish and support her child to go to university.

loans.use: to build a bathroom

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene used the previous loan to purchase clothes to sell. Irene's main sources of income are a video hall and working at Gardens Restaurant. She also sells second-hand clothes. She faces challenges of weather and seasons since her clothing business is in the open market. Irene needs a loan to buy land.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: Danie Jean

texts.en: Danie Jean is 18 years old and is living with her parents. She studies HRM in a university to gain knowledge that would help her in improving the lives of her family. She wants to become a manager someday, and with this ambition, she strives to move forward despite hardships in life. Danie Jean considers it a challenge to pursue her studies. In the future, she wants to become a successful person who can make things happen.

loans.use: to pay her school tuition fees

loans.name: Jose Willian

texts.es:
José, es un agricultor que disfruta trabajar en el campo, cultivando granos básicos así como también tiene una pequeña ganadería de esta manera genera ingresos para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, en su tiempo libre ofrece el servicio de transporte en su vehículo, estas actividades las realiza desde niño, su horario es de seis de la mañana a dos de la tarde; José, es acompañado, aun no tienen hijos, vive en casa familiar con su compañera de vida, su madre y un hermano.
Está solicitando un financiamiento para comprar cerdos, de esta manera ampliara su negocio, José ya cuenta con corrales en buen estado para iniciar la crianza de cerdos, espera tener una mejor situación económica con la que dé a su familia un mejor estilo de vida e ir cancelando su deuda puntualmente.
Su deseo es tener el recurso económico para comprar un nuevo vehículo y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en: José is a farmer who enjoys working in the field growing basic grains, he also has some livestock. In this way he generates income to cover the basic household necessities. In his free time, he offers transportation services with his vehicle. He has done this since he was a boy. His schedule is from 6 A.M. to 2 P.M.. José is accompanied, even though he doesn't have children, by his wife and lives in a house with his mom and brother. He is requesting financing to buy pigs and in this way increase his business. He already has corrals in good shape to begin raising pigs. He hopes to have a better economic situation with which to give his family a better quality of life and pay his debts punctually. His desire is to have the resources to buy a new vehicle and provide better service to his clients.

loans.use: to buy pigs and in this manner grow his business.

loans.name: Lidia Hortensia

texts.es: A sus 50 años de edad Lidia es soltera y tiene 6 hijas de las cuales 4 aun viven con ella y están estudiando  solo los fines de semana y 2 de ellas ya son independientes, Lidia trabaja en una casa de empleada domestica desde la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde y después de eso se dedica a cuidar una vaca que tiene en la actualidad, con el dinero del crédito va a comprar otra vaca  para mejorar sus ingresos mediante el ordeño, mientras Lidia se encuentra en su trabajo son sus hijas quienes le dan sacando la leche de sus vacas, la aspiración más grande de Lidia  es que sus hijas lleguen a ser profesionales y lleguen a tener un buen trabajo que les permita mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en: Lidia, at age 50, is single and has six daughters, four of whom still live at home and attend school on the weekends.  The other two are on their own now.  Lidia works as a domestic employee from morning until 3:00 pm and then cares for a cow that she has.  She will use the money from this loan to buy another cow so she can improve her income from milking it.  Her daughters milk the cow while Lidia is at work.  Her greatest aspiration is for her daughters to become professionals and have good jobs that will allow them to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle to raise.

loans.name: Grupo Las Maxeñas 1 Group

texts.es:
Candelaria tiene 48 años de edad residente en Suchitepéquez, tiene cinco hijos por quienes tiene que realizar un enorme esfuerzo diario a diario para poder satisfacer las necesidades de su familia. Los primeros tres hijos ya tienen familias apartes y los dos últimos  son excelentes estudiantes en la escuela que les queda cerca de la comunidad. (Ella es la que se encuentra en medio del grupo)
La actividad que el realiza es la venta de pescado y camarones ella viene realizando dicha actividad durante 8 años lo cual le generan ganancias y ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia, la segunda actividad que ella realiza es la venta de pollo por los alrededores de su comunidad.
El uso respectivo que ella le dará al crédito es para la compra de pescado y camarones para  luego venderlas por los alrededores y en el mercado de su comunidad, para ella es una muy buena fuente de ingresos económicos porque por medio de ello a mejorado la condiciones de vidas de su familia.
Ella es un buen ejemplo a seguir en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se a reunida a Candelaria para emprender juntas el negocio que si genera muy buena ganancia para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familias.
Uno de las más grandes aspiraciones de ella es poner un depósito de pescado y de pollo en la comunidad donde ella vive y dar estudios a sus hijos y que se conviertan en profesionales en un futuro.
texts.en:
Candelaria is 48 years old and lives in Suchitepéquez. She has five children for whom she exerts enormous effort daily in order to satisfy her family's needs. Her eldest three already have their own families on their own and the two youngest are excellent students in the school near their community.
(She is pictured in the center.)

She sells fish and shrimp and has done so for 8 years; earnings generated from the sales support her family. The second job is to sell chicken around her community.

She will use the loan specifically to buy fish and shrimp to then sell around the community and in the community market. This is a good source of income for her because doing this has improved her family's condition and lives. 

She is a good role model in her community and for this reason a group of women has attached themselves to Candelaria to start business together that generates good income to improve the livelihood of their families.

One of her biggest aspirations is to establish a fish and chicken shop in the community she lives in and give her children an education so that they may be professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish and shrimp

loans.name: Enock

texts.en: Enock is a new borrower, 45 years old and a resident of Kitojo Ntungamo district. He is married and has eight children.  His wife is a teacher and earns little. The fact that he has many children who are all in school means that he is faced with the problem of paying their tuition. So he has to juggle many businesses to ensure that he makes enough money to meet their needs. He is therefore applying for a loan to buy some cows that he will sell at a profit and also use part of the money to pay tuition for his daughter at the university in Mbarara.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Mpipi Group

texts.en:
Seleman  is in his late 40s and is a hard-working married man with one daughter.  She attends school. 

 He has sold charcoal for seven years and works from 6am to 7pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Seleman's 23rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy sand,  equipment, and  charcoal.   He is very happy with the loan.  He has successfully repaid his loans and used the profit to pay school fees, buy a  plot of land, and cover household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy bulk quantities of charcoal to resell.  He dream is to build a house.

Seleman will share this loan with his loan group "Mpipi" which has three members who hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy bulk quantities of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Samol

texts.en: Samol is 43 years old, a garment worker, and a married woman with three children. She has been in this job since 2006. One of her children is also a garment worker. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. They all live in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. They can earn approximately $25.70.   Samol would like to request a loan to buy wood and zinc sheets to build a new house. This loan will help her and her family have a new house to live in.  In the future, she is going to open a small shop for designing clothes and support her children to go to university.

loans.use: to buy wood and zinc sheets to build a new house

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 58 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, reside en el caserío Pampa de los Silvas en casa propia junto a con toda su familia. La población de la comunidad se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería en general.

La actividad a la que se dedica Pedro es a la venta de ganado menor como cabritos, ovejas entre otros, esta actividad la realiza hace más de 5 años contando con experiencia en el negocio, sus ventas las realiza en mismo domicilio y alrededores de su comunidad. Pedro tiene muy buenas referencias personales y crediticias. Él solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de ganado menor y posterior engorde, el dinero restante será para unificar deudas de Caja Piura, y trabajar exclusivamente con nosotros; lo que le va a permitir organizar sus gastos ya que sus ingresos aumentarán y por ende sus ganancias también lo que hará que su calidad de vida y la de su familia mejore.
texts.en:
Pedro is 68 years old and is cohabiting. He lives in the village of Pampa de los Silvas in his own house with all of his family. The local population works in agriculture and livestock in general.

Pedro works selling small livestock such as baby goats and sheep, among others. He has been doing this for more than 5 years so has experience in the business. He carries out his sales at his home and in the surrounding area of his community. Pedro has very good personal and credit references. 

He is applying for the loan to invest in the purchase of small livestock and the subsequent fattening of these. The remainder of the money will be used to consolidate his debts from Caja Piura so that he can work exclusively with Kiva partners. This will allow him to organize his finances as his profits and earnings will increase, meaning that his own and his family's quality of life will improve.

loans.use: to buy small livestock and to consolidate his debts from Caja Piura so he can work exclusively with Kiva partners.

loans.name: Ega

texts.en:
Ega appreciates the previous loan that helped her expand her business.  Ega prepares goat meat and soup using goat heads and legs and sells it to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the KSHS 35,000, she wants to purchase more goats for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business

loans.name: Tarasila

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Tarasila, a very hardworking mother who is 62 years of age. She is a small holder farmer from Mburi, a remote village in the fertile Kerugoya area of Kenya. This charming mother of five has been engaged in mixed farming for the past 41 years. She commands a lot of respect from fellow farmers in her village. Her main source of income has been eggs, milk, tea, and a variety of food crops that she plants. 

Taking care of her poultry is an activity she finds very enjoyable. Feeding her poultry is her hobby. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in Kerugoya. Tarasila has good knowledge of the market and has been taking advantage of the ready market. However, the demand is so high. Being a visionary woman, she has always wanted to increase her poultry. She is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. 

Accessing financial services for women is very difficult, but through institutions such as Kiva, enterprising women like Tarasila will achieve their dreams and goals. Tarasila believes that the key to increased egg production is proper feeding of poultry and taking good care of them. By ensuring that the poultry are fed well, she is guaranteed to reap the benefits. In addition to selling eggs and poultry meat, she will also sell poultry feathers that are commonly used to make earrings. The increased income will be used to improve her living conditions and to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married Ugandan man with two children. He lives in Kagadi, where he sells produce to earn a living for his family. He is also a farmer. Through hard work, he desires to educate his children. Due to insufficient funds for his business activities, John is asking for a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start horticulture farming

loans.name: Maranatha Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARANATHA” iniciará el décimo quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sandra es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de medias, venta de ropa interior, servicio de transporte, venta de lubricantes, venta de ropa, venta de comida, venta de polleras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sandra es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra a Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace dos años con el primer crédito obtenido en Pro Mujer.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención que le brinda el personal de la institución.
texts.en:
The “MARANATHA” communal bank is beginning its fifteenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Exaltación regional hub. The group consists of eight members and is led by a board of directors, with Sandra as secretary. 

The members of the communal bank run a variety of businesses, including selling stockings, selling underwear, providing transportation services, selling lubricants, selling clothes, selling food, and selling traditional Andean skirts.

The loan that the group will take out will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs, one of whom is Sandra. She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago and that she became a member at the invitation of an outreach officer from the institution who went to visit her at her home. Currently, Sandra has a business selling clothes; she mentions that she learned the business two years ago, with the first loan received through Pro Mujer.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital to purchase clothes wholesale, which she will acquire from the wholesale vendors from the city of El Alto. She will then sell the items at her retail space. This type of work allows her to generate the means to support her family, as she lives in a common-law marriage and has two children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the support provided by the staff of the institution.

The children of three group members are also pictured in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase clothes wholesale.

loans.name: 14 De Enero Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “14 DE ENERO” iniciará el cuarto tercer en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Guayaramerin, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sintia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: panadería, venta de ropa, venta de comida, venta de abarrotes.

Después de la inundación que hubo en Guayaramerin muchas microempresarias fueron afectadas, ya que perdieron gran parte de su mercadería y sus herramientas de trabajo. La señora Sintia  indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución; Ella cuenta que después de este desastre natural, que afecto a su familia,  ella decidió retomar su actividad económica, ya que es su única fuente de producción; el negocio que tiene es la venta de ropa, da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace tres años en su domicilio iniciando como un hobby, ya que podía hablar con sus amigas y vender sus productos, con el pasar del tiempo se convirtió en su fuente de sustento económico. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de Santa Cruz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su negocio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el apoyo y el cuidado de su salud y de su familia que le ofrece la institución para restablecer su negocio con los consultorios médicos.
texts.en:
The communal group January 14th  will begin its fourth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the regional center of Guayaremerin.  The group has eight members and is directed by a committee, whose president is Sintia.  The members of the association run various businesses, among these a bakery, and sales of clothing, food and groceries.  

The flood that took place in Guayaramerin affected many small businesses, since they lost much of their merchandise and tools of trade.  Sintia says that she joined Pro Mujer four years ago, invited by a friend who is a customer of the organization.  After the natural disaster struck her family, she decided to return to her work, since this was her own way to contribute financially.  Her business is selling clothing.  Sintia wants it known that she began this business three years ago in her home, first as a hobby, since she could talk with her girl friends ad sell things.  With time it became her means of financial support.  

The loan she is taking out now is to increase her capital goods  through a purchase of clothing wholesale.  She will buy from the wholesalers in the city of Santa Cruz and then sell the clothes in her business.  This form of work allows her to generate income to support her family since she lives with her partner and has two children.   When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Sintia answers that she likes the help  in rebuilding her business and the care for her  and  her family's health offered through the doctors' offices.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wax pagnes to sell.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a widow with seven children, four attend school.  

She has had a door-to-door used clothing business for many years.  She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy quantities of used clothing. She sells African attire to acquire additional income. She sells on retail basis six days every week.  Her major business challenges include changing seasons and theft.  

She wishes to own a permanent business premise, buy  plot of land, and build a house. She resides in a rented house with  access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy quantities of used clothes.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en: Vicent, a married man, operates a mini depot, owns rentals and practices farming in Kagadi, Uganda.  He hopes to boost his business despite increased accident rates due to poor roads causing losses. He is hard working and intends to use a loan to buy beer and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy beers and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a married woman, aged 37, living in Kagadi, Uganda, where she operates a retail shop alongside farming to generate income to support her family. However, she is challenged by price fluctuations hindering her returns.  Through hard work, she hopes to grow her business to higher profits. Ruth is asking for a loan to buy stock of salt, sugar and soap for selling.

loans.use: to buy stock of salt, sugar and soap for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Acram

texts.en:
Acram is a 28-year-old married man with four children.  He  lives with his family in Haja, Yemen.  

He is a very talented and responsible professional young man. In recent times, Acram's family had a financial crisis and Acram decided to work in order to look after his family. He began with a small amount of capital and purchased lambs to sell for their meat. Over time, his business has grown. He has been a butcher for 8 years.  

 Acram applied for a youth loan of 200, 000 YER from AMB to purchase lambs and bulls for his butcher shop. 

Acram looks forward to expanding in his business. He hopes to open a savings account in AMB.

loans.use: to purchase lambs and bulls to slaughter and sell their meat.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en: This is Winfred. She is a final year student at the Kenya Medical Training College studying towards a Diploma in Community Nutrition. Winfred hopes to use the skills she will get after graduation from her program in helping her community. She comes from a humble background and a loan from Kiva will enable her pay for tuition fees in her final year to complete her education.

loans.use: to pay for school fees at the Kenya Medical Training College

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en: Vannak is 32 years old, a grocer and a married woman with three children. All of her children are students. Her husband is a commune clerk. They live in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. They can earn approximately $12 per day. Now Vannak would like to request a loan to buy more groceries to resell. This loan will help her earn more income. In the future, she is going to keep expanding her business, renovate her house and support her children to go to university.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to resell

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александру — 31 год, он живет в с. Водяное.  В свое время он работал на АЭС, зарплаты не хватало, решил заниматься исключительно огородом. Начал с двух теплиц, которые взял у родителей жены, выращивал там помидоры. За 6 лет развились, накопили на свой дом. В прошлом году купили дом и построили на участке 3 большие теплицы, провели отопление. В этом году Александр купил котел мощнее, старый перенес на участок родителей. На данный момент Александр занимается выращиванием овощей на собственном участке земли уже 10 лет. Имеет пять больших отапливаемых теплиц. Работает на двух участках земли — один свой, а второй отдали родители. Александр выращивает в основном помидоры и огурцы. 
На сумму в 30 000 гривен Александр хочет докупить удобрения на второй урожай, отремонтировать теплицу, купить пленку на теплицы и выплатить зарплату своим рабочим. Со временем Александр хочет расширять бизнес и строить еще теплицы. В ближайшем будущем планирует построить две дополнительные теплицы.  Александр — активный, трудолюбивый, любит всего добиваться сам.
texts.en:
Alexander is 31 years old and lives in the Vodyanoye village. At one point in time, he worked at a nuclear plant, but the salary was low, and he decided to be exclusively involved in farming. He started with two greenhouses that he got from his wife's parents and grew tomatoes there. The business grew in 6 years, and they saved enough to buy a house. They bought a house last year and built 3 large greenhouses on their land and installed heating for them. This year, Alexander bought a more powerful boiler and moved the old one to his parents land. To-date, Alexander has been involved in growing vegetables on his own land for 10 years. He has five heated greenhouses. He works on plots of land - his and a second one given by his parents. Alexander primarily grows tomatoes and cucumbers.

Alexander wants to use the sum of 30 000 hryvnia to buy fertilizers for the second crop, repair a greenhouse, buy plastic for greenhouses and pay a salary to his workers. With time, Alexander wants to expand his business and build more greenhouses. In the near future, he plans to build two additional greenhouses. Alexander is active, hardworking and loves to achieve everything on his own.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the second crop, repair a greenhouse, buy plastic for greenhouses and pay a salary to his workers

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 23-year-old married man who  established his own electricity providing services station in his region 9 years ago. Lebanon citizens face major electricity problems. Hussein is a responsible person and works hard to provide his neighbors and customers with the requested services in a well managed way.

He has a power generator which he maintains through regular scheduled maintenance. His business is in high demand because of the problem local people face with the supply of electricity.

Hussein increased his income and became capable of covering his family’s expenses and living needs.   He is acquiring a YOUTH Loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to develop his business and buy  spare parts, cables, and necessary requested accessories to expand his work  and satisfy more customers.

He hopes to keep on developing and expanding his business in a well managed way.  He wants the business to be sustainable and provide a good income.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts, cables, and necessary requested accessories.

loans.name: Qaryagdi

texts.en:
Qaryagdi  is a 36-year-old married man with 2 children. He  is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar region. His wife is a homemaker who cares for the children.  Qaryagdi  and his wife love their children very much and they try to provide for them  because they want their children to have a good upbringing. 

Their income is not sufficient to meet all of the family's needs so Qaryagdi started a business as a home-repair handyman.  Qaryagdi  and his wife want to make repairs to their home so they can improve their living conditions, but they don't have enough money for this project. He applied to Aqroinvest CU for a loan to buy building materials to repair his home. He is hoping for positive results and thanks Kiva in advance for the support

loans.use: to buy building materials to repair his home.

loans.name: Sokny's Group

texts.en: Sokny’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sokny makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work trading groceries to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Than's Group

texts.en: Than’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Than makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Mary. She is a very humble smallholder farmer with big ambitions. She hails from a small village in Karumandi, which is in the central parts of Kenya. For the last 25 years, the mother of two has been doing mixed-farming on a small piece of land she owns. With time, she grew very passionate about dairy cattle farming and horticulture. For a living, she sells milk and tea among other varieties of crops and flowers from her farm. She also diversified into a small business that deals with offering transportation services. 
Mary is seeking a loan for two things: to purchase a hybrid dairy cow and to construct a dairy shed. She loves raising cows. However, over the years the biggest challenge for farmers has been diseases. For this reason, most rural farmers would rather keep traditional breeds that are resistant despite being way less productive.  Traditional breed is simply not an option for progressive farmers like Mary. 
With your loan, Mary is going to buy a high quality breed that is very productive.  To curb diseases, she is going to tighten her belt as far as dairy management in the farm is concerned.  An efficient management of cattle will be incomplete without a well-planned and adequate housing of cattle. The new durable cattle shed shall provide comfortable accommodation for the cattle with proper sanitation and good arrangement for the production of clean milk under convenient and economic conditions. The cattle will have constant access to feed and an abundant supply of fresh, clean water.

Juhudi Kilimo, rural farmers’ microfinance, believes in innovation and transformation. We hope the cowshed will protect Mary’s cattle from weather, improve hygiene and provide an environmentally efficient method of recycling stock effluent, saving her the cost of artificial fertilizer, money which she could use to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and construct a dairy cattle shelter

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en:
Hanaa is a 51-year-old married mother of four. She has been working in the art business for nineteen years.

Hanaa is involved in many areas: she has nine years of experience as a teacher in the Association for the Handicapped, where she taught Arabic language and mathematics. Her main business now is in mosaic and faux-bijoux handicraft work.  Her husband, a blacksmith, works to earn daily wages and has a fluctuating income. Hanaa benefited from four loans from Al Majmoua to develop her business and cover her children's education expenses. Her current loan will be invested in paying her children's requested education expenses.

Hanaa is very satisfied with what she has learned and accomplished. She feels more confident as she proves herself by participating more and more in the budget and decision-making of her family.  Just like her previous loan, Hanna is acquiring a forth loan cycle from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to pay for her children's education expenses.  She hopes to stay capable of providing her children with the best education to provide them with a brighter future.

loans.use: To  pay for her children's education expenses.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married with seven children, two attend school.  She also takes care of additional family members (grandson). 

She has had  a business to sell charcoal  for 9 years and works from home seven days each week.  She wishes to becoming a wholesaler and to buy iron sheets to roof her rental houses.  She generates additional income sellimg onions and green banana fingers. 

She has applied for a loan of 2,400,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas.     She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because she wanted additional capital for her business. She resides in the family house which  has access to electricity and   piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Emlen

texts.en: Emlen studied in the university in order to make her ambition of becoming a policewoman someday. She is still single and lives with her family. She always wants her parents to become proud of her in the future. She has three siblings and still needs her parents' support. To help with school expenses, she joined GDMPC and took a loan to pay her school tuition fee for the first semester. She is hopeful enough to make her dreams come true and enable her to support her family .

loans.use: to pay her school tuition fee for the first semester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: June Ximon

texts.en: June Ximon is single and lives with his family. He is a very dedicated son who wants to become successful in the future. He is studying at a university in order to fulfill his dreams. His parents are business-minded and make money in the market. He needs financial assistance  to pay tuition fees. With his GDMPC education loan, he will  hopefully be able to continue.  in the future, he hopes to find a better job according to his desires.

loans.use: to pay his school tuition fees

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Gemma works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming rice. Gemma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested this additional loan to further build her business.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is  married and has three children, all attend school. She owns a house without electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees, and clothing.

For the past four years, she has operated an open-air food business to sell to her neighbors and students at the  neighboring school.She also farms to earn additional income. She faces a major challenge of weather conditions especially during the rainy season. She dreams of establishing a retail shop and a café.

She will use the loan to purchase wheat flour, cooking fat oil, salt, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, cooking fat oil, salt and sugar.

loans.name: Natia

texts.en: Natia is 29-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, two children, and pensioner grandmother in Chiatura district. Natia is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she has a cow and produces cheese to sell locally. As the income is not enough for a five member family, she decided to seek additional income and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan to start a trading business. With the received credit, Natia will purchase a stock of fruits and vegetables and will start trading. This will enable her to get additional income and improve the living conditions of her family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Darwin Otoniel

texts.es:
Darwin, vive con sus padres y tres de sus hermanos; con un hermano aprendió a administrar una tienda de productos de la canasta básica y se independizo hace 2 años, desde entonces se dedica a atender su negocio para contar con ingresos que utiliza para cubrir sus gastos personales y apoyar económicamente a sus padres.
Invertirá en la compra de  dulces, pan, galletas, productos de uso personal, bebidas, jabón, etc., le será de  ayuda  para atraer a nuevos clientes, mejorar su inventario, aumentar ventas y ganancias, las cuales le servirán de respaldo para el pago de sus cuotas y mantener el apoyo a sus padres.
Su visión es tener los recursos económicos suficientes para comprar un molino nixtamal y de esta manera tener nuevos ingresos.
texts.en: Darwin lives with his parents and three of his siblings. With one brother he learned how to manage a store that sells basic groceries.  He became independent two years ago and since then he has been tending his business and counting on the income to cover his personal expenses and economically support his parents. He will invest in the purchase of sweets, bread, cookies, personal products, drinks, soap, etc. which will help him attract new clients, improve his inventory, and increase sales and earnings. The earnings will serve as support to make his payments and for his parents. His vision is to have sufficient economic resources to buy a cornmeal grinder and have a new income source.

loans.use: to buy sweets, bread, cookies, personal products, drinks, soap, etc. to help him attract new clients.

loans.name: Wisam

texts.en:
Wisam is a 20 year-old single young man from a village near Tulkarm city.  He lives with his parents in a small house. His father works as an employee with a low wage. 
Wisam is a student in his second year.  He studies mechanical engineering.   He would like to complete his studies and find a job in the future.
Wisam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies.   By taking this loan, Wisam will be able to do his home work and write the reports easily.
Wisam appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, three of whom go to school. She operates a beauty salon in the market. She has been in this business for three years. She takes care of additional family members. She works for seven days a week. She has requested a loan of UGX 200,000 to buy weaves, braids, hair relaxers, rollers and treatments. Her major challenge is electricity black outs that hinder her work. Her goal and aspirations is to get more hair dryers so as to serve her customers better. She lives in rented house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy braids, weaves, shampoo, relaxers

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is a 38-year-old vigorous lady who lives in a populated area of Lahore, Pakistan along with her spouse and five children.
Her husband sells gravestones in a marble market. He also marks inscriptions in various languages on gravestones. His forefathers have been doing the same work for many years. He is very expert in his art and wants to teach these techniques to his son. 
He has been marking inscriptions over white marble for many years and now he wants to buy various colors of marble stone so he can easily attract his customers. But due to a lack of funds, he is unable to make this purchase. 
Therefore, Uzma has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner to support her husband. He will buy gravestones of desired colors and sizes for inscription and then sell them. She hopes that her husband would be able to generate more income than before.
Uzma is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan for their generous support.

loans.use: To buy gravestones for inscription and then selling them.

loans.name: Magaret

texts.en: Magaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, two of whom go to school. She takes care of additional family members (brother's daughter). She operates a kiosk at the market. She sells to all kinds of people on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 12 years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of UGX 200,000 to buy trays of eggs, sweets, biscuits, cooking oil and other kinds of juice. Her major challenge includes high transportation costs and electricity which increases the operational costs. Her goal is to buy a plot of land and also to own a fully stocked kiosk .She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy a tray of eggs, sweets, biscuits and other snacks

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
To make a living, Flora manages her own general store in her village while her husband does farming. With their generated income, her previous loan was used for buying additional goods to sell and was successfully repaid. Improving her business is now easier with her access to GDMPC. Recently, she took a new loan to buy more goods to sell. 
She wants to sustain and improve the business to ensure a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Marvelyn

texts.en: Marvelyn is a very dedicated daughter who wants to become successful in the future. She has studied courses in a university. Her parents work as farmers earning from their own farm.  She needs financial assistance to make it possible for her to pay her school tuition fees for the first semester. She took a loan from GDMPC, and she hopes to find a good job according to her desire. She wants to go abroad and have a better job for her future.

loans.use: to pay her school tuition fees for the first semester

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a married man who has six children. He describes himself as successful. He operates a business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are the general public. He will use the KES 75,000 loan to buy a 10,000-litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use, especially during the dry season. His business goal is to have more motorcycles within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will own a taxi and that he will be successful. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a 10,000 litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use

loans.name: Erlina

texts.en: Erlina lives in Camanga, Tukuran, with her family.  She has four children and is happy working on their farm with her husband. She used her previous loan from GDMPC for her farm improvement and it was repaid successfully.  She took a new loan recently to purchase fertilizer to be used for this cropping season. She hopes to have a better income from her farm and be able to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married mother of five children. She describes herself as optimistic. She operates a farm where she keeps cows which produce milk. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a semi-urban area. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy a calf. Her business goal is to be a supplier of milk within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will succeed. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a married father of six children, ages 1 to 14 years. He describes himself as honest. He operates a farm where he does fish farming. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fingerlings. His business goal is to have more fish ponds within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially independent. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy fingerlings for his fish farm

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel was born in Nyeri and moved to Nairobi in search of employment. He got a job at an open-air mechanic shop near one of Nairobi's informal settlements. As the days went by, he noticed that there were no toilets at his work site. He thought it would be a good business idea to invest in a Fresh Life franchise when he heard about the model. He seeks a loan to help him purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets at his work site. He hopes that the toilets will help improve the standards of cleanliness in the area and create a more comfortable working environment. Income generated from the franchise will be used to repay his loan and improve his standard of living. He also hopes to see more such facilities installed in the area.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Meet Lydia, 45, a smallholder farmer in Kerugoya, which is a small rural area in central Kenya. She has 3 children. For the last 7 years, she has been doing mixed farming. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, and other crops.

She states that she finds dairy goat farming and horticulture to be the most enjoyable farming activities. The biggest challenge, however, is the prevailing animal and crop diseases in the region.

Lydia is seeking a loan to purchase farm implements and some dairy goats. The additional goats will boost the milk production volume of her farm. The new farm implements will help Lydia till, plant, cultivate and harvest crops, significantly reducing the time she spends to accomplish farm tasks. In addition, it will decrease her need for farm workers. She will be able to use the money she would otherwise pay in salaries to purchase and maintain the farm equipment.

Additional income earned as a result of these developments will go to her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase farm implements and goats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three computers and printing paper.

loans.name: Abbos

texts.ru:
Аббос энергичный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 42 лет. Он женат и имеет четверых детей. Живёт он со своей семьёй в небольшой посёлке. Семья у него большая и он очень любит своих детей и старается много работать, чтобы их обеспечивать. Жена Аббоса является домохозяйкой, она занимается воспитанием детей и домашними делами.

Аббос занимается своим бизнесом для получения дохода и обеспечения своей семьи всем необходимым. У него имеется собственный бильярдный зал, куда приходят клиенты чтобы поиграть в бильярд. От этого бизнеса он получает хорошую прибыль. Сейчас Аббос хочет  расширить зал и установить больше бильярдных столов и другого оборудования. Для этого он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит, чтобы закупить оборудование для своего бильярдного зала. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Abbos is an energetic and hardworking 42-year-old man. He is married and has four children. He lives with his family in a small village. He has a big family and loves his children very much, and tries to work a lot to support them. Abbos's wife is a homemaker, involved in raising children and household work. 

Abbos is involved in his own business to have an income and provide his family with all of the necessities. He owns a billiard hall, where customers come to play billiard. He earns a good profit from this business. Now Abbos wants to expand his hall and install more billiard tables and other equipment. He came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to buy equipment for his billiard hall. He thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy tables and other equipment for his billiard hall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Hadijah

texts.en:
Hadijah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children; all go to school. She has no additional family members. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

Hadijah sells used clothes at the market, working seven days a week. She sells to all kinds of people on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last two years. Hadijah has requested a loan of UGX 200,000 to buy a bale of used clothes.

Hadijah's major business challenge is the high cost of transportation, which increases her operational costs. Her goal and aspirations are to increase her capital base so that she can serve her customers better.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Lorie

texts.en:
Lorie lives in Zamboanga del Sur with her six children. She used to operate their farm together with her family. She successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming from their generated income. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Recently, she took a new loan to finance farm cultivation and fertilization costs for this planting season. In the future, she wants to ensure a better source of income for her family.

loans.use: to finance farm cultivation and fertilization costs

loans.name: Jose Santana

texts.es:
José de 66 años de edad, estudio hasta 3º año de bachillerato,su esposa trabaja de profesora en una escuela cercana.

José  es jubilado, ahora recibe pensión y mas ingresos de unas habitaciones que alquila.

 El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar lamina y ponerla a todo el techo ya que cuando no esta,seria posible que le lleven sus cosas tanto que le han costado, que las ha comprado con sacrificio por su arduo trabajo.

José tiene como objetivo arreglar bien su casa, el préstamo le ayudara para cubrir la emergencia que tiene hasta este momento.
texts.en:
José is 66 years old and has three years of college. His wife is a teacher in a nearby school. José is retired and receives pension and earnings from some rooms that he rents.

He requests a loan to purchase sheet metal to place on his ceiling. In its absence, it is possible that his things can be taken, and they've cost so much since he has bought them with sacrifice from his hard work.

José's goal is to fix his home. The loan will help cover the urgent need that he has at the moment.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal and place it on the room since in its absence their things can be taken and they've cost so much

loans.name: Ringshot Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Pachoicham, a 52-year-old woman, spent most of her life selling vegetables. She enjoyed her work and feels the joy of serving her customers every day with varieties of seasonal vegetables including cabbage, mustard leaves, cauliflower, peas, beans, ginger, onions, etc. She is the featured borrower of the group, and is shown with her hand raised. 

By engaging in this occupation, she supports her children and sends them to college. She never feels discouraged by the loss and profits she has made every day for the past 15 to 20 years, and continues to be self-reliant. She has been in this business since her husband passed away 15 years ago. Being a widow and jobless does not narrow her mind to raise her six children alone and give them education. She has been giving her best to educate her children despite the hardship she faced, and feels content with her life. 

The village they dwell in does not have a public transport system. She carries the stock of vegetables in a sack on her back and walks to the main market for selling early in the morning.
