As soon as she finishes selling, she rushes home, spending her time to collect and prepare varieties of vegetables for the next day. There is no proper power supply in her village, which is the reason for availing the solar energy loan. With much difficulty, she used to arrange her vegetables in a candlelit room, since she had bad eyesight. After availing the loan, she can arrange her vegetables in the evening with better sight and prepare them to sell the next morning. She arranges the vegetables in small bundles and ties them together with equal portions so that they will be easier to sell in the market. 

She is grateful to WSDS for breaking the barrier between her bad eyesight in dim light and her business by lending the solar house lighting system. Now she comfortably arranges her vegetables after sunset.

loans.use: to buy a mini solar home lighting system.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a single mother of three children and all her children go to school. She does not take care of additional family members. She has a beauty salon and has been in this business for 6 years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids, weaves and other cosmetics. She generates additional income from selling used clothes and also from hiring out her motorcycle.  She works at the market six days out of every week and sells on retail basis. Her major business challenges include thieves, on and off electricity and ever increasing prices of cosmetics in Uganda. She aspires to own a fully stocked beauty salon and also to buy a plot of land and build a house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy cream relaxers, braids, weaves and other cosmetics for her beauty salon

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a 48-year-old married woman with nine children, five of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Eva has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Eva requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like fabric and threads for her business.

Eva has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Eva would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fabric and threads for her business

loans.name: Karisa

texts.en:
Karisa is a married man with eight children, six of whom attend school. he owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past four years, he has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) transport business, where his potential customers are town dwellers and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during rainy season it becomes hard to operate. His dream is to purchase another motorcycle in the near future.

With the Kshs 10,000 he wants to service his motorcycle and purchase new spare parts. He decided to join Yehu because they offer affordable interest rates.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle and purchase new spare parts

loans.name: Dena

texts.en:
Dena is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, Dena has operated a business selling soft drinks / fruit juice from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces challenges of seasonality and the high cost of transporting raw materials. 

Dena decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits (mangoes and passion fruits) for making fruit juice for sale.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits (mangoes and passion fruits) for making fruit juice for sale

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is married with five children, all of whom go to school. She doesn't take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling Airtime and has been in this business for 2 years. She has applied for a loan of 800,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more Airtime. She also generates additional income from selling soft drinks. She sells both retail and wholesale basis seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. She aspires to own a fully stocked phone accessories shop and also to build her own shop. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy Airtime and crates of soda

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru:
Шахноза животновод, проживающий в районе Дж.Расулова города Худжанд. Она занимается разведением коров, быков, коз и овец на протяжении 6 лет. Муж Шахнозы занимается предоставлением услуги по стройке домов. Он также помогает жене в купле и продаже скотов. 
Шахнозе 31 год. Она целеустремленная и решительная женщина. Сейчас она хочет увеличить поголовье скота. Так как в ее хозяйстве в данный момент имеется корова с теленком, она хотела бы на сумму кредита закупить мелкорогатый скот, откармливать их в течение 3-4 месяцев и затем продать по прибыльной цене. Она надеется на кредит, благодаря которому реализует свою цель.
texts.en: Shahnoza is an animal husbandrist living in the city of Khujand of the J. Rasulov district. She has been involved in raising cows, bulls and sheep for 6 years. Shahnoza's husband is involved in providing housing construction services. He also helps his wife with reselling livestock. Shahnoza is 31 years old. She is a goal-oriented and decisive woman. Now she wants to increase her livestock headcount. Because her farm currently has a cow with a calf, she wants to use this loan to buy small livestock, fatten it up for 3-4 months and then resell it at a profitable price. She hopes for the loan, thanks to which she would be able to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to buy small livestock

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. Lydia owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Lydia sells charcoal from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business. With this loan of Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale. Lydia decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James, 56, is a diligent farmer based at Kerugoya region of Kenya. James has been able to sustain the livelihood of his family of two children for the last five years by selling milk, eggs, tea, and other crops produced from his farm.

Many farmers are just like James in Kerugoya; they practice mixed farming. Most of their problems are with crop farming. They take too much time to accomplish their tasks. They also need a lot of effort and labour to plough and cultivate land. Machinery and equipment come in handy to reduce all sorts of costs. 
James is seeking a loan to purchase farm implements. Old or poor farm implements usually result in high costs and poor quality of work. This is a clear recipe for losses. 

To resolve this issue, he joined a group named Kabuit Elder in order to access Juhudi Kilimo’s agricultural loans. Juhudi offers loans to individual farmers in a group whose members share a strong bond of solidarity. 
Your loan contribution will enable James to afford proper farm implements necessary for quality work output on the farm. With the increased yields, he will comfortably afford his children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase farm equipment.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero, sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa familiar, en una zona rural del distrito de Oyutún, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Julio tiene su peluqueria en la cual brinda el servicio de corte de cabello, ondulacioens, entre otros, el brinda este servicio hace ya 9 años, su peluqueria se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, y solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo ya que desea comprar de tintes, esmaltes, ligas, carmines, para darle un valor agregado a su servicio, y de esta manera poder captar un número mayor de clientes, y asi lograr que sus ingresos aumenten, su ganancias crezcan y por ende su calidad de vida mejore.
texts.en:
Julio is 29 years old, single, without children in his care. He lives in a family house in a rural zone of the district of Oyutún, province of Chiclayo, region of Lambayeque, north coast of Peru.

Julio has a hair salon in which he offers the service of hair cuts, perms, among others. He has offered this service for 9 years now. His salon is located in his home, and he asks for this loan for work capital, considering that he wants to buy dyes, nail polish, hair ties, lipsticks, to add an added value to his service, and in this way he can gain a higher number of clients. In this way, he will be able to increase his income, his earnings will grow, and therefore his quality of life may improve.

loans.use: to buy dye, nail polish, hair ties, lipstick to give an added value to his service

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Monica sells charcoal from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business. With this loan of Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Last year, Ali applied for a youth loan which was given by Kiva lenders to purchase some construction materials to renovate his house. The house where Ali lives with his family is very old. It needs to a lot of money to complete all its renovation. Ali is very thankful for Kiva lenders for their first loan which helped him very much to complete the first stage of the renovation. Ali didn't complete the repayment of the installments of the first loan and applied for a current youth loan of 450,000 YER from Kiva lenders to complete the renovation of the rest of the house through purchasing construction materials such as cement, bricks, iron steel, and other materials which he needs to finish the renovation.

Ali hopes to be financed in this loan.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks, iron steel, and other materials to complete the rest of his home renovation.

loans.name: Bitractor Group

texts.en:
Fatuma aged 30, is a married mother of three children, two of whom attend school. She also looks after two orphans, providing all of their basic needs such as school fees, clothes, etc.

For the past five years Fatuma, a member of Bitactor Group, has operated a retail shop in Nansana Wakiso district, selling sugar, soft drinks and salt among other items. She decided to start up this business to supplement her husband’s income, which isn't enough to sustain the family. She faces the challenge of competition from better-stocked surrounding retail shops.

Fatuma has hopes of becoming a well-known business lady by expanding her enterprise through the loan she has requested.

loans.use: To buy retail stock items to resell

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмира, 52 года, замужем, есть сын. У Гулмиры средне-специальное образование.  Супруг и сын помогают по хозяйству. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1996 года занимается животноводством, полеводством и продажей молока. Благодаря упорному труду Гулмиры в хозяйстве имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 3 теленка, 3 бычка, 30 овец и 1 лошадь. На 2,60 ГА собственной земли Гулмира выращивает картофель, зерновые и эспарцет. Также реализут молоко от собственных коров и скупая коровье молоко у односельчан, в день в общей сложности 50 литров экологически чистого, свежего, вкусного молока Гулмира сдает в магазины города. Также на вещевом рынке продает одежду (чулки, носки, колготки и т.д.). В общей сложности деятельность Гулмиры приносит  около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулмира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров, для увеличения удоя молока. Доходы от кредита Гулмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства и товара в обороте.
texts.en: Gulmira is 52 years old, married and has a son. Gulmira has a secondary-specialized education. Her husband and son help her with the household. To provide the primary source of income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry, farming and selling milk since 1996. Thanks to Gulmira's hard work, today her business has 3 dairy cows, 3 calves, 3 bulls, 30 sheep and 1 horse. Gulmira also grows potatoes, cereal crops and sainfoin. She also sells milk both from her cows and bought from neighbors. She sells about 50 liters of ecologically clean and delicious milk per day to city stores. Also, she sells clothing (stockings, socks, pantyhose, etc.) at a clothing market. All together Gulmira's business yields about 15,000 som (KGS) per month. To further develop her business, Gulmira requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy dairy cows to increase milk volume. Gulmira plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further expanding her business and goods turnover.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows in order to increase milk volume

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa is a 29-year-old single Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Thirteen years ago, and due to the low social and financial situations of Palestinian refugees in Lebanon, Issa had to quit school and started working as a mechanic to help in covering his family’s living expenses and needs.

In 2012 Issa established his own business, and he is working hard on developing it. Today, he is acquiring a Youth Loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary updated mechanical business tools and machines that will help him provide more developed technical services to his customers, which will increase his income and develop his living.

This loan will help Issa increase his profit, and improve his social and financial situations. He hopes to expand his work more in the upcoming future, through opening a wider shop with highly developed mechanical tools.

loans.use: to buy updated mechanical business tools and machines.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.en: Faustino has lived in Totolapan his whole life. Faustino spends the day, from sunrise to sunset, growing plums and peaches. He has been doing this since he can remember, first working with his dad and now working with his sons. Faustino has been living in a single room house for the last eight years with his wife. He has saved for a while to make additions to his house. He wishes to add a room for a kitchen and living room. Faustino has no technical knowledge of construction and he buys materials in small quantities, meaning he misses out on savings from bulk prices. Faustino has been saving and is asking for credit to complete the payment of the materials needs. By working with Ecoblock International he will also be part of a program that gives borrowers building materials at bulk prices, technical training, assistance, and supervision to make sure that construction meets all safety and quality regulations. Faustino makes $500 USD a month. Given his age and the informality of his business, he has no opportunity for credit from other institutions. Faustino has invested a lot of time and effort into his home renovations and he wishes to finish this work the right way. This is the opportunity he has to make it right.

loans.use: To add a room to his home

loans.name: Shorena

texts.en: Shorena, 33 years old, is divorced and lives alone in Batumi, West Georgia. She is unemployed and wants to start her own enterprise. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, qualifies her to get a loan of $3000 to start a jewelry business. With the received credit she will purchase gold jewelry to resell at higher prices. This will give her a chance to be involved in her own business and generate income.

loans.use: to begin a jewelry business.

loans.name: Burul

texts.ru: Бурул успешно погасила полученный ранее кредит, увеличив поголовье скота, за счет покупки овец. На сегодняшний день у нее есть 1 корова и 5 овец. Бурул вновь обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS), на полученные средства, она приобретет овец для дальнейшей их перепродажи на скотном рынке. Полученная прибыль от кредита позволит Бурул и в дальнейшем развивать ее животноводческую деятельность, а также построить баню и предоставлять банные услуги населению.
texts.en: Burul has successfully repaid her earlier-obtained loan and was able to increase her livestock headcount by buying sheep. Today, she has 1 cow and 5 sheep. Burul comes to "Bai-Tushum" Bank again to obtain a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep for subsequent resale at a livestock market. The profit received from the loan would allow Burul to continue developing her animal husbandry business and also to build a sauna and provide sauna services to people.

loans.use: to buy sheep in order to expand her business

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
Gonzalo es un hombre de 28 años de edad soltero, padre de dos hijos y su negocio es la confección de ropa deportiva.
El es una persona emprendedora, desidido, proactivo, luchador, constante, responsable y muy trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona 16 de Julio que se encuentra a una altitud de 4.070 metros sobre el nivel del mar y dónde se encuentra el Aeropuerto Internacional El Alto. Posee una gran actividad comercial minorista y ha sido el lugar establecimiento para inmigrantes del resto del país, en especial recién llegados de las áreas rurales. La mayoría de los inmigrantes que viven en esta ciudad provienen de los sectores rurales de los departamentos de La Paz, Oruro y Potosí.
Gonzalo es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello corto negro, su lengua natal es el aymara que combina con español según el habla de sus clientes. Su trabajo es la confección de ropa deportiva; primero se encarga del Dibujo o diseño de la prenda, la Elaboración de patrones, realiza el Trazo y Corte para terminar con la confección. Su sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus dos hijos, el piensa que realizando la compra por mayor de tela generará mejores ingresos económicos para su familia. También necesita realizar unas refacciones en su taller de costura debido a diferentes nevadas que arruinaron el techo dejando que el agua entre y malogre sus prendas.
Es por esos motivos que Gonzalo solicita un préstamo para la compra de tela por mayor y con los beneficios refaccionar su taller de costura.
texts.en:
Gonzalo is a 28 year old, single man, father of two children and his business is manufacturing sports clothing.

He is an entrepreneurial person, purposeful, proactive, a struggler, steady, responsible and hard working. He works in the 16 de Julio area which is found at an altitude of 4,070 meters above sea level and where the El Alto International Airport is. He has a large commercial retail business and has been the established location for immigrants from the rest of the country, especially recent arrivals from the rural areas. The majority of the immigrants that live in this city come from the rural sectors of the La Paz, Oruro and Potosí departments.

Gonzalo is of a dark complexion, medium build and short, black hair. His native language is Aymara which he combines with Spanish depending on his customers. His work is manufacturing sport clothing. First, he works on the drawing or design for the garment, preparing the pattern and then traces and cuts to finish the clothing. His dream is to improve his quality of life and that of his two children. He thinks that buying the fabric wholesale will generate a better income for his family. He also needs to make a few renovations on his sewing shop due to various snowstorms that ruined the roof, allowing water to enter and ruin his garments.

For these reasons, Gonzalo is requesting a loan to buy wholesale fabric and to renovate his sewing shop with the profits.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fabric and renovate his sewing shop with the profits.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 19-year-old single man, the sole earner in his family, responsible for the living expenses of five other members. For four years he has been working as an employee, cutting logs into firewood to be used for warming up during the winter season. He puts so much effort into making sure that he can provide his family with a good income to improve their living situation. He was too young when he had to start working.

Hasan is a hardworking man who is determined to develop and improve the way he makes his living. For this reason, he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to start his own business selling spare parts for motorcycles. He hopes that in the future, after gradually developing his business, he can open a motorcycle-selling showroom that will improve his social and financial situations.

loans.use: to start his own business selling spare parts for motorcycles.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en: Catalina works in the government office of Totolapan as a secretary. She is very responsible at her job and has kept it even when the government has changed. Catalina lives with her husband and is expecting a baby that will be arriving soon. They are both very excited and a couple of months ago started building a new small room in their house where the baby would sleep once he grows. Unfortunately, they did not made the right calculations and materials and money ran out before they finished. They have been saving to finish the room and request a credit to finish buying the materials needed. Catalina's husband is a farmer and they are not able to prove his income, so getting a credit only with her income is very expensive. Although the room is not needed immediately, Catalina and her husband know that once the baby gets here they will have to cover many expenses and will never get to finish the room. Catalina and her husband will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction. This new addition will give everyone in the family the space they need. Catalina is aware that dedication and hard work is what will give her family a better life.

loans.use: to pay for the construction costs of building a room and doing electric work in her house

loans.name: Oscar Geovanny

texts.es:
Oscar de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta 5° en la escuela de la comunidad, está acompañado desde hace 5 años, tiene una hija de 4 años de edad, su compañera de vida realiza trabajos de oficios domésticos y viven junto a sus padres y dos hermanos.

Oscar se dedica a la albañilería y a la compra y engorde de cerdos y siembra hace ya 8 años que se dedica a dichos oficios, para realizar el trabajo de albañilería el cliente tiene que retirarse de su hogar a las 5:00 am, le toca que recorrer varias horas en bus cuando tiene que trasladarse a otros municipios.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar  6 sacos de abono, veneno y mano de obra para la siembra, así tendrá una mejor cosecha e incrementar los ingresos en su hogar, por esta razón el crédito mejorara su vida.

El sueño de Oscar, es poder seguir trabajando arduamente para ayudar a su familia y construir su casa propia, darle la educación adecuada a su hija, su vestimenta y su salud, pues también sus ingresos económicos son para la ayuda de su demás familia.
texts.en:
Oscar is 25 years old. He went to school through 5th grade. He has been in a relationship for five years. He and his partner have a four-year-old son, and she is a homemaker. They live with his parents and two brothers.

Oscar is a bricklayer and also raises hogs and plants crops. He has been engaged in all of these activities for eight years. He leaves the house every day at 5 a.m. to do his bricklaying work. Sometimes his jobs are in other municipalities and take him a few hours to get to by bus.

The loan he is requesting from CREDICAMPO will be used to purchase 6 sacks of fertilizer and pesticides. The loan will also be used to hire manual labor for planting, which will improve his crop and increase his household income. In this way, the loan will improve his life.

Oscar's dream is to be able to continue working hard to build his own home; to keep his daughter healthy and clothed and to provider her with a good education; and to help his family and support his extended family, as his extended family also depends on his income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides; and to hire laborers to help with planting.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz lives with her husband and children in Totolapan Morelos. Beatriz has made a living selling prepared food in a stall at the market for the last 14 years. Beatriz works hard to give her children the opportunity she didn't have: to study, at least through middle school, and have a better life. For the last ten years Beatriz and her husband have been saving to build new additions to their house. However they did not plan accordingly and their bathroom could not be completed. The construction work was more expensive than they thought. They now use the neighbor's bathroom every day since they do not have their own place to bathe. 

Beatriz is always looking out for her children and understands the importance of giving them a complete bathroom and how not having one will affect their health. This process has been really frustrating for Beatriz's family since they have invested time and their savings and still were not able to accomplish what they dreamed of. Beatriz and her husband make no more than $800 USD a month through informal jobs, so accessing credit is impossible to them. For the last three months, they have been saving to complete the bathroom including installations, equipment and furniture needed. Beatriz needs this loan to finish paying for the construction materials. She and her husband will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction. This new addition will give everyone in the family the space they need. Beatriz is aware that dedication and hard work is what will give her family a better life.

loans.use: to pay for construction materials to finish her restroom with complete water and gas installations and cement floor

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.en: Hermelinda has been working as a farmer for over 30 years. She plants different kinds of fruits and sells them at the local market. Hermelinda started doing this when she was just a kid, then helped her ex husband to continue doing it when he left. Although every year physical labor gets harder, she continues working everyday from sunrise to sundown. Hermelinda has always dreamed of a closed kitchen, like those she sees in the TV. Right now her kitchen is out on the open with no doors, windows or floor. Hermelinda saved last year to start doing some work. She started by building walls but soon all her money was gone and the work was only half done. Hermelinda has been saving for the last three months to finish building her kitchen. She is now asking for a loan to complete the payment of materials needed. Since she works in the field she does not have access to credit from banks or other organizations. Hermelinda will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction. The new kitchen will be a dream come true for Hermelinda.

loans.use: to pay for the installation of windows, a door, and cement floor in the kitchen

loans.name: Aminah

texts.en:
Aminah, a 47-year-old married mother of two, has been working as a tailor for 15 years to support  her husband in developing their family’s financial situation. She has succeeded with time to expand her business by improving her productions’ wholesale trade. 

Today, Aminah is seeking a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to expand her business even more by opening a retail shop where she can display her production and attract more customers. 

Aminah hopes to keep on developing her business in a well-managed way in order to ensure that she can provide her beloved family with the standard of living they both need and deserve.

loans.use: To expand her business by opening a retail shop where she can display her production and attract more customers.

loans.name: María Ermelinda

texts.es:
María de 49 años de edad, vive junto a sus 2 hijos menores de edad de 13 y 17 años, el menor  tiene un nivel académico de 7º grado de educación básica y el mayor cursa el bachillerato general. María no tiene ningún nivel académico, debido a sus escasos recursos económicos. Pero aun de sus limitantes ella aprendió a firmar y a leer todo con la ayuda de sus hijos.

María es una persona que conoce muy bien la actividad que realiza, ya que es madre soltera y ha trabajado muy fuerte y por mucho tiempo para sacar adelante a sus hijos con los estudios. Ella se dedica a la venta de tomates, chile, cebollas, papas, frutas, etc. Ella se dedica a su trabajo el tiempo desde las 7.00 am hasta las 4.00 pm. Muy arduamente cada mañana emprende su camino desde su hogar hacia el mercado central.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar Huisquiles, zanahorias, remolachas, entre otras verduras y frutas, debido a que la clientela ha aumentado y están demandando más mercadería. 


Ella planea obtener un negocio estable y rentable para el desarrollo de su familia y satisfacción de sus clientes.
texts.en:
49-year-old María lives together with her two younger children, ages 13 and 17. The youngest has a 7th grade level of basic education and the oldest studies for the general high school diploma. María doesn't have any level of education, due to scarce economic resources. But even with her limitations, she learned to sign her name and read everything with the help of her children. 

María is a person who knows very well the job that she does, considering that she's a single mother and has worked very hard and for a lot of time to get her children ahead in their studies. She works in the sale of tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, potatoes, fruits, etc. She goes to work from 7 AM to 4 PM. Very arduously every morning she starts out on her walk from her home to the main market.

The loan that she's asking for from CREDICAMPO is to buy chayotes, carrots, beets, among other fruits and vegetables, because her clientele has increased and are demanding more merchandise.

She plans to obtain a stable and profitable business for the growth of her family and satisfaction of her clients.

loans.use: to buy chayotes, carrots, beets, among other fruits and vegetables, because her clientele has increased and are demanding more merchandise.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.en: Ignacio completed paying his last loan and now is looking for a new one to build a bathroom for his family's house. Ignacio and his wife, Aida, are thrilled to have a new room for their children. They now feel that the next step to continue providing for them is building a complete bathroom for the family. They currently need to go to the neighbor's house to get a bath, so they do it once every other day so they do not disturb them. Ignacio and Aida feel that adding this element will help them be a step closer to their dream home and will greatly increase the quality of life for their children.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a bathroom for his family's house

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel finished paying off her first loan and is enjoying her new bedroom. Her kids are thrilled with their new space. Maribel and Luis would now like to finish building their home kitchen. The kitchen that they have now works but has no doors so the smoke from the stove goes into the house and there is a part of the kitchen that has dirt floor. They know that this is not healthy, especially since this is where they eat and prepare food. Maribel has been saving now to finish the kitchen. She is asking for a loan that will help her buy the materials needed. Luis, her husband, would do the work and certified technicians will supervise the work making sure it complies with the safety and quality standards. Maribel and Luis are excited to have this opportunity and cannot believe they are this lucky and able to make their dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish building a kitchen in her home

loans.name: Paula

texts.en: Paula is a young women from Totolapan, Morelos. She works as a seamstress 6 days a week from 8 am to 8pm. She loves her work and imagines one day creating her own clothes. Paula is really excited because after years of saving she bought a piece of land near her parents' house. She now wants to start building little by little but wants to do it right.  She wants to build a house that will last for years to come and maybe some place where she can have a family in the future. Paula has worked many years to be able to do this. She wants to be supervised and be sure that the first room she builds complies with all the safety and quality standards. Paula is asking for a credit to buy the necessary materials to begin construction. She cannot ask for a credit someplace else given that she works from her house through an informal job, so a proof of income is impossible to get. Paula will receive visits from Ecoblock's certified technicians as well as training. Paula is really excited about this opportunity and making her dream come true.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of the first room of her future home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school fees and education costs

loans.name: Festus

texts.en: This is Festus. He is a first born in a family of 5. He is in his final year at the Kenya College of Accountancy (KCA University) and majors in Finance. His ambition in life is to work for 3 years and establish his own business. His inspiration is to build a business that can help those in need. He was brought up in an  environment where there were limited opportunities to get an education and his current situation inspires him to complete his education and make the world a better place. A loan from Kiva will help Festus complete his education and help his community with the knowledge and skills he would have acquired.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees in an accountancy college

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a married man with six children. He owns a clothing and retail shop. He started his business to earn a living. He has additional income from produce and he plans to buy a pool table in the future so as to have several sources of income, and he also wishes to educate his children. He is a hardworking man and his challenge is competition from people with similar businesses.
He needs a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Marianella

texts.es:
Marianella es una joven muy noble, es soltera, tiene 37 años y vive en Calleria junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchos deseos de superación, estudió la carrera Técnica de Computación y actualmente trabaja en Cobranza de Arbitrios y le va muy bien debido a su excelente desempeño. Vive junto a su hermana y sus sobrinos, y los apoya de manera incondicional porque su hermana es madre soltera, y sus sobrinos son como sus hijos por ello siempre se preocupa por su bienestar.
Marianella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa por las tardes y quiere ampliarlo, es por ello que está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería por temporada para ofrecer a sus clientes y así pueda obtener mayores ingresos, gracias a esto mejorará el nivel de vida de su familia y seguirá esforzándose para apoyar en la educación de sus sobrinos.
texts.en:
Marianella is a noble young woman. She's single and 37 years old, and she lives in Calleria together with her family.

She's a person with many desires for self-improvement. She studied Computer Science and actually works in Tax Collecting, and things are going well for her due to her excellent achievement. She lives with her sister and her sister's children, and she supports them unconditionally because her sister is a single mother, and her sister's children are like her children; for this reason, she's always worried about their wellbeing. 

Marianella has a business selling clothes in the afternoons and she wants to expand it. It's for this reason that she's very grateful for Kiva loans because with the support that they have given her, she will be able to buy seasonal merchandise to offer her clients and in this way she can earn better income. Thanks to this, the standard of living of her family will improve and she will continue making the effort to support the education of her sister's children.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing to use in her business

loans.name: Pius

texts.en: Pius is a married man who sells produce, especially maize. He also operates a mini depot in Kagadi Uganda to earn money for a living. He is hardworking and hopes to grow his business into new market areas, despite the poor roads hindering transportation of his drinks to markets. Pius is asking for a loan to buy sodas and beers to sell.

loans.use: to buy sodas and beer to sell.

loans.name: Yeni

texts.en:
A loan of Rp 10,000,000 helps Yeni introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to her community.

Yeni is married with four children. She wanted to be a pastor but got no further than high school due to family financial difficulties. Yeni’s husband is a lecturer but does not make enough money to make necessary improvements to their house. 

To increase her income Fritz has joined Kopernik’s Tech Kiosk network to sell simple life-changing technologies. She will use the loan to buy stock and grow her business.  Yeni is excellent at building good relationships with customers and after participating in Kopernik’s benefit and after sales service training, is able to promote the products more successfully. So much so that word of mouth means that customers from villages located a few hours away visit her house in person to purchase.

loans.use: to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to their community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for biodigesters for resale

loans.name: Fuente De Paz Group

texts.en:
The Fountain of Peace Group consists of six entrepreneurial women who are located in the colonial town of Antigua Guatemala in the Sacatepéquez Department. They chose their name for being Christians and believing in the empowerment through God and as a motivation for this upcoming new period in their lives. They have a variety of businesses, such as food sales, cosmetics sales and clothing sales. They are based out of the central market of Antigua, which is a central sales point in the area. They are eager to not only receive FNGs loans but also to learn more about business administration and financial literacy. 
One outstanding member of this group is Liliana (second from left) who is the leader of the group and helps the business advisor with organizational tasks regarding payment meetings and educational sessions. 
Liliana is 37 years old and married with three children (ages 10, 14 and 15), who are enrolled in Primary and Middle School. She is a bilingual secretary, but prefers to work in her own business. Her husband is a male nurse in a laboratory in Antigua. They are a good team and both support their family economically and emotionally. 
Her business is the sale of tights and other beauty items in the central market of Antigua. She wants to invest her loan money in higher quality products due to her clients ‘demand. She is currently counting on monthly sales of 8200 Guatemalan Quetzales with net earnings of 3280 Guatemalan Quetzales. She dreams of better housing conditions for her family, which she wants to achieve through growing her business and investing her profits in construction in the future.

loans.use: to buy higher quality tights and other beauty products due to her clients ‘demand

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: This is Mary. She is a small scale dairy farmer from Kiambu, Kenya. Mary is married with school going children. She has a big challenge of raising school fees for her children. With her current 3 dairy cows, she is not able to raise adequate money for family upkeep and education for her children. With a loan from Kiva, Mary will be able to buy one more Dairy cow, increase milk production and be able to raise adequate finances to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to  purchase an extra Dairy cow and improve her milk production

loans.name: Sumomei 3 Group

texts.en:
From Chorkor, six women are part of a group called Sumomei 3. The ladies are focused to transform their lives through empowerment, small loans and education. They have a vision of raising their standard of living and creating a more prosperous future for themselves and their families. They are selling materials such as African wax-prints, linings, soaps, make-up products, rubber products and general goods.

Victoria is  married, with two children and is a member of the Sumomei 3. She is a 50-year-old trader who has been selling materials, African wax-prints, for 16 years. Victoria wants to continue to support her children so that they can continue with their studies up to university level. Victoria has a textile business and she buys materials, African wax-prints, at a wholesale price and sells to customers. 

She has made tremendous improvement in her business and so have the other members. The majority of the ladies do not know how to read or write and so the training sessions are essential to their success as caretakers of their family members and business entrepreneurs. The training is given in the indigenous language of the women, often with pictures, and covers a variety of subjects including effective business management practices, nutritional and health tools, and self-esteem.

The seven women look forward to creating a brighter tomorrow as empowered women eliminating poverty.

loans.use: To buy materials, African wax-prints, at a wholesale price for resale to customers.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: This is Benard. He practices Dairy farming in Kericho Kenya. Benard has been rearing dairy cows and his major challenge is maintaining a stable supply of milk especially during the dry season. This is due to lack of adequate funds to buy enough feeds. Benard has been a role model to many youths in his area since he is able to raise finances that have raised his standard of living. A loan from Kiva will enable him increase milk production from his animals hence have adequate funds to sustain the animals, pay his loan and make savings for his future.

loans.use: to purchase high quality and adequate animal feeds for his Dairy cows

loans.name: Mornica

texts.en: This is Mornica. Mornica cultivates onions that she sells in Kisumu town. She started the business in year 2005 with only Ksh5,000 which has been growing progressively. Her family relies on the income from her onions business which she wishes to grow into a wholesale outlet able to supply onions to traders in Kisumu. A loan from Kiva will enable Mornica expand her onions business and be able to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to pay for the expansion of her onions farming business

loans.name: Grupo Yoxaja 2D Group

texts.es:
Antonia tiene 40 años de edad, ella es una mujer emprendedora y decidida por poder superar en la vida, ella no se deja vencer por los obstáculos que la vida le pone sino ella alcanza todo sus mentas y sueños, ella tiene tres hijos que mantener el primero ya es casado y los dos últimos son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad. (Ella se encuentra de 1ra de izquierda a derecha la que tiene puesta una blusa de color morada).
Ella obtiene sus ingresos económicos por medio de la producción de bananos en la comunidad donde ella vive, sus padres le enseñaron dicha actividad desde hace 35 años, ella realiza la venta de su producto en el mercado y en los alrededores de su comunidad y así tener un ingreso económico para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
El uso respectivo que le dará al crédito es para el mantenimiento de banano, ya que para ella es de mucha importancia que sus plantas de bananos produzcan frutos de primera calidad y así no perder a los clientes con que ella cuenta.
Ella es un buen ejemplo en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se ha decidido a emprender el negocio junto a ella y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familias, una de las grandes aspiraciones de ella es la siembra de más plantas de bananos y ver crecer a sus hijos en el campo de la educación y convertirse en profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
Antonia is 40 years old. She is an enterprising woman and is determined to exceed in life. She doesn't let herself be defeated by obstacles that life puts in her way, but rather she reaches all her goals and dreams. She has 3 children to support. The oldest one is married and the other 2 are excellent students in the school in their community. (She is the first on the left wearing a purple shirt.)

Antonia obtains her earnings through the production of bananas in the community where she lives. Her parents taught her this activity 35 years ago. She sells her product in the market and around her community and thus has an income to improve her family's living conditions. 

She will use this loan to maintain her banana plants since it's very important to her that her plants produce high quality fruit so that she doesn't lose any of her customers.

Antonia is a good example in her community and that's why a group of women have decided to start a business along with her and thus improve their families' living conditions. One of her biggest aspirations is to plant more banana plants and to see her children grow in the education field and become professionals in life.

loans.use: to maintain her banana plants.

loans.name: Houeida 1 Group

texts.en:
Lina is the featured borrower of Houeida 1 Group. She joined along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends, and they are working hard on developing their family's social and financial situations.

Lina is a 41-year-old, married mother of two. She has been working in selling women's clothes since 21 years ago. She is a good support for her family and her beloved husband, and is working hard on developing her business properly. Today, her acquired loan will be invested in increasing her business merchandise with a special summer and the coming autumn newly released collection. This will help her in developing her family's living.

Lina is the lady at the center of the picture. Houeida is 27, married, and a mother of one child. She works as a hairdresser, and is the first lady at the far right side of the picture.  Rima is the first from the left, 45, and a married mother of one child. She sells tobacco.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special summer and new autumn collections.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel, who operates a retail shop and clinic since 2009, is a married and hardworking man of 28 years, living in Kagadi, Uganda. He desires to improve and strengthen his business in the face of challenges including competition and lack of material to use in the locality. Having been in business for 5 years, Emmanuel is asking for a loan to buy medicine for his clinic to sell.

loans.use: to buy medicine for his clinic to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of cellphone chargers, batteries, pouches and extension braids

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase energy-efficient cookstoves to sell in the community

loans.name: David E.

texts.en:
David has a small business that supplies hardware materials. He has been in business for a few years now. 	
He hopes adding Sustainable Energy for All (SE4All) products like charcoal stoves and solar lighting to his inventory will help his business grow. The profit made will be used to grow his business.

loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael has a business in central Monrovia selling home electronics and movies. He's been in business for five years now. He hopes adding Sustainable Energy for All (SE4All) products like clean charcoal cookstoves and solar lighting to his inventory will increase his profits and help his business grow.

loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase energy efficient stoves to sell in the community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas and market stall

loans.name: Demba

texts.en: Demba sells dry goods in central Monrovia. He's married with two children and has been in business for a few years now and hopes increased profits made by adding Sustainable Energy for All (SE4All) products like clean charcoal cookstoves and solar lighting to his inventory will help his business grow.

loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more banana supplies and construct a market stall

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en: This is Samwel. He is a farmer and trades in onions, Tomatoes and Peppers in Meru county, Kenya. Samwel started farming on hired land about 3 years ago. So far he has managed to buy a small piece of land where he farms. He also farms on other hired land. Since he sells his produce in Wajir, a distance of more than 600 Kilometers away, he wishes to increase his capacity in order to maximize on his profits. Samwel hopes to raise his sales and be able to buy a pick up vehicle in two years time. A loan from KIVA will grow Samwel's business and enable him do contract farming selling to big processing companies as well as produce for his business..

loans.use: to expand his farming activities i.e Hire land, buy inputs

loans.name: Herina

texts.en: This is Herina. She is a mother, widowed in May 2014. Herina is adapting to the uphill responsibility of the sole breadwinner and paying high school fees for her son. She plans to add one more dairy cow that will increase supply of milk and manure. She is determined to change her fortunes by working hard to bring up her income through milk production and maize planting that will enable her feed and educate her son. A loan from Kiva will assist Herina build a stable source of income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow that will boost milk production hence income to pay school fees for her son

loans.name: Chitubu Cheupenyu Group

texts.en:
Chitubu Cheupenyu is a group from Tynwald South and Emily is one of its four members. Emily is a divorcee with two school going dependants, one in primary school and the other in secondary school. She is a cross border trader selling clothes, blankets and comforters. Emily gets orders from people in her neighbourhood and gets paid at the end of the month which is also good timing for her restocking. 

She said she has acquired great knowledge from Thrive and wished she had known that when she started her business. Emily appreciates the idea of strict time keeping implemented during training by Thrive staff and record keeping.  The group is applying for her first loan and Emily hopes to secure a proper place for herself and her family to stay, by finishing paying for her residential stand in Windsor Park with the profits and savings.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, blankets and other goods for resale.

loans.name: Abiaz

texts.en:
Mr. Abiaz, aged 43 years, is a businessman with a petrol station (fuel). He is married with 4 children, ages 14,10, 8 and 3, and all of them attend school. He has applied for a loan of shs 5,000,000 (five million shillings only) to buy fuel for his business. He started his business in the year 2006 in the rural area because there was limited supply of the fuel in the area, and so he would get the opportunity to make income to sustain him and the family. 

He is a hardworking man who sells milk to supplement his income. He works 12 hours a day and 7 days a week. His clients are drivers and motorcyclists plus people who use generators and paraffin. He is faced with the challenge of limited capital to stock enough fuel, thus, he usually runs out of the product in a short time. There is also competition from other fuel business people but Mr. Abiaz works hard to beat it. He hopes the loan money will boost his business and bring him more customers, therefore increasing his profit margin. He is resilient and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy fuel to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a farmer age 42 years old. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to pay tuition for her daughter Mackline.  She is married with seven children, ages 26, 25, 23, 21, 18, 18 and 13 years, and four of them attend school at the moment. She does farming as her main business and runs a small hotel to supplement her income. She is a very hardworking lady who works eight hours a day and six days a week.  She started her business in 1994 to have an income to sustain her. The business is being carried on in Ruhinda, Mitooma District and her clients are all categories of people who have helped her to grow from one level to another. She is faced with the challenge of competition from other business people, but is determined to boost her business through hard work.  She hopes to grow her business, become financially stable, and educate all her children to have a better future. She thanks Kiva lenders for the support.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition.

loans.name: Cavid

texts.en:
Cavid is 34 years old and married with 3 children. He has been working in a water project company for 8 years and participates in the building and cleaning of irrigation channels. His monthly income is 600 AZN, and this amount does not cover his family’s needs. 

Channels are artificial bodies of water that are constructed to direct and control the flow of water. Many companies build irrigation channels. These channels are used to artificially inject water into soil that is experiencing persistent or recurrent lack of moisture, in order to obtain stable and high crop yields.

Cavid is very interested in this area and wants to expand his business. He wants to make this work more profitable and of higher quality. He applied for 1200 AZN in order to buy new irrigation tools for artificial irrigation.

loans.use: to buy new irrigation tools for artificial irrigation

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
María Esther tiene 49 años de edad, vive en casa alquilada, es madre soltera vive con su hija de 16 años de edad, la cual cursa secundaria en colegio nacional del distrito de Pucará. Su comunidad está ubicada en el distro de Pucará, provincia de Jaen, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza María es la venta de cerveza asi como tambièn la produción de bodoques, cuenta con clientela fija pues ella es muy conocida en la zona; María ya cuenta con 2 años de experiencia en el rubro, además se dedica a la venta de ceviche, papa rellena, ingresos adicionales que le permiten solventar el credito sin ningún problema. María solicita el préstamo para ivertir en su negocio surtiendo con bebidas gaseosas, y para comprar su materia prima para la fabricación de alimentos que ella vende, con ello le generará mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su hija.
texts.en:
María Esther is 49 years old and lives in a rented house. She is the single mother of a 16-year old daughter who is a student at the national college in Pucará. The community where they live is located in the district of Pucará, in the province of Jaen, Cajamarca Region, in Peru's northern mountains.

María Esther earns her living selling beer and also making fruit-based popsicles. She has regular customers as she is well-known in the area and has done this work for the last two years. She also sells ceviche and stuffed potatoes. This additional income will allow her to pay off the loan without difficulty.

María Esther is seeking a loan to buy stock for her business such as soft drinks, and to buy ingredients for the food she makes and sells. In this way she will generate more income and more profit resulting in an improved standard of living for herself and her daughter.

loans.use: buy stock for her business such as soft drinks and ingredients for the food she makes

loans.name: Anuka

texts.en: Anuka is 21 years old. She is divorced and lives with her infant son and grandmother in Sighnaghi district. Anuka is a very hardworking young woman, and she is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they grow tomatoes on family-owned agricultural land and sell locally. Anuka wants to increase her income and has requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 1700 GEL for purchasing a cow and a calf. After that she will milk the cow everyday and will produce cheese products to sell. This will increase the income of her family, and with increased income she will be able to improve the living conditions for her child.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and a calf.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is 52 years old and married with eight children. With one child still in school, Jacinta works very hard to provide for the family. She has been in her business for 10 years and sells a variety of items. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of soft-drinks, canned goods, beer, biscuits, candies, detergent soap, etc. to sell. Jacinta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of soft-drinks, canned goods, beer, biscuits, candies, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Nestan

texts.en:
Nestan is a 49-year-old widowed woman. She lives in the village of Dighomi with her daughter. Nestan works as a nurse at a local hospital and gets a small monthly income, which is the only source of income for the family. 

Previously, she was trading with clothes and is experienced in this field. Nestan wants to restart this business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enabled her to get a loan of 1,100 USD for purchasing a stock of clothes. 

Nestan will re-start her trading business and will increase her family income. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for restarting a trading business.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra lives in Rawalpindi. She is 22 years old and married. She is a housewife and her husband is a taxi driver by profession. He is hardworking and makes sure that all their monthly expenses are met. He has been a taxi driver for more than 5 years. 

Due to constant driving, his taxi is not functioning properly. He needs timely maintenance of his taxi because all his income depends on driving the taxi. As he is short of cash, his wife has applied for a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva partner, in order to support her husband. This will help him to repair his taxi and start driving smoothly again

loans.use: To help her husband repair his taxi.

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en: Chanthy’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Chanthy makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as scrap dealer and seller by selling porridge to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sida's Group

texts.en: Sida’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sida makes a living cultivating cassava and she also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Aduri Rani

texts.en:
Aduri is a 44-year-old married woman from Dhupguri. She is the mother of two sons. One is in college, and the other is in secondary school. She is illiterate and can only sign her name. Her husband, Tarapada, is engaged in agricultural activities. They live in a small village, Gosairhat, in Jalpaiguri district.

Agriculture is an activity suited only to those who love the earth as a mother and as a provider of future life - a good future full of hope for future generations. This is Tarapada's (Aduri's husband's) work. He plants potatoes, carrots, beans, and gourds. He does this activity in the locality where he lives, and he sells his products in the local markets. He chose this work because he inherited a good knowledge of vegetables from his father. Now, with the growing needs of the family, he needs to increase his cultivation. So he has decided to cultivate paddy: the much demanded crop in his region.

So Aduri has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS). She will use this loan to purchase paddy seeds as well as chemical and organic fertilizers so that her husband has a good harvest this year. Some of her biggest dreams are to build some rooms for the children and to provide them with adequate living conditions. They would like to see the children get proper education and grow into professionals in the future.

Aduri is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs (seeds, fertilizers, pesticides) for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: J. Ndorbor

texts.en: Ndorbor has a business center located in Paynesville. He sells a variety of dry goods. He has been in business for a number of years now and hopes he will receive increased profits from adding Sustainable Energy for All (SE4All) products like clean charcoal cookstoves and solar lighting to his inventory. These products will help his business grow.

loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna has a Beauty Saloon located in Red Light. She wants to offer products to her customers that every home needs. She's been in business since the start of 2014 and hopes that increased profits made by adding SE4All products like clean charcoal cookstoves and solar lighting to her inventory will help her business grow.

loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Camilia

texts.en: Camilia is a 28-year-old, Lebanese single woman, living with her parents. She has two siblings and they all cooperate together with their father to be able to pay the high costs of living. Three years ago, she started to work as a private teacher from her home. In parallel, she works at a local store, which sells sport equipment and clothes to supplement her income and to live in better conditions. And today, she is requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase a set of newly published books with the aim of enhancing her teaching skills. In addition, she will set aside a small space at her house and supply it with needed equipment to be able to welcome her students properly. As for her future plans, Camilia seeks to start working at a local school with this coming season, and to focus on growing this business, gain more experience and earn satisfactory revenues.

loans.use: to purchase a set of books, and to set aside a small teaching space at her house, and to supply it with needed equipment.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 38 years old and single. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, shampoo, coffee, canned goods, cereals, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business. In the future, Josie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jennelyn

texts.en:
Jennelyn is single and has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years now.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers. In the future, Jennelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready to wear to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is 55 years old and widowed with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lydia has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Lydia has been in this business for 21 years. Lydia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of customers waiting too long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Ry's Group

texts.en: Ry’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Ry makes a living cultivating rice with his family and he also does extra work as construction worker to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Aleya

texts.en:
Aleya hails from Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district. She is 26 years old and the mother of two children (one son and one daughter). Her husband is a cultivator by profession. Both of them did not get an opportunity to get education as their family could not afford their education expenses. So they can only sign their names. Her children are in different grades in primary and secondary school. They live in their own house in Khalaigram.

Aleya's husband strives hard to make a living. All his life, he has worked in agricultural pursuits growing different crops. He has worked in unity with his wife. With the profits obtained from their farming, they have managed to build their modest little house. First, he wants to get a good harvest from the land and continue to save up other earnings little by little to cover household expenses. Right now, the need that has arisen is the cultivation of a profitable crop as his present income is insufficient to cover all the expenses of his family. He decided to cultivate paddy but lacks the capital.

Aleya is requesting this loan from Kiva's partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) to buy fertilizers, paddy seeds, and herbicides. She wants to take advantage of the rainy season to obtain a good harvest with all the care and management possible to achieve her intended future earnings, which will allow her to meet the needs of the family.

Aleya thanks BJS and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers to grow paddy.

loans.name: Seang's Group

texts.en: Seang’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Seang makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Kheann's Group

texts.en: Kheann’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Kheann makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Nyame Dor 3 Group

texts.en:
The group is made up of six members and begins its first loan cycle with ID-Ghana. The businesses that the members of the group run are varied. Among them are selling lining, home appliances, soft drinks, groundnut paste and phone cards.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these micro-entrepreneurs, of whom Martha (standing far left in the photo) is one. She indicates that she joined ID-Ghana not long ago, through a promotional campaign by the institution. She now has a business of selling groundnut paste. She mentioned that she began this business 18 years ago with some basic capital. With the time passing by, she expanded her business. 

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital to buy more groundnuts to prepare the paste and sell to customers. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is married and has three children.

When she was asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she responded that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: To buy more groundnuts to prepare the paste and sell to customers.

loans.name: Roeun's Group

texts.en: Roeun’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Roeun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Chenda's Group

texts.en: Chenda’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Chenda makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Namsang Group

texts.en: Mr. Khamtouy's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village are able to buy bottled water.  The water in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    Mr. Khamtouy is excited that he and his neighbors were able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income and available working days due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal or foraging for wood to boil the water and/or purchasing bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Teung Group

texts.en:
Mr. Souphasit's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village are able to buy bottled water.  The water in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    Mr. Souphasit is excited that he and his neighbors were able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income and available working days due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal or foraging for wood to boil the water and/or purchasing bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

A couple of the group member's chilren are also pictured in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 27-year-old single man who had to quit school during the elementary years to work and support his family in their living. In 2013, he opened his own bakery after five years of experience as an employee. 

Today, Hussein is acquiring a YOUTH Loan from Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua, to expand his work and increase his merchandise by buying requested raw materials that will increase his business capital and production.

The loan will help Hussein to better serve his customers and make additional income for his family. He always dreams of opening a dining lounge for his bakery, and he hopes to open a wider bakery in the future

loans.use: To expand his work and increase his merchandise by buying requested raw materials that will increase his business capital and production.

loans.name: Tural

texts.en:
Tural is 25 years old, married, and has a daughter. Tural works on a team, which builds water channels, and he has been working in this area for four years and has good skills. His monthly income is 150 AZN. Additionally he lives with his parents and takes care of them. 

People build water channels in order to make water circulate and be in every house, because water is very important for people’s lives. He is very responsible and understands the importance of his job, because it’s very hard and he needs good knowledge.  Tural applied for 600 AZN loan in order to buy good coveralls and quality tools for his job. Good equipment and tools will increase productivity of his team’s work and will give good results at the end of project.

loans.use: to buy good coveralls and quality tools for his job.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years now.

Marina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Marina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Khatia

texts.en: Khatia is 22 years old. She lives with her 4-year-old daughter in Rustavi district. Khatia works as a saleslady at local shop. As the income is too small, she decided to start an additional business and has requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 200 USD to purchase English language books and to teach from home. She will be able to increase her income and provide better living conditions for her daughter. Khatia awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase books and to teach English language from home.

loans.name: Melvis Sayaneth

texts.es:
Melvis de 29 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa  desde hace 7 años, negocio que administra junto a su mamá. Ella es madre soltera de una niña de 9 añitos, quien ha sido su principal motivo para seguir adelante.

Ella es una persona que siempre ha trabajado comercializando ropa. El ser comerciante fue algo que lo aprendió de su mamá a muy corta edad. Ella no ha practicado con otro negocio en toda su vida,  Melvis ha observado que es rentable el vender ropa y por tal motivo se ha mantenido en esta parte del comercio.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar faldas, blusas, camisas, pantalones, short, calcetines, ropa interior para ambos sexos y niños, etc.  

Ella tiene mucha demanda de clientes quienes le exigen ropas a la moda y variedad de colores.
Sus ideales a futuro son mejorar su negocio e instalar un pequeño local en su comunidad, para vender la ropa a las personas que le visiten, ademas darle lo mejor a su pequeña, que es por quien lucha día a día.
texts.en:
29-year old Melvis has sold clothing for seven years, a business she runs with her mother. She is the single mother of a 9-year old daughter who is the reason she wishes to get ahead. Melvis has always worked selling clothing. Her mother taught her about running a business at a very young age, and she has never done anything else. She notes that it is a profitable field so she has kept working in it.

The loan she is seeking is to buy skirts, blouses, shirts, pants, shorts, socks, and underwear for both men and women as well as children. She has many requests from customers who are looking for fashionable clothing in a variety of colours.

In the future Melvis would like to improve her business and open a small store in the community to sell merchandise to her customers. She also wishes to do the best she can for her daughter as it is for her that she works hard every day.

loans.use: buy skirts, blouses, shirts, pants, shorts, socks, and underwear for men,  women and children
