loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy all kinds of merchandise in order to be able to meet the demands of his customers

loans.name: Yeat's Group

texts.en: Yeat’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Yeat makes a living cultivating rice. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Saima lives in Rawalpindi. She is a housewife and a mother of five children. Her husband has a small bookbinding business. They cover all their expenses with the income from the business, so it is vital that it is profitable. Given their big family, her husband wants to expand his binding business by buying more material used in binding books. But given their small income, which only covers their daily expenses, it has not been possible. Therefore, as a dedicated, wife Saima has applied for a loan to help her husband in his business. They are thankful to Kiva and BRAC.

loans.use: To help her husband expand his press and bookbinding business

loans.name: Taingim's Group

texts.en: Taingim’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Taingim makes a living cultivating and she also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sokkin's Group

texts.en: Sokkin’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sokkin makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Hem's Group

texts.en: Hem’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Hem makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sothea's Group

texts.en: Sothea’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sothea makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as farm laborer and  selling second hand clothes to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sarwat

texts.en:
Sarwat lives in Rawalpindi. She is married and has one son and two daughters. She is 29 years old and is self employed, running a small, home-based tailoring business. She is a hardworking person and a dedicated mother.

Recently, Sarwat got an order to make army bags, for which she would need to buy material. But due to financial constraints, she cannot do so. Her family's expenses do not allow her to save any money, so she is short of cash. Therefore, she has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, Kiva's partner, to provide her with the funds she needs to buy the material for the army bags.

Sarwat's dream is to become a successful entrepreneur and a role model for her children.

loans.use: to buy material to fulfill an order for army bags.

loans.name: Nang's Group

texts.en: Nang’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Nang makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en: Yen’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Yen makes a living cultivating rice and raising ducks to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more supplies for her grocery business.

loans.name: Prince Honor

texts.en: Prince has a small hardware store located in Paynesville, Monrovia. He likes the idea of offering Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products to his customers. He's been in business for over three years and hopes increased profits made by adding SE4All products like clean charcoal cookstoves and solar lighting to his inventory will help his business grow.

loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Mach's Group

texts.en: Mach’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Mach makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs and she also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en: Phalla’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Phalla makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Dúo San Cristobal Group

texts.es: DUO SAN CRISTOBAL Doña Juana originarias de San Andres Itzapa, ellas se dedica a la elaboración de ropa para caballeros y gracias a Dios kiva le a ayudado mucho en su negocio a prosperado ya que en la actualidad tiene una mini fabrica en donde fabrica pantalones, camisas, playeras chumpas para niños y lo distribuyen a distintos departamentos de Guatemala, es el tercer crédito que solicita a kiva y cuentan que les servirá para poder invertir en telares y fabricar mas ropa ya que el sueño que ella tiene es de tener una fábrica de ropa mas grande y llegar a exportarlo fuera de Guatemala.
texts.en: The group, DUO SAN CRISTOBAL; Dona Juana, comes from San Andres Itzapa. The ladies make a living by manufacturing fine clothing and gives thanks to Kiva which has helped their business prosper greatly. They currently operate a small factory where they produce pants, shirts, and lightweight jackets for children and then distribute them to different departments in Guatemala. This is the third loan they request from Kiva, it serves the purpose of investing in fabric to produce more clothing, furthering their dream to have a larger clothing factory and eventually export outside of Guatemala.

loans.use: To purchase raw material (fabric) for the manufacture and sale of wearable clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, galvanized metal sheeting, and purlins to cement the floor and replace the roof on his house.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vive en zona de alto en casa propia con su grupo familia. Se dedica a la venta de tortillas y pupusas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, la joven es muy trabajadora, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar. ella solicita un crédito para la compra de maíz, frijoles, quesillo, chicharrón, tomates, entre otros y asi poder tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: This borrower is 25 years old and lives in a high risk region so her face is blurred out to protect her identity. She lives with her family in a house that they own. She works selling tortillas and pupusas [filled tortillas]. Her business is located in her place of residence and she is a hard worker. With the proceeds from her sales, she is able to cover the necessities that arise in her household. The borrower is requesting a loan to buy corn, beans, farmer's cheese, pork, tomatoes and other items. In this way she and her family will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, farmer's cheese, pork, tomatoes and other items to make pupusas

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 36 years old and married with four children. With four children currently in school, Merlinda works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like snack foods, canned goods, candies, eggs, shampoo, soft-drinks, etc.  Merlinda has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business. In the future, Merlinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like snack foods, canned goods, candies, eggs, shampoo, soft-drinks, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase styling chairs and a range of hair and skin care products, in order to start her own business and achieve her dream.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and coffee seeds to maintain and improve his crops.

loans.name: José Guillermo

texts.es:
José de 54 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, sus padres no tuvieron los recursos económicos para que siguiera estudiando; fue así como aprendió el trabajo de campo, actualmente se dedica a la agricultura. Se creció con sus padres quienes le enseñaron esta actividad, su familia esta conformada  por su esposa quien le apoya con los oficios domésticos ya que sus hijos tienen su hogar aparte.

 
José se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. para ir a trabajar durante la mañana en la parcela que alquila y durante el resto del día trabaja en otras parcelas o cuidando sus animales.

 El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar  semilla, veneno, abono, rastreo de la tierra en donde cultivara maíz, el propósito de él es que sea una cosecha abundante para vender una parte y la otra para consumo familiar. 

José  planea en un futuro sembrar cacao y con ayuda de otro crédito espera lograrlo.
texts.en:
José, 54, studied up to third grade.  His parents didn't have the financial resources for him to keep on attending school.  That was how he learned to farm.  Currently he earns a living in agriculture.  He grew up with his parents, who taught him this job.  His family is made up of his wife, who helps him with the household chores, because his children have their own homes.
 
José gets up at 4:30 a.m. to go to work for the morning at the plot of land he rents.  The rest of the day he works on other plots of land or takes care of his animals.

The loan he's requesting from CrediCampo is to buy seeds, poison, and soil amendments, and to plow the land where he's going to grow corn.  His goal is to have an abundant crop so he can sell part and keep some for family consumption.

José plans to grow cacao in the future, and he hopes to achieve this with the help of another loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds, poison, and soil amendments, and to plow the land for corn

loans.name: Laiheang's Group

texts.en: Laiheang’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Laiheang makes a living cultivating rice and her husband also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Aoua

texts.fr:
Madame AOUA est née en janvier 1972 à BAMAKO, mariée, mère de 6 enfants, elle réside sous couvert de son époux et leurs enfants dans une famille traditionnelle à HAMDALLAYE un quartier populaire dans la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Cette brave femme après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès madame AOUA s’est initiée aux activités d’achat et de vente des friperies il ya 3 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché.
A fin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle sollicite auprès de l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso un quatrième prêt individuel commerçant. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 2 balles de friperie pour la revendre en détail au marché à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit.  
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aoua was born in January 1972 in Bamako, and is married and the mother of six children. She lives with her husband and their children in a traditional family in Hamdallaye, a working-class neighborhood in Sikasso, third administrative region in the Republic of Mali.

After having tried many businesses without success, Mrs. Aoua took up the purchase and resale of secondhand clothing three years ago. She gets her supplies from the big market.

In order to meet the growing needs of her customers, Mrs. Aoua is seeking a fourth individual loan from microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. The previous loans have been properly repaid. This loan will allow Mrs. Aoua to purchase two bales of clothing to sell at the market to a group of customers made up of men and women for cash and credit.

Mrs. Aoua expects to see an average monthly profit of 30,000 CFA francs. This profit will allow her to repay the loan and her interest, with the rest for her savings.

loans.use: To purchase secondhand clothing.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is 59 years old and married with nine children, one of whom is still in school. 

She is in farming, fattening pigs in the Philippines for three years. Teofila requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has borrowed five times from NWTF to sustain her busienss. Teofila would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Porferia

texts.en:
Porferia is 44 years old and has eight children. She is married and has four children who are currently in school. Porferia is in the agricultural business of farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Porferia has been farming vegetables for 20 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Porferia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi appreciates the previous loan that helped her expand her business.

For over twenty years, she has operated an open-air food business, selling from her home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, beans, onions, tomatoes and cooking oil.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a previous client aged 28 years. He is a businessman who sells drinks and beverages as his main source of income and his customers are all categories of people. He has applied for a loan of UGX 3,000,000 (Three million shillings only) to buy more stock of soda and bottled juices to sell in the business.  He is also a youth district speaker where he earns a monthly salary. He is still single with no children. He is a hardworking man who works 12 hours a day and 6 days a week. He started his business in 2008 in Ruhinda, Mitooma District to have an income.  His future plan is to be financially stable. He is however, faced with the challenge of competition from other bar business people, but is determined to grow his business through his hard work and the loan money.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and juices to sell.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 47-year-old married woman. She has successfully run a business making flowers for the past two years. She offers various colorful flowers for decorating homes and events like birthdays, parties, etc.. She sells them directly to the people of her community and also in the local market.  

Zahida has good communication skills and a good client list. She has six children. Zahida is motivated to provide for her family. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy raw materials such as fabric, glaze papers, and containers of paint in various colors. 

In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demands of her customers. She wishes to spend part of the revenues to pay for her family's expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as fabric, glaze papers, and containers of paint in various colors.

loans.name: Iqbal

texts.en:
Iqbal has expertise in hand embroidery and is using her skill to provide for her family for many years. She is proud to be well-known in her community as the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. 

She has been using loans from the Kashf Foundation to improve her business. Now she has requested another loan worth 40,000 PKR to purchase bundles of cloth in many colors. 

She says that the women in her community are becoming more demanding over time and satisfying them is her challenge. She dreams of providing a prosperous future to her six children.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of cloth in many colors.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Hello world. Meet Stanley, a very energetic, hardworking and ambitious farmer who is 50 years of age. He is based in Kiboroa, a remote village in the rich highlands of Kitale. For the past seven years he has been involved in mixed farming, and selling eggs, milk and with his personal business he has been able to earn a decent and honest livelihood. He passionately loves poultry farming and as he likes to put it “poultry farming is close to my heart.” When asked what he enjoys in poultry farming he responded, “feeding his poultry.” 

Stanley sells eggs and poultry products to his neighbors and to the local market and the demand has really grown. He benefits from word of mouth because of his high quality eggs, and this has made demand for his eggs overwhelm him. He is seeking funds to buy additional poultry. Through the loan he will be able to satisfy the demand that is there, and to improve his income level. With the loan he is going to expand to full capacity, and this will improve his profit margins. Through Juhudi Kilimo he has gained both financial and technical training on the best poultry farming techniques. He is confident that increased profits will be used to repay the loan and to improve his living conditions. Additionally, he will benefit from poultry manure.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry for his business.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 50-year-old single lady. On her own through all these years, she has struggled for her life and tried to cover her living costs without falling back on anybody. She succeeded in opening a clothes selling and tailoring shop that she manages well and which has covered all her needs and expenses. Zeinab is the sole earner in her family and is responsible for an additional member of her family.

Today, Zeinab is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to buy new furniture for her house to keep it a healthy living place. This loan will help Zeinab live well and have a better future.

loans.use: To buy necessary furniture for her house to keep it a healthy living place

loans.name: Mashhura

texts.en:
Mashhura is divorced and has a child. She has always wanted to provide her child with a good education, so she decided to start a new business in animal husbandry. With this aim she studied the course of ‘To Get Ahead’ with a women's organization and got enough skills about business. Her mother will help her with the business. She will be a very successful business woman as she is hardworking and smart. 

She is asking for a loan of 10000 TJS to buy cattle for organizing her new business. She will get through, using the loan, and her business will go on to be a source of income so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. 

She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle for organizing a new business in animal husbandry.

loans.name: Noor  Ulain

texts.en: Noor Ulain is a 19-year-old married woman. Three years ago she started a business of tailoring to support her husband in providing for their family. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of their household. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family. Currently, she has requested for a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons and laces etc. In this way she will be able to meet with the increasing demand. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She hopes to grow her business by expanding her customer base.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons and laces, etc.

loans.name: Mariyam

texts.en:
Mariyam is a 42-year-old married woman running a business selling milk for many years. She and her husband have two buffaloes producing milk. She sells it to the people in her community to generate a good income. She is happily doing her business to support her family. 

She has four children and is trying hard to meet their demands for food, health care, clothing and education. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase another buffalo she has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. It will help her to grow her sales and profits.  This is her third loan; Mariyam has a good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en:
Kubra is a 43-year-old married woman running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has buffaloes and cows for milking. She sells the milk in her area. 

Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has five children. Kubra is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. She uses most of the income to pay for her children’s healthcare and education. This is her fourth year with the Kashf Foundation.

Kubra has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo for milking. She is hopeful that her business will expand with the help of this loan and she will be able to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Delmy

texts.es: Delmy tiene 42 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus tres hijos de 17 años, 14 años y 12 años de edad. Delmy es una  mujer que se caracteriza por ser muy trabajadora dado que desde hace 20 años se gana la viada mediante la venta de artículos de playa como flotadores, calzonetas, etc. De esta forma es como se logra ganar el sustento diario y mantiene la economía del hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para reparar el techo del corredor de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Delmy is 42 years old and lives in her own home with her three children aged 17, 14, and 12 years old. Delmy is a woman defined by her hard work, since for 20 years, she makes a living selling beach accessories such as floats, articles of clothing, etc. She makes a living daily in this way and maintains the home financially. 

She requests this loan from FUSAI in order to improve her home. She will invest the loan in the purchase of galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails to repair the patio covering in her home.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails to repair the patio covering in the homestead

loans.name: Mrecelline

texts.en:
Mercelline is married with seven school-going children. They live at a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

Mercelline has operated a clothes selling business for the past two years. She sells in a shop to her town dwellers, passersby, and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman but has no children. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

For the past two years, Amina has operated a cereals business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Amina dreams of establishing a wholesale cereals shop in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000, Amina wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and maize. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and maize

loans.name: In Him Is Life Group

texts.en:
From Chorkor, three women are part of a group called In Him is Life. The women are focused on transforming their lives through empowerment, small loans and education. They have a vision of raising their standard of living and creating a more prosperous future for themselves and their families. They are selling fruit, hair products and groceries. 

Lucy is single with one child and is a member of this group. She is a 40-year-old trader who has sold fruit for 22 years. Lucy wants to continue to support her child. Lucy sells her merchandise at retail. She buys fruit at the wholesale price from the market and sells to customers. 

She has made a tremendous improvement in her business, as have the other members. The majority of the women do not know how to read or write. The training sessions are essential to their success as caretakers of their family and business entrepreneurs. The training is given in the indigenous language of the women, often with pictures, and covers a variety of subjects including effective business management practices, nutritional and health tools, and self-esteem. The three women look forward to creating a brighter tomorrow as empowered women eliminating poverty.

loans.use: To buy fruit at the wholesale price from the market and sell retail to customers.

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
Sulaiman, aged 26, is a farmer engaged mainly in growing tea. He is an old client and has applied for a loan of UGX.1,500,000 to buy fertilizer for high quality tea leaves. 

Sulaiman also sells matooke (a type of starchy banana) to supplement his income. He started tea farming in 2001 in a rural area, and has seen his business grow. His customers are tea traders; their continued support and his tireless effort have helped his business to grow. He started this business to develop a source of income and be able to support his six children who are in school. 

Sulaiman's major challenge in his tea farming is the poor weather in the dry season.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 54-year-old lady. She has an expertise in embroidery, and is using her skill to provide for her family. She is very famous in her circle for providing beautiful designs of hand embroidery. Today she is proud to be famous in her community; to be the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. 

Now she has requested another loan worth 50,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread, along with the packs of beads, sequins and pearls in different colors. She then would be able to target more customers and get an increase in her net income. 

She is in her sixth loan cycle, and has shown excellent repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, along with the packs of beads, sequins and pearls in different colors.

loans.name: Iqbal

texts.en: Iqbal, age 56, is a married woman, doing a business of cattle buying and selling with the help of her husband of many years. She sells cattle in different markets in the city. Her business is good enough to provide her family with a decent living. She is a mother of four children. She is in her second loan cycle and has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR. She intends to utilize the loan amount to purchase more cattle to inflate her sales. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Hameedan

texts.en: Hameedan is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen, age 47, is a married woman. With the support of her husband, three years ago she started selling plastic crockery items such as plates, bowls, and baskets. As her customers are satisfied with the quality of their goods, their demand is increasing day by day. For this reason, Nasreen applied a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more items such as bowls, glasses, plates, and baskets. This will help to grow her sales and profits. 

Nasreen is a mother of six. She dreams of providing quality education to her children for their prosperous future. She is in her 7th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as bowls, glasses, plates, and baskets.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is a 37-year-old married woman and mother of six. She has been running a business trading cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of fabric from the main city and then sells it to people locally. She has become known for selling good quality cloth in her community. 

Najma has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation to buy bundles of different varieties of cloth for the summer season. She takes into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this loan.

loans.use: to buy bundles of different kinds of cloth for the summer season.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 34-year-old married woman. She deals in a business selling animals. After raising small animals for a year or two, she sells them to the people of her locality.  She is very experienced in her work, and earns a good amount of money to contribute to the family income. She has six children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with a good education, food, and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet day to day expenses of life. It’s her sixth year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through support of it. 

Now she requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more animals. She is in her sixth loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Bacilio

texts.es: Bacilio  es habitante de la comunidad san Antonio esta es una comunidad que poco a poco se ha ido poblando  acá ha vivido toda su vida estudio la primaria en la escuela de la comunidad , desde que tenía 12 años aprendió  a trabajar en la agricultura con su papa ya que cosechaban  frijoles , maíz y café  de esta forma el a muy temprana edad  el aprendió a ser un hombre de bien y a ganarse el dinero honradamente , él se esfuerza para sacar adelante a su esposa y sus dos hijos  que son la razón de su vida, en la comunidad no hay energía eléctrica ya que está bien alejada  de donde pasa el tendido eléctrico  es por eso que aplicara a trámite de crédito para comprar un sistema solar para así poder tener energía en la vivienda ya que les hace mucha falta.
texts.en:
Bacilio lives in the San Antonio community, which has begun to populate little by little. He has lived there all of his life. He attended elementary in the community school. He learned how to work in agriculture when he was 12 years old with his father when they harvested beans, maize, and coffee. In this way, he learned how to be a good man from an early age and earn an honest living. He puts effort into improving the lives of his wife and two kids, who are his reasons for living. 

The community does not have any electricity because it is very far from the power network. For this reason, he will ask for a loan to purchase a solar energy system so that he may have energy in his home, which is much needed.

loans.use: to buy a solar power system

loans.name: Fiza

texts.en:
Fiza is a 43-year-old vigorous, married woman. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for many years. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Fiza’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. 

She is a mother of five children. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She dreams of expanding her business and wants to provide a quality life to her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is 31 years old. She is married with two children, aged between 6 and 10. She has been running a butcher business for one year. With this loan, Jeannette would like to buy more cows for getting meat to sell. With the profits from the business she will be able to refurbish her butcher business, to look like a modernized one.

loans.use: to buy more cows for slaughter for her butcher business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 47-year-old married father of three. He is a Palestinian refugee who had to stop his schooling during his intermediate education to start working in a bakery and support his parents. Thirty-six years of experience is enough to provide him with special talents in his domain. In 1982, he opened his own special “Kaak” bakery (a special kind of toasted bread).

Today, due to low business income, Ahmad is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to cover some of his family’s necessary living needs (clothes, shoes, etc.), especially since he has 3 children and he has to make sure they can have a better living.

loans.use: to cover some of his family’s necessary living needs such as clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Mehreen

texts.en: Mehreen is a housewife who lives in Rawalpindi with her family. She is 30 years old and is a mother of four children.  Her husband is a taxi driver by profession and has been driving a taxi for the last seven years. He is an honest and hardworking man. He works day and night to make sure that their daily needs are met. He does not have sufficient income to save for other purposes. As the income that is generated from taxi only covers their daily expenses, they are unable to save money. She has applied for a loan from Brac Pakistan to help her husband to pay for the maintenance cost of the taxi.  After receiving this loan, her husband will be able to repair his taxi. Mehreen and her husband want their children to get a formal education and have a better future.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's taxi repair.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 46-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has become famous for providing good quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is in her third loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Fausto Francisco

texts.es:
Fausto tiene 56 años, es un pequeño productor de café que vive en una comunidad rural al norte de Nicaragua. Tiene nueve hijos con su esposa, junto a la cual maneja su pequeña finca de 28.2 hectáreas, de las cuales 10.6 hectáreas son de café. En los últimos tres años, su producción de café ha mejorado notablemente, dada la atención y mantenimiento que le ha venido brindando a su cultivo.

Este año, además de contar con un préstamo para el mantenimiento de sus cafetales, está solicitando un crédito para la renovación de sus plantaciones, a fin de mejorar la productividad de su finca y con ello los ingresos para su familia.

El sueño de este pequeño productor, es brindar a sus hijos mejores oportunidades y heredarles una finca altamente productiva, que ellos puedan continuar mejorando y ampliando para sus familias.
texts.en:
Fausto, 56, is a small coffee producer who lives in a rural community in the north of Nicaragua.  He has nine children with his wife, with whom he runs a small 28.2-hectare farm, 10.6 of which are coffee.  In the last three years his coffee production has increased significantly, given the attention and maintenance he has been giving to his crop.

This year, in addition to having a loan to maintain his coffee farms, he's requesting a loan to re-plant.  His goal is to improve productivity on his farm as well as his family's income.

This small producer dreams of giving his children better opportunities and leaving them a highly productive farm so they can keep on improving and expanding for their families.

loans.use: to buy inputs to re-plant his coffee farm

loans.name: Akbari

texts.en: Akbari, 41, is a married woman who has been running a business selling bangles and costume jewelry for many years. She offers colorful bangles in various designs and makes enough to provide for her seven children. Akbari has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. At present, she is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase a variety of bangles in different colors. This will help her to consistently fulfill the demands of her customers. She dreams of providing a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of bangles in different colors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Amicha

texts.en:
Amicha is a resident of Dhupguri. She is a 34-year-old illiterate woman who lives with her husband and three school-going children (two sons and one daughter) in Khalaigram in the district of Jalpaiguri. Her children are in grade 12, grade 9 and grade 8. She is a homemaker who looks after her children and husband and also manages her household jobs. In her spare time, she helps her husband in his work.

Amicha's husband, Safikul, 44, is a land cultivator and his family is his greatest priority. He tills his land and grows vegetables. But, he wants to grow paddy on his farmland, as his current income from vegetable cultivation is not satisfactory, and he can hardly cover the expenses with the income. So Amicha, who is an enthusiastic woman, has asked for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner)

She intends to use the loan to buy farm supplies such as manure for paddy cultivation and also to pay for good-quality seeds. She wants to improve their agribusiness using this loan. She hopes that with it, they will be able to improve its conditions and get better results from it so that next year their harvest will be better. This will improve their economic stability and their family’s wellbeing.

She wants to purchase more land with the profit generated from the business.

She is grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Aloka

texts.en:
Aloka, age 36, is an illiterate but hardworking housewife from Dhupguri. She is unfortunate that she could not get the opportunity for education due to the lack of financial resources of her parents. She is married to Shyamal, who is 45 years old and with whom Aloka is rearing two children. She is living with her husband and her two children. Her children are continuing their schooling and are in grade 9 and grade 6.

Both Aloka and her husband have been involved in agricultural activity for many years. They have good knowledge of paddy rice cultivation and vegetable cultivation. They are currently growing paddy rice. They grow good-quality rice.  That's why they have achieved a good many customers. To satisfy their customer demand and for an additional income, they want to grow paddy in a larger quantity.

Thus, Aloka has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). She has requested this loan to expand her agriculture activity. Her ambition is to enlarge the business for which she is receiving financial support and to diversify her activity by growing more paddy rice.

With the loan that she is receiving, Aloka plans to boost her agricultural business, and to do so she will purchase chemical fertilizers and paddy seeds.

She hopes she will develop her business and with the profit, she can improve her family's condition and can give further education in the future. She also wants to save money to construct a better and decent house for them in the future.

She is thankful and grateful to BJS and Kiva for the funding.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality paddy seeds and other agricultural inputs for their paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Abarinzi B Group

texts.en: Vestine is a group leader. She is 36 years old, and married with six children aged between 1 and 17. Three of them go to school. The group is called ABARINZI, which means “Self protector” in English. They sell different products, but they have the same objectives.  Vestine has run a restaurant for the past eight years. With the loan, she would like to buy more equipment to use in restaurant such as spoons, saucepans, forks and dishes. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for their children.

loans.use: to buy more spoons, saucepans and dishes for  the restaurant.

loans.name: Hasina

texts.en:
Hasina is a young entrepreneur of only 21 years old. She is married and from Khalaigram, a small village in Jalpaiguri district. She is the mother of a very young child. She lives with her child and husband in their mud and straw-made house. Sadly, for lack of economic resources, Hasina studied until seventh grade and was unable to pursue further education.

Hasina's husband works hard on family-owned agricultural land, growing seasonal vegetables. He always has high-quality products, which are sold to local retailers for a good price. As the family has only seasonal income, Hasina decided to start dairy farming. She owns a dairy cow. She sells milk and milk products (cottage cheese, butter and curd) in her neighborhood and earns for the family. As their joint income is also insufficient to cover the basic needs of her family, she likes to improve on her business to strengthen the family economy.

So, she has taken a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase one more dairy cow to grow her dairy business. With this new cow, she can start producing more dairy products to sell and satisfy her customers. They also use the milk products for family feeding. She is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure the financial stability of her family.

She is thankful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her existing business.

loans.name: Jonaki

texts.en:
Jonaki is 31 years old and is staying with her husband and her two lovely daughters who are students in grade 6 and grade 9. They live in a remote village, Altagram.  Both Jonaki and her husband are uneducated and can sign their names only.

Her husband has been involved in vegetable and paddy farming for a long time. Jonaki helps her husband in sowing and harvesting the crop. Her husband got the idea of doing paddy cultivation from his father. He started paddy cultivation on a small scale. He has developed a very good relationship with his customers in the village, as he sells fresh and high-quality paddy. He likes the fact that he can cater to the needs of the people in his village. Now, to generate more income, he wants to expand his paddy cultivation.

So, Jonaki wants to help her husband. She came to know about BJS and has taken a loan from them to purchase agricultural materials such as seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides. She hopes this loan will provide them with financial sustenance. She also wants to provide her children with the necessary education so that they will be well prepared for the future and be able to face life more easily.

Her dream is to acquire some agricultural land in the future with the profit.

She gives her hearty thanks to her lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Corazon Valiente Group

texts.es:
Corazón valiente es un grupo solidario que lo integran tres mujeres emprendedoras y laboriosas y esforzadas por el bienestar de sus familias, una de ella es la coordinadora, Doña Antonia de 47 años de edad, casada y madre de siete hijos de los cuales solamente dos depende económicamente de ella de las edades de 19 y 17 años, su negocio ha sido una mini pulpería en la que ofrece productos varios y el crédito lo solicita para invertir en su negocio en Coca Cola, Big Cola, Jugos del Valle, Jugos Eskimo, pan dulce, pan simple, etc., uno de sus logros es que amplio su negocio además que le permitió diversificar los productos que ofrece, una de sus metas es convertir su negocio a una pulpería. 
Otra de las integrantes es la señora Angélica quien tiene la edad de 31 años y su negocio es realizar productos derivados del maíz como es nacatamal, tamal dulce, tamal pisque, etc., ella los comercializa en el mercado de la municipalidad, y la señora Jacinta quien tiene la edad de 49 años y se dedica a la elaboración de canastos artesanales en su domicilio, este negocio lo impulso hace veintiséis años, lo que le ha permitido mejorar la calidad y la clientela.
texts.en:
Corazón Valiente is a communal bank that is comprised of three enterprising and hard-working women who put forth great effort for their families’ well-being.  Antonia, the coordinator, is one of them.  She is 47 years old, married, and has six children.  Only two of them, ages 19 and 17, are financially dependent on her.  Her business has been a mini store where she sells various products.

She is requesting the loan to invest in her business by purchasing Coca Cola, Big Cola, Valle juices, Eskimo juices, sweet bread, and bread, etc.  One of her accomplishments has been expanding her business.  This allowed her to diversify the products that she sells.  One of her goals is to convert her business into a grocery store.

Angélica, age 31, is another member.  Her business is making corn derived products like ‘nacatamal’, ‘tamal dulce’, and ‘tamal pisque’,[different types of tamales] etc.  She sells them at the market in her municipality.

Jacinta, age 49, is also a member.  She makes handmade baskets at her house.  She has been engaged in this business for 26 years.  It has allowed her to improve the quality and her clientele.

loans.use: to buy Coca Cola, Big Cola, Valle juices, Eskimo juices, sweet bread, and bread, etc.

loans.name: Armenia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Armenia works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Armenia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more fish and ingredients for her dried fish making business.

Armenia has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fish and ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Dukorane Group

texts.en: Anonciata is a group leader, age 42. She is married and has five children between the ages of 8 and 18. All of her children go to school. The group is called Dukorane, which means “Let us work together" in English. They sell different items, but they have a common goal of improving their lives. Anonciata owns a retail shop that she has been runing for the past eight years. With the loan, she would like to buy more salt, rice, soap, Colgate pastes and brushes, and maize flour for resale. The profit from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to expand her business inventory.

loans.use: To buy more soaps, rice, maize flour, and other items for resale.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is a 39-year-old, married woman with five dependent children. She sells foodstuff, women’s wear and wax prints. She has been doing this for nine years, from door-to-door. Vida needs a loan to buy foodstuff, women’s wear and wax prints to sell to customers. The profits will be used to pay for household expenses, and to help pay for her children's education. She became a member of ID-Ghana in 2008 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuff, women's wear and wax prints and sell to customers.

loans.name: Mamina

texts.en:
Mamina is a 29-year-old woman who hails from Dhupguri. She lives in the village of Khalaigram in Jalpaiguri District, West Bengal. She did not get the opportunity to receive any formal education because of her poor family condition. She can only sign her name. She is married and has four sons, three of whom are studying at school. Their eldest son is unemployed.

Her husband, Mafijuddin (aged 53 years), is engaged in agriculture and is the only earning member for the family. Mamina is a housewife, though she helps her husband in his agricultural activities. He grows paddy on his own land. His crop has a good customer demand, so he wants to work on it and improve it. But due to inadequate capital, he is unable to expand his agribusiness.

Mamina wants to help her husband. She heard about BJS and that they give financial help to rural women. She has sought a loan from them to purchase quality paddy seeds and fertilizers. 

Her goals are to be able to give her children the opportunity to study further and have smoothness in life, and also to strengthen her family economy. She aspires to construct a concrete-made house for them with the profit.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase quality seeds and fertilizers for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Loyce

texts.en:
Loyce is married, and has six children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

For the past twenty years she has operated a fruit and vegetable selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenges are the high cost of transportation to her place of operation and stiff competition. 

With the KES 45,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe BENKADI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à MISSASSO un village dans la commune de KOLOKOBA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame MINATA débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 3. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The six members of the group “BENKADI 3” are married women, who average 34 years of age and three children each, living for the most part in traditional families in MISSASSO, a village in Commune de KOLOKOBA, in Cercle de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali.) The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan with the institution. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with Ms. MINATA (standing first from the left in the photo of this women’s group BENKADI 3). With her loan, she intends to purchase two 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and a container of herbicide and to pay the cost of plowing to maintain 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village and in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 74,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan with interest and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, herbicides, and plowing

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Emelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Emelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Emelyn is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Flora is 52 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Flora has a fishing business in the Philippines. Flora requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

Flora has been in this business for 20 years. Flora would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is 49 years old and married with five children.

Guillerma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Guillerma has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns additional income from selling fruits.

Guillerma aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Pepita

texts.en:
Pepita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 31 years now.

Pepita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

In the future, Pepita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Leocadia

texts.en:
Leocadia is operating a cosmetics and boutique shop. She is an honest Ugandan married woman who also does tailoring to generate income. 

Leocadia desires to educate her children to university, but she is challenged by competition from fellow businessmen and women reducing her profit margin. 

However, she is getting credit to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, ont en moyenne 6 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à MISSASSO un village dans la commune de KOLOKOBA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est d’arachide avec madame ASSETOU débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group “BENKADI 1” are married women, who average 45 years of age and six children each, living for the most part in traditional families in MISSASSO, a village in Commune de KOLOKOBA, in Cercle de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali.) The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan with the institution. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with Ms. ASSETOU (standing second from the left in the photo of this women’s group BENKADI 1). With her loan, she intends to purchase two 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and a container of herbicide and to pay the cost of plowing to maintain 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village and in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 74,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan with interest and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, herbicides, and plowing

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, ont en moyenne 6 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à MISSASSO un village dans la commune de KOLOKOBA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.
