The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan with the institution. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with Ms. SIGUITIO (standing first from the left in the photo of this women’s group BENKADI 2). With her loan, she intends to purchase two 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and a container of herbicide and to pay the cost of plowing to maintain 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village and in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 74,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan with interest and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, herbicides, and plowing

loans.name: Allin

texts.en:
Allin is 41 years old and married with five children. With three children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Allin's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Allin has restarted her native basket-making business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Allin has taken a PHP 7,000 housing loan through NWTF to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Allin is committed to rebuild her devastated life, and in future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Carlotta

texts.en:
Carlotta is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Carlotta is 52 years old, and one of her children is still in school.

Carlotta has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Carlotta requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Carlotta has been in this business for 10 years. Carlotta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is a thirty-one-year-old hardworking married woman with one child, aged three years. She lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. She deals in the selling of secondhand clothes as her main source of income. 

The main reason is to cater to her family’s needs, though she faces a challenge of competition and seasonal markets for her clothes. She has hopes of owning a wholesale boutique and educating her child.

She is requesting a loan to buy more secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace is a resident of Kyenjojo, Uganda. She is 26 years old, and a mother of three children. She is a hardworking woman and a cattle trader. She buys cattle and fattens them to mature faster for the market. She earns extra income from pool table games. She has dreams of educating her children and penetrating urban markets for her business; however, she is faced with lack of enough capital and transport challenges to serve different market segments.

She wants a loan to buy more cattle for fattening and selling.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening and selling

loans.name: Nancy Patricia

texts.es:
Nancy es una mujer de 27 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene dos hijos y se dedica a la venta de comida rápida.
Ella es emprendedora, luchadora, amable, positiva, puntual, responsable, ordenada, entusiasta, cooperativa, precisa y, muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ ubicado al sur de la ciudad de santa cruz, un lugar caracterizado por el comercio y el constante crecimiento de su población.
Nancy es de tez morena, cabello largo negro, estatura mediana y vestimenta  a la moda, su negocio es la atención de un restaurante tipo snack. Los restaurantes snack brinda el servicio de comida rápida como ser; pollo frito, hamburguesas con papas fritas, salchipapas, choripán, etc.
Nancy ocupa su jornada diaria en la atención y cuidado de sus dos hijos, ayudando a sus tareas diarias de la escuela y también preparando la comida para su snack. El restaurante abre sus puertas a partir de las seis de la tarde hasta la media noche de lunes a domingo, dónde decenas de clientes disfrutan de comidas rápidas o al paso. Nancy quiere realizar la compra de un puesto de comida rápida para ampliar su negocio, debido a la demanda del lugar y de esa manera generar mejores ingresos económicos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Es por esos motivos que Nancy solicita un préstamo para la compra de un puesto de comida rápida y con lo beneficios ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Nancy is a woman of 27. She lives with her partner and has two sons. She sells fast food.

She is entrepreneurial, tenacious, friendly, positive, punctual, responsible, organized, enthusiastic, cooperative, precise, and very hard-working. She carries out her business in the "Plan 3000" zone located to the south of the city of Santa Cruz, a place characterized by commerce and the constant growth of its population.

Nancy has a dark complexion, long black hair, medium stature, and stylish clothing. Her business is tending to a snack-type restaurant. Snack restaurants offer fast food service with such items as fried chicken, hamburgers with French fries, salchipapas (a dish containing beef and French fries ), choripán (chorizo sandwiches), and so forth.

Nancy fills her daily schedule with tending to and caring for her two children, helping with the daily schoolwork, and also preparing the food for her snack restaurant. The restaurant opens its doors from 6 pm until midnight from Monday to Sunday, and tons of customers enjoy the fast food or take it out. Nancy wants to purchase a fast food stand to expand her business due to the demand in the area, and in this way she will generate more income to improve the quality of life of her family.

It is for these reasons that Nancy is applying for a loan to purchase a fast food stand and use the earnings to help her family.

loans.use: to buy a fast food stand and use the earnings to help her family.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es: El socio Virgilio se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia,el socio tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra maiz y papa el socio tambie se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de agricultura. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.
texts.en: The borrower Virgilio is continuing to make a living in the livestock business. The borrower has a piece of land where he harvests corn and potatoes. He also continues to make a living in transportation. The borrower works from 8 AM until 6 PM . He has already has been in business for several years and he is doing very well. His dream is to expand his agriculture business. The borrower is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 45 years old and has four children. Carmen is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Carmen and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Carmen is taking out a housing loan amounting to 9,700 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Carmen has been an NWTF borrower since 2001.

With your help, Carmen can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Tuvyumvakumwe Group

texts.fr:
Salvator fait partie du groupe  Tuvyumvakumwe et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 35 ans et est marié à 
Pascaline ,une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 3 à 11 ans, dont 3 étudient.

Il a sous sa charge 1 enfant membre de sa famille élargie, qui étudie. 

Il fait le commerce de boutique( piles,bougie,bonbon,...)  depuis  7 ans. 


Il est son deuxième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d'articles de sa boutique( piles,bonbon, bougie,...), à revendre pour gagner plus. 


Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  construire une maison d'habitation ,et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Salvator is part of the group Tuvyumvakumwe and lives in Bujumbura. He is 35 years old and married to Pascaline, a merchant. Together they have four children, from 3 to 11 years old, of whom four are students.

Salvator supports a member of his extended family who is a child and a student. 

Salvator has been a shopkeeper (batteries, candles, candy, …) for seven year. 

He is on his second Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and to purchase many items for his shop (batteries, candy, candles,…) to resell, so as to earn more

In the coming years, he would like to build a house and to see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase many items for his shop (batteries, candies, candy,…) to resell, so as to earn more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additonal poultry

loans.name: Twisungane Cb Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is a group leader. She is  51 years old. She is married with two children aged 14 and 19; both of them go to school. 

The group is Twisungane, which means “Let's help each other" in English. They sell different products, but they share the common aspect of life of changing their lives through handiwork. 

Beatrice prepares and sells blocks/bricks for building. With the loan, she would like to have more tons of bricks so that she earns more. The profits from the business will used to pay school fees for her children, and provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy and own more tons of bricks for sale.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 48 years old and married. Anita works very hard to provide for the family.

Anita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like coffee, detergent soap, canned goods, bath soap, coffee, eggs, etc., to sell.

Anita has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, detergent soap, canned goods, bath soap, coffee, eggs, etc. 

Anita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like coffee, detergent soap, canned goods, bath soap, coffee, eggs, etc. to sell

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en: Augustine is a 39-year-old man. He is married with three children and he lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He owns a retail shop selling general merchandise, and obtains other income from brewing “waragi.” He is hard-working and began the business so as to be able to pay school fees for the children. He hopes to expand his retail shop though he mainly faces a challenge of high prices of the commodities. Augustine is requesting the loan to buy more stock of bread, soft drinks and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy more bread, soft drinks and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy underwear, pants, skirts, blouses, t-shirts and stylish clothing in order to have a more competitive business

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es:
Augusto tiene 50 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 06 hijos dependientes, Augusto vive con sus hijos y su conyugue, él cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales por parte de sus vecinos, vive en el caserío de Pandachin, distrito Cañarís, provincia de Ferreñafe, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. En dicho caserío la población se dedica a la agricultura siendo el cultivo de café el de mayor producción, a la ganadería y alcomercio.

Augusto se dedica a la cría y comercio de ganado vacuno, él cuenta con invernas propias donde cría su ganado vacuno, los cuales lo comercializa todos los viernes, pues él lleva a su ganado vacuno para comercializarlos en el Puerto de Chiple; Augusto cuenta con más de 05 años de experiencia en el rubro, además se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con cultivos de café, el préstamo lo solicita porque desea invirtir en su negocio comprando una cantidad mayor de animales y alimento de engorde para los mimos y así poder adquirir una utilidad acéptale para que mejoren sus inrgesos, aumenten sus ganancias y por consecuente mejore también su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Augosto, age 50, is married and has six dependent children.  Augusto lives with his wife and children.  He says that he has very good personal references from his neighbors.  He lives in the Pandachin settlement in the Cañaris district, Ferreñafe province, Lambayeque region.  It is on the northern coast of Peru.  The population in his community devotes itself to agriculture, coffee being its greatest production, livestock, and commerce.

Augusto raises and sells cattle.  He has his own winter pastures where he raises his cattle.  He sells them every Friday.  He takes his cattle to the Chiple port to sell.  Augusto has over five years of experience in the field.  In addition to this business activity, he has coffee crops.

He is requesting the loan because he wishes to invest in his business by purchasing more animals and animal feed to fatten them.  This way he will be able to get an acceptable profit in order to improve his income.  His earnings will increase, and, consequentially, his quality of life and that of his family will also improve.

loans.use: to buy animals and animal feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Sergio  Aristeo

texts.es: Sergio  tiene 42 años de edad  nació y habita actualmente en la comunidad  el sardinal creció en una familia bien numerosa rodeado de sus hermanos, gracias al apoyo de sus padres él fue a la escuela y termino toda la primaria esto es algo que le ha servido ya que es tan importante saber leer y escribir aunque hubiese deseado dice haber aprendido más, pero no fue posible es por eso que ahora que él tiene sus hijos en los apoya y motiva a que vayan a la escuela , él vive en su humilde hogar con su esposa y 5 hijos que han procreado del matrimonio . él se dedica a sembrar granos básicos , los que una vez que los cosecha los comercializa y otra parte los deja para consumo del hogar , viven a oscuras en esta comunidad porque no hay energía eléctrica , él y su familia dice usan candiles para poder iluminarse , está optando por  realizar  tramite de crédito para asi poder comprar un pequeño sistema solar para  instalarlo su hogar
texts.en:
Sergio is 42 years old. He was born in the community of El Sardinal,  where he currently lives. 

He grew up in a large family surrounded by his siblings. Thanks to his parents' support he went to school and completed primary education. This has served him well, since it is so important to know how to read and write, although he would have wished to continue learning, he says, but that was not possible. This is why now that he has children, he supports and encourages them to go to school. 

He lives in a humble home of his own with his wife and five children born from the marriage. He makes a living growing basic grains to harvest and sell, leaving a part for household consumption. They live without electricity since there is none available for this community, he says, so he and his family use oil lamps for lighting. He decided to request a loan to buy and install a small solar system for his home.

loans.use: to buy a solar system.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her food vending business and is now requesting a 9,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Merlyn will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Merlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Renida

texts.en:
Renida is 44 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, Renida works very hard to provide for them.

Renida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Renida has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, juice, milk, cereals, canned goods, soft drinks, etc. 

Renida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Fotemogoban 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à NIELEPEBOUGOU un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame FATOUMATA débout au milieu  sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group “BENKADI 1” are married women, who average 40 years of age and three children each, living for the most part in traditional families in NIELEPEBOUGOU, a village in Commune de LOULOUNI, in Cercle de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali.) The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the institution. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is rice, as is the case with Ms. FATOUMATA (standing in the middle in the photo of this women’s group BENKADI 1). With her loan, she intends to purchase two 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and two containers of herbicide and to pay the cost of plowing to maintain 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village and in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 74,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan with interest and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, herbicides, and plowing

loans.name: Dúo San Francisco Group

texts.es: Dúo San Francisco está formado por doña Aura Elizabeth quien tiene 32 años y 2 hijas (7 y 2) ella tiene una pequeña tienda ubicada en su vivienda en vista hermosa hace mas de 4 años, vende productos de consumo diario (azúcar, frijol, golosinas, papel higiénico, etc.) y venta de ropa y calzado para niños, este es su segunda crédito  y ella solicita un nuevo crédito para invertir en su negocio ya que no cuenta con suficiente efectivo para surtir mejor su negocio ya que en este tiempo han incrementado mas sus ventas su mayor sueño es poder lograr agrandar mas su negocio y  poder realizar un ahorro para la educación de sus hijos en el futuro.
texts.en: Dúo San Francisco consists of two members. Aura Elizabeth is 32 years old and has two children ages 7 and 2. She has had a small store located in a beautiful space in her home for more than 4 years. She sells basic groceries (sugar, beans, candy, toilet paper, etc.) and also children's clothing and shoes. This is her second loan and sh seeks a new loan to invest in her business as she doesn't have enough cash to better stock her business and during this season her sales are increasing. Her primary dream is to be able to expand her business more and be able to save for her children's future education expenses.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Fotemogoban 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à NIELEPEBOUGOU un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame DJENEBA débout au milieu  sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.

The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the institution. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is rice, as is the case with Ms. DJENEBA (standing in the middle in the photo of this women’s group BENKADI 2). With her loan, she intends to purchase two 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and two containers of herbicide and to pay the cost of plowing to maintain 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village and in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 74,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan with interest and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, herbicides, and plowing

loans.name: Renida

texts.en:
Renida is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Renida is 44 years old and has three children who are in school.

Renida's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Renida is taking out a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Renida has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Renida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce used the previous loan to buy more fruits for selling. She is still in the same business and is disturbed by losses caused by the perishable nature of her stock. Besides that, she has hopes of making a big hotel. Joyce needs a loan to buy bananas for selling.

loans.use: to buy bananas for sale.

loans.name: Dukundukuri Cb Group

texts.en:
Francine is a group leader, aged 52. She is married with five children aged between 12 and 35; they all go to school. The group is called DUKUNDUKURI, which means “let us be honest” in English. They sell different merchandises, but they have something in common, which is to make their businesses more rewarding and help uplift their living standards.

Francine has sold foodstuffs for the past six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, cassava, sorghum and maize flour for sale. The profit from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs such as beans, cassava and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Bedford

texts.en:
Benford, 23, is a very passionate dairy farmer based near Chuka, Kenya. He is a young bachelor with an untamed ambition to make a difference. Benford has been doing mixed farming for the last five years to fend for himself. His primary income sources are milk and tea. To make extra income, he is involved in other personal businesses.

He stated that the part he most enjoys is when he is collecting returns. His biggest challenge is lack of capital. 

Benford is seeking a loan to purchase an additional dairy cow. The additional milk will help fulfill the current demand. With the loan, he is going for a productive animal, which will on average produce 15 litres of milk per day. Having understood the market requirements, he wants to expand the dairy farm in a modern manner with more animals so that he can diversify the farm’s products. 

Your loan will help Benford make enough money to afford the high farming expenses. He stated that the loan will benefit his family by providing him with the financial ability to improve their livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en:
Ekaterine is a 34-year-old married woman from Senaki district, West Georgia. She lives with her husband, daughter and pensioner parents-in-law. Ekaterine is unemployed. In the region, there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living. 

So, Ekaterine decided to start a nuts trading business with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Ekaterine’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she doesn’t satisfy their requirements. 

She received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, the so-called Startup Program, which gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With the loan of $1,500, she will purchase nuts and will resell them at a higher price to generate income.

loans.use: to begin trade in nuts and generate income.

loans.name: Fotemogoban 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 7 membres du groupe BENKADI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans, ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à NIELEPEBOUGOU un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame AWA A assises au milieu  sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 3. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,25 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 35 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The seven members of the group “BENKADI 3” are married women, who average 26 years of age and two children each, living for the most part in traditional families in NIELEPEBOUGOU, a village in Commune de LOULOUNI, in Cercle de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali.) The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the institution. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is rice, as is the case with Ms. AWA (sitting in the middle in the photo of this women’s group BENKADI 3). With her loan, she intends to purchase a 50-kg sack of fertilizer and a container of herbicide and to pay the cost of plowing to maintain 0.25 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village and in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 35,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan with interest and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, herbicides, and plowing

loans.name: Haguruka Cb Group

texts.en: Marthe is a group leader, aged 53. She is married with two children aged between 22 and 26. The group is called Haguruka which means "stand up." They sell different items, but they have the same goal of improving their lives. Marthe owns a shop which she has been running for the past eight years. With the loan she would like to buy more rice, soaps, salt, and Omo for resale. The profit from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy rice, soaps, salt and Omo for resale.

loans.name: Jiguisseme 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe JIGUISSEME 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à NIANKOROBOUGOU un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame FATOUMATA assises au milieu  sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme JIGUISSEME 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.

The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan with the institution. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is rice, as is the case with Ms. FATOUMATA (sitting in the middle in the photo of this women’s group JIGUISSEME 1). With her loan, she intends to purchase two 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and two containers of herbicide and to pay the cost of plowing to maintain 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village and in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 74,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan with interest and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, herbicides, and plowing

loans.name: Jiguisseme 2 Group

Les 6 membres du groupe JIGUISSEME 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à NIANKOROBOUGOU un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.

This profit will enable her to pay back her loan with interest and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, herbicides, and plowing

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane lives in Vanadzor town with her husband. Her two sons live and work abroad as migrants. Gayane is a musician. She teaches at a local music school and also provides individual classes from her house. In a small room, Gayane organizes piano classes for her students.

To improve the quality of her classes, Gayane has applied for this loan. It will enable her to purchase music books, a metronome, and a chair needed to provide piano classes. 

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The business start-up loan program provides loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for music books, a metronome, and a chair needed to provide piano classes

loans.name: Biail

texts.es:
Biail, es felizmente casada y con su esposo ya tienen dos hijos, todos viven juntos, por la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, inicio su propio negocio el cual consiste en vender tortillas y administrar una mini tienda en la que ofrece productos de primera necesidad, el negocio lo aprendió de su madre siendo una niña, el horario de venta de tortillas es de seis de la mañana a nueve de la mañana y de una de la tarde a cuatro de la tarde, mientras que en la tienda ofrece sus servicios todo el día.
Utilizará el crédito para comprar una refrigeradora en la que almacenara nuevos productos que ofrecerá en el negocio, para atraer nuevos clientes, incrementar las ventas e ingresos, así contara con recursos económicos para mejorar las circunstancias familiares y cancelar con buena calificación su deuda.
Biail, sueña con tener una tienda más fuerte y contar con su fuente de ingresos funcionando.
texts.en:
Biail is happily married and lives with her husband and two children. She needs to help her husband with the household expenses so she began her own business selling tortillas and managing a mini-store that sells basic need items. She learned this work as a child from her mother. She sells tortillas 6-9 AM and 1-4 PM, and keeps her store open all day.

She will use the loan to buy a refrigerator from which she will sell new products in her business. This will enable her to attract new customers, increase sales and income, thus providing the economic resources to improve her family's economic situation and repay her loan promptly. Biail dreams of have a successful store and being able to depend on her business for income.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator from which to sell new products that she will offer in her business.

loans.name: Roberto William

texts.es:
Roberto, vive en casa de su madre, es acompañado; su padre se encargó de enseñarle a cultivar maíz, plátano y pipián siendo un niño, cuando inicio a independizarse solamente cultivaba media manzana de maíz, posteriormente poco a poco su área de cultivo creció hasta lograr tener más tipos de cultivos, su negocio funciona desde hace 10 años.
El capital será de utilidad para comprar fertilizantes, insecticidas, plaguicidas, semilla, abono y pagara mozos, fortalecerá su negocio y limpiara el terreno de la maleza que pueda afectar el buen desarrollo de los cultivos, espera tener una mejor productividad, continuar generando ingresos para cumplir con sus obligaciones y cultivar nuevamente de inmediato.
Sus aspiraciones son comprar sus propios terrenos para dejar de alquilar, agregar nuevos cultivos y construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Roberto is married and lives in his mother's house. When he was a boy his father taught him how to grow corn, banana and squash. When he grew up he only grew corn on a small plot of land. Later little by little he expanded his crop land in order to have a variety of crops, and his farming business has been going for 10 years now.

The loan will be used to buy insecticides, pesticides, seed, manure, and pay for labor which will strengthen his business and he will keep his land free from the pestilences that could impact his crops. He hopes to have a better crop production, and to continue generating income to meet his financial obligations and replant immediately. His dreams are to buy his own land and stop renting land, to add new crops and to build his own house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, pesticides, seed, manure, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah runs a retail shop that sells general merchandise. She is married and responsible for taking care of five children. She lives in Masindi, Uganda. She also does livestock farming to earn a living. She ventured into business so as to meet her family's increasing demands. She hopes to expand her business into a big supermarket however constant price fluctuation affects her business.

Fridah needs a loan to to buy more general merchandise.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as detergents, sugar and sweets.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is a 59-year-old married man with three children, aged 17, 10 and 8 years, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He practices farming as his main source of income, though he is also an LCI (local council) chairman of his village. He started this business to earn a living and look after his family. He faces challenges of inadequate capital and weather changes. However, he has a dream of becoming a model farmer in his area.

Ben is requesting a loan to buy manure for his farm.

loans.use: to buy manure for his farm.

loans.name: Madinah

texts.en:
Madinah is 48 years old. She lives in the town of Masindi in Uganda. She sells general merchandise like soap, sugar, and rice. She started her business to support her family. She hopes to educate her children. Poor weather and seasonal changes affect her business.

Madinah wants a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his horticulture farming.

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es:
José de 19 años de edad, estudio en la escuela hasta 7° grado, su compañera de vida se dedica a oficios domésticos y a cuidar de su hija que tiene 18 meses de nacida,  en el mismo terreno pero en diferente casa vive su mamá.

José desde que tenía 12 años, se dedicaba al trabajo de agricultura, luego vio que la seguridad del país estaba fallando y decidió pertenecer al cuerpo militar y así también incrementar un poco los ingresos económicos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para construir una pequeña casa, donde puedan vivir más seguros su esposa y su pequeña hija,  pues la vivienda actual es de bahareque pues se cansó de andar alquilando y su salario no era lo suficiente, pues él ha venido viviendo en una familia muy numerosa.

José es un joven que tiene muchos sueños como construir su propia casa y no volver a lo del alquiler, pues comenta que esa vida es muy dura y no quiere que su hija crezca en ese medio. Por eso pide que kiva le ayude a realizar su sueño.
texts.en:
Jose is 19 years old and has a 7th grade education.  His life partner cares for the home and their 18-month-old daughter.  His mother lives on the same piece of land, but in a different house.

Jose has been farming since he was 12 years old.  He then saw the nation’s security failing, so he joined the military and was able to increase his income a bit this way.

He is asking for this loan to build a small house where he, his wife, and daughter can live more securely.  Their current house is made of adobe and he got tired of renting, but his salary was not enough and he is from a large family.

Jose is a young man with lots of dreams, like building his own house and not having to rent.  He says that it’s tough life this way and he doesn’t want his daughter to grow up like this, so he is asking for Kiva’s help in realizing his dream.

loans.use: to build a small house.

loans.name: Carlos Arquimides

texts.es:
Carlos de 27 años de edad, es agricultor, estudio hasta bachillerato como nivel académico.  La esposa es maestra, han procreado dos hijos.

Carlos se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 12 años de edad, el padre siempre le enseño este trabajo ya que ellos como familia se han dedicado solo a la agricultura y el padre lo inculco a este trabajo para cuando él ya estuviera en hogar aparte pudiera defenderse; pero también Carlos ha decidido comprar una vaca, por el momento tiene 5 ganados, pero solo una es vaca y quiere comprar una más, ya que le está dando leche y esto ve que le puede dar ganancias mejor que la agricultura, es por eso que quiere dedicarse a esto pero en la actualidad la agricultura le queda a una distancia de 15 minutos de donde vive y viaja a pie, en un horario de las 6:00 am a las 12:00 md.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar una vaca. De esa manera, será un aporte a la casa ayudándole a la esposa, ya que por el momento es ella quien cubre algunos gastos,  ya que él no ha podido encontrar trabajo pero esto le ayudara mucho.

Los sueños de Carlos son tener un corral lleno de ganado y de vacas lecheras y vender los terneros y esto lo lograra con la ayuda de los créditos y con el esfuerzo de él y de su esposa.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 27, is a farmer.  He went to school through high school.  His wife is a teacher, and they have two children.

Carlos has worked in agriculture since he was 12 years old.  His father always taught him this work because, as a family, they only worked in agriculture.  His father involved him in this work so that he could take care of himself when he had his own home.  However, Carlos has decided to buy a cow.  He now has five head of cattle.  However, only one is a cow, and he wants to buy one more.  This is because it is giving him milk, and he sees that this is able to give him better income than agriculture.  That is why he wants to work at this.  His agriculture is now 15 minutes from where he lives, and he gets there by foot.  His schedule is from 6:00 a.m. until 12:00 p.m.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy a cow.  This will be a contribution to the household and a help to his wife.  At the moment she is the one who covers some of the expenses.  This is because he has not been able to find work, and this would help him a lot.

Carlos’s dreams are to have a farmyard full of livestock and dairy cows and to sell the calves.  He will achieve this with the help of the loan and with effort from him and his wife.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de cinq (5) femmes, les membres du groupe Djantoyerela sont majoritairement  mariées et vie dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 31 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Ouenzindougou commune de Mandé dans le cercle de Kati. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe mènent  des activités génératrices de revenu  identique, uniquement la vente des savons. Dans  le souci d’élargir et d’agrandir   leurs activités, elles ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso et sont  à 2ème  prêt  en solidaire.
Madame Sitan (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une bonne notoriété, car les savons sont très prisés par les femmes à Kanadjiguila. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de la matière première pour la préparation du savon ensuite ils sont destinés à la vente. Elles s’approvisionnent à Médine.  Elle mène ses activités au comptant  à Ouenzindougou à une clientèle de femmes. Madame compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen de 45 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour satisfaire son besoin et investir le reste dans son activité. Madame a pour objectif de fidéliser  ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’en profiter beaucoup de prêt.
texts.en:
Composed of five women, the group Djantoyerela has members who are married for the most part in monogamous households. The women average 31 years of age and three children each, and they all live in Ouenzindougou, Commune de Mandé, in Cercle de Kati. The women know one another through their tontines and their revenue-generating businesses in the district. The group members all have the identical revenue-generating businesses, just the selling of soap. 

Concerned about expanding their businesses, they decided to turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan.

Ms. Sitan (the woman sitting at the far right in the photo) has a good reputation, since soaps are highly prized by the women in Kanadjiguila. She intends to use her loan to purchase the raw materials for making soap to be sold later. She gets her supplies in Médine. She operates her business accepting cash from a customer base of women in Ouenzindougou.

With this loan, Ms. Sitan plans on making an average profit of 45,000 francs CFA per month that will be used to meet her needs. And the rest will be reinvested in her business. Her goal is to develop loyalty in this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to take advantage of many loans.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making soap

loans.name: Giradi

texts.en: Giradi lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is a single mother with three children. She runs a retail shop that sells general merchandise supplemented by phone charging to increase her income. She started the business so as to be self-employed and look after her family as the only breadwinner. She hopes to educate her children. However, she is challenged by competition and general price fluctuations. Giradi is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise like sugar, soap, clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like sugar, soap, clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 5 membres du groupe  BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans, ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à QUEMASSO un village dans la commune de DIOMATENE dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame FATOUMATA C debout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  BENKADI 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The five members of the group “BENKADI 2” are married women, who average 25 years of age and two children each, living for the most part in traditional families in QUEMASSO, a village in Commune de DIOMATENE, in Cercle de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali.) The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their third farm loan with the institution. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is rice, as is the case with Ms. FATOUMATA  C (standing second from the left in the photo of this women’s group BENKADI 2). With her loan, she intends to purchase two 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and two containers of herbicide and to pay the cost of plowing to maintain 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village and in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 74,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan with interest and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, herbicides, and plowing

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Poultry farming is one of the profitable business ventures in Kenya. Patrick, 34 years, is a mixed farmer from Kitale, a rural town in Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for the past two years. This hardworking father of six earns his livelihood through selling milk, crops and some personal business he engages in when the harvests are low. 

He passionately loves poultry farming, and rearing chickens is his hobby. Every day he wakes up in the morning to collect eggs and feed his chickens, and he finds this very fulfilling. Neighbors have been flocking to his compound to buy eggs, and through word of mouth, news has spread like fire in the whole village that he has quality eggs. The demand is so high, he cannot fully satisfy it. He is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Through the loan, he will be able to satisfy the demand, and this will translate to increased income level. 

Through Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders, Patrick believes that small-scale farmers like him will be able to benefit from financial solutions. Poultry meat is a very popular meal among many people in his village, and this translates to improved income and better living standards. Patrick will sell eggs for commercial purposes and for home consumption. Increased income will allow Patrick to provide nothing but the best for his family and improve his living conditions. Other than profits, he will benefit from poultry manure and poultry feathers, which will help improve his life.

loans.use: to purchase additional poultry.

loans.name: Kotognogontala 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KOMALA un village dans la commune de KIGNAN dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame MAMOU assises au milieu  sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme KOTOGNOGONTALA 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group “KOTOGNOGONTALA 1” are married women, who average 41 years of age and five children each, living for the most part in traditional families in KOMALA, a village in Commune de KIGNAN, in Cercle de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali.) The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their ninth farm loan with the institution. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is rice, as is the case with Ms. MAMOU (sitting in the middle in the photo of this women’s group KOTOGNOGONTALA 1). With her loan, she intends to purchase two 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and two containers of herbicide and to pay the cost of plowing to maintain 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village and in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 74,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan with interest and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, herbicides, and plowing

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr:
Les 5 membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, ont en moyenne 6 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KOMALA un village dans la commune de KIGNAN dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame WOMA debout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme KOTOGNOGONTALA 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 60 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The five members of the group “KOTOGNOGONTALA 2” are married women, who average 45 years of age and six children each, living for the most part in traditional families in KOMALA, a village in Commune de KIGNAN, in Cercle de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali.) The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their ninth farm loan with the institution. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is rice, as is the case with Ms. WOMA (standing second from the left in the photo of this women’s group KOTOGNOGONTALA 2). With her loan, she intends to purchase two 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and a container of herbicide and to pay the cost of plowing to maintain 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village and in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 60,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan with interest and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, herbicides, and plowing

loans.name: Jiguisseme 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 5 membres du groupe JIGUISSEME 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à NIANKOROBOUGOU un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame KADIATOU debout au milieu  sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme JIGUISSEME 3. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 25 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 36 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The five members of the group “JIGUISSEME 3” are married women, who average 42 years of age and five children each, living for the most part in traditional families in NIANKOROBOUGOU, a village in Commune de LOULOUNI, in Cercle de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali.) The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their seventh farm loan with the institution. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is rice, as is the case with Ms. KADIATOU (standing in the middle in the photo of this women’s group JIGUISSEME 3). With her loan, she intends to purchase a 50-kg sack of fertilizer and a container of herbicide and to pay the cost of plowing to maintain 0.25 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village and in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 36,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan with interest and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, herbicides, and plowing

loans.name: Creciendo Con Fe Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario lo integran tres socios laboriosos y emprendedores que lo coordina el señor Alejandro quien tiene la edad de 28 años, casado y padre de dos hijos de las edades de 7 y 4 años, por quienes se ha propuesto superarse, es propietario de una pulpería desde hace siete años, y solicita el crédito para la compra de granos básicos como es arroz, frijol, aceite, queso, leche, pan, chiverías, gaseosas, jugos, papel higiénico, toallas sanitarias, etc. Los otros integrantes son jóvenes emprendedores uno de ellos Josselin de 18 años de edad propietaria de pulpería, y María Alejandra de 19 años propietaria de una pulpería. Este grupo es la primera vez que solicitan el financiamiento en esta institución y se han propuesto como meta pagar a tiempo sus cuotas y crecer en el ámbito de los negocios.
texts.en:
This communal bank is comprised of three hard-working and enterprising members.  Alejandro, age 28, is the coordinator.  He is married and has two children, ages 7 and 4.  It is for them that he has set out to improve himself.  He has had a grocery store for seven years.

He is requesting the loan to buy basic goods like rice, beans, cooking oil, cheese, milk, bread, snacks, soft drinks, juice, toilet paper, and sanitary napkins, etc.

The other members are young entrepreneurs.  Josselin, age 18, is one of them.  She has a grocery store.  María Alejandra, age 19 has a grocery store.  

This is the first time that this group has requested a loan with this institution.  They have set their goal to make their payments on time and to grow in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy basic needs products.

loans.name: Tonny

texts.en:
Tonny is a 38-year-old male living in Masindi, Uganda. He does welding and has a motorcycle transport business that adds to his income. He started the business to cater for the family needs, having failed to get formal employment. He wishes to educate his children, though challenged by inadequate capital.
Tonny will use the loan to buy welding materials.

loans.use: to buy welding materials.

loans.name: Esmilda

texts.es:
Esmilda tiene 43 años de edad, es conviviente, ella tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en el distrito de Nanchoc, en una zona rural, de la provincia de San Miguel, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Esmilda se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, con más de 8 años de experiencia, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de más animales, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; Esmilda piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender las diversas gustos y necesidades de sus clientes; lo que le generá mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su toda su familia.
texts.en:
Esmilda is 43 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children.  She lives with her family in the Nanchoc district, within the rural zone of the San Miguel privince, in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

Esmilda raises and sells animals and she has been doing this for eight years out of her home.  She is asking for this loan to buy more animals so she can have a greater variety and greater production.

Esmilda wants to increase her stock of animals so she can better tend to her customers’ needs and likes.  This will generate more income, better profits, and provide a better quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy animals.

loans.name: Panajachelense Group

texts.en:
The Trust Bank “Panajachelense” is the name of the seven members who live in the town of Panajachel, a beautiful place on the shores of Lake Atitlan in Western Guatemala. All of the women are entrepreneurs and owners of businesses that are engaged in the sale of food, clothing, cosmetics and jewelry. After successfully finishing the first loan cycle with Kiva founds, the ladies are applying for their second loan cycle. 

Among the members of Panajachelense is Gladys, who is 46 years old with six children and only six years of formal education. Her vision is to create a better life for her children. Gladys’ vision has motivated her to develop an Internet Café business that offers photocopying and printing services as well as the sale of computer accessories.

In order to satisfy her young clients’ demands for state-of-the-art technology, she needs capital to provide additional services. Gladys plans to use the next loan to expand her business to offer computer repair as well as sell computer accessories such as USB thumb drives and printer ink. 

The whole group has an average of only eight years of formal education. They all say that the Friendship Bridge Educational Program has improved their practical skills and has contributed to the positive development of their families and their community.

Panajachelense sends its deepest gratitude to the investors of Kiva for believing in them and their businesses.

loans.use: to expand her business to offer computer repair as well as sell computer accessories such as USB thumb drives and printer ink.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is a 40-year-old man living in Masindi, Uganda. He deals in produce, buying and selling such things as soya beans and maize, depending on the season. He started this business after realizing the importance of self-employment, having been inspired by his friends. He wishes to expand his business into new markets by opening other stores in nearby towns. Weather and poor roads affect his business. Lawrence needs a loan to buy more soya beans.

loans.use: to buy more soya beans for resale

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 38-year-old female living in Masindi, Uganda. She sells used clothes and does farming to boost her income. She started the business to support her family's needs and supplement her husband's income. She wishes to build a commercial house and pay school fees for her children; however, she is challenged by seasonal changes that affect her business.
Monica intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sopio

texts.en:
Sopio is 26 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia. Her husband works as a distributor and gets a small salary, which is the only source of income. Sopio is unemployed. 

In the region, there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living. So, Sopio decided to start a clothing trading business with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Sopio’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she doesn’t satisfy their requirements. 

She received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, the so-called Startup Program, which gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With the loan of $300, she will purchase clothes and linens at wholesale prices and will resell them at a higher price to generate income. 

Sopio awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin a trade in clothes and linens in order to generate income.

loans.name: Diodora

texts.en:
Diodora is 46-years-old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Diodora works very hard to provide for them.

Diodora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like candies, soft-drinks, toothpaste, eggs, biscuits and other groceries to sell.

Diodora has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as candies, soft-drinks, toothpaste, eggs, biscuits and other groceries. 

Diodora would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like candies, soft-drinks, toothpaste, eggs, biscuits and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Dominga is 40-years-old and has two children who are currently in school.

Dominga has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Dominga requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Dominga has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Dominga would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support her family. Lilia is married and has a furniture making business in the Philippines.

Lilia requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials like wood, nails, paints, etc. for her business.

Lilia has been in this business for five years now.

In the future Lilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like wood, nails, paints, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more of merchandise for his grocery store

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal is a married male with two children - one attends school. He carries out farming whereby he grows bananas for selling. He also earns a salary as an additional source of income. He started his business to earn a living after finding out that his salary alone could not sustain his family. He sells his products to hotels. He has hopes of getting enough money to educate his children even though he is affected by weather changes.

Micheal wants a loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a thirty-four-year-old male. He deals in the transportation business and his clients are traveling people. He began this business to increase his income. John hopes to construct a school in future. He faces the challenges of poor roads which lead to mechanical breakdowns and high fuel prices.

John wants a loan to service his vehicle.

loans.use: to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a married woman. She has four children, all of whom attend school. Martha owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Martha operates a rental housing business. Her customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from competitors in her business.
 
With the KES 20,000 she wants to expand a room in her house to let. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to expand a room in her house to let.

loans.name: Tony Angel

texts.es:
Tony, manifiesta que en la institución se le brinda un buen servicio y facilidad de pago, por lo que se ha decidido a solicitar un nuevo préstamo para realizar la compra de semilla, abono e insecticidas, el resto será de utilidad para pagar el arrendamiento del terreno en el que sembrara.
Tony realizo la recolecta de su cosecha en menor tiempo, mejorado la productividad, pues cuenta con sistema de riego en caso que no llueva lo suficiente, cubrió la demanda de sus clientes y mejoro la alimentación de su familia. Ha mantenido su buena calificación crediticia.
texts.en: Tony says that the institution provides good service and ease of payments so he has decided to ask for anew loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and insecticides.  He will use the rest to pay the rent on the farmland.  Tony was able to harvest his crops in less time, increasing his production, because he has an irrigation system in case it doesn’t rain enough.  He covered his customers’ demand and improved the feeding of his family.  He has maintained his good credit rating.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Maria Marta

texts.es:
María, es madre de tres hijos, uno tiene 17 años de edad está estudiando bachillerato, otro 16 años de edad estudia noveno grado y el menor tiene 14 años de edad y estudia primaria;  como jefa de su hogar se esfuerza por mantener su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras funcionando desde hace 11 años, para tener los recursos económicos con los que cubre los gastos de su hogar, su horario es de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, lo atiende sola, poco a poco ha ido fortaleciéndolo y aumentando su clientela. 
El financiamiento le servirá para comprar repollos, manzanas, papas, papayas, güisquiles, etc., con esta compra diversificara el negocio y suplirá la demanda de sus clientes; espera tener en su negocio productos frescos y de calidad con los que sus ventas y ganancias sean mejores.
Sus sueños son expandir su negocio, mejorarla rentabilidad, brindar a sus hijos una mejor alimentación, vestuario, salud y educación.
texts.en:
Maria is the mother of three children. One is 17 and is studying in high school, one is 16 and is in 9th grade, and the youngest is 14 and is in primary school. As the head of her household, she has made an effort to keep her business of selling fruits and vegetables functioning for 11 years in order to have the economic resources with which to cover the household expenses. Her schedule is from 8 in the morning to 5 in the afternoon. She tends her business alone. Little by little she has strengthened it and increased her clientele.

The financing will serve her to buy cabbages, apples, potatoes, papayas, chayote, etc. With this purchase she will diversify her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to have fresh and high quality products in her business, so that her sales and earnings will be better. Her dreams are to expand her business, improve its profitability, and offer her children better nourishment, clothing, health, and education.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, apples, potatoes, papayas, chayote, etc. and to thus diversify her business.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina tiene 61 años de edad, su estado civil es divorciada, vive en casa propia en el distrito de Saña, Provincia de Chiclayo en la Región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú, ella vive en una comunidad tranquila.

Alejandrina se dedica a la venta de ropa principalmente, pero también se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales mejores. Ella ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles, dicha inversion es para la compra de mercaderia(ropa), para poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes, lo que le servirá para poder aumentar su ventas y por ende sus ganancias; logrando de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 61 years old, divorced, and lives in a home of her own in the Saña district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.  She lives in a tranquil community.

Alejandrina mainly sells clothing, but also raises and sells animals.  She is asking for a loan of 1,500 Nuevos Soles, through Edpyme Alternativa, to buy merchandise (clothing) so she can meet her customer requests, and increase her sales, and profits.  This way she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair the bicycle on which he goes out to sell bread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, sand, and iron and pay for labor

loans.name: Beatrace

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 42-year-old woman.  She farms, sells at market and makes local brew. She used the previous loan to buy farm products such as seeds and fertilizers and managed to reap a lot from the proceeds. She wishes to buy land and construct a permanent house for her family. She faces a challenge of weather variations, price fluctuations and a poor transport network.

She wants a loan to prepare her garden by ploughing, weeding and buying chemicals.

loans.use: to prepare her garden by ploughing, weeding and buying chemicals.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a married man with four children.  He has a motorcycle transport business where he has to remit the proceeds to his boss. He does farming to increase his income. He wishes to educate his children and own more motorcycles however he is challenged by inadequate capital and bad weather especially the rainy season where roads become impassable. He wants a loan to buy his own motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy his own  motorcyle.

loans.name: Grupo Xojola Camino Caserio Pasac Group

texts.es:
Manuela tiene 38 años de edad, ella es una mujer emprendedora y decidida por poder superar en la vida, ella no se deja vencer por los obstáculos que la vida le pone sino ella alcanza todo sus mentas y sueños, ella tiene tres hijos que mantener el primero ya es casado y los dos últimos son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad. (Ella se encuentra de 1ra de izquierda a derecha la que tiene puesta una blusa de color morado).
Ella obtiene sus ingresos económicos por medio de la producción de bananos en la comunidad donde ella vive, sus padres le enseñaron dicha actividad desde hace 30 años, ella realiza la venta de su producto en el mercado y en los alrededores de su comunidad y así tener un ingreso económico para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
El uso respectivo que le dará al crédito es para el mantenimiento de banano, ya que para ella es de mucha importancia que sus plantas de bananos produzcan frutos de primera calidad y así no perder a los clientes con que ella cuenta.
Ella es un buen ejemplo en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se ha decidido a emprender el negocio junto a ella y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familias, una de las grandes aspiraciones de ella es la siembra de más plantas de bananos y ver crecer a sus hijos en el campo de la educación y convertirse en profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
Manuela is 38 year old and an enterprising woman determined to get ahead in life.  She does not allow herself to be defeated by the obstacles she faces.  Instead she reaches all her goals and dreams.  She has three children to support.  The oldest is married and the others are excellent students in their community schools. (She is the first one from the left, wearing a purple blouse.)

She gets her income from raising bananas in her community.  Her parents taught her how to do this 30 years ago.  She sells her products in the markets around her community and earns an income with which to improve her family’s quality of life.

She will use the money from this loan to maintain her banana crops, since it’s very important to her that her plants produce quality fruit so she doesn’t lose customers that she counts on.  She is a good example in her community and for this reason she and a group of women decided to go into business together in order to improve their families’ quality of life.  One of her grandest aspirations is to plant more bananas and watch her children get an education and become professionals.

loans.use: to maintain her banan crop.

loans.name: Dúo Shalom Group

texts.es: Dúo Shalom este grupo esta conformado por la señora Iris de 47 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de calzado, esta muy agradecida con Kiva ya que gracias a los creditos que ella a obtenido a podido salir adelante en su negocio, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia en calzado, su sueño es tener un negocio mas grande para generar mejores ganancias.
texts.en: The Duo Shalom group includes Señora Iris, who is 47 years old. She sells footwear. She is very grateful to Kiva, since thanks to the loans that she has obtained, she has been able to get ahead in her business. At this time she is applying for this loan to purchase more footwear merchandise. Her dream is to have a bigger business to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy footwear to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Comerciantes Group

texts.en:
El Quiché is the name of a department located in the Northwestern Highlands of Guatemala. It is one of the most populous in Guatemala. The population is Maya-Kiché, a proud and traditional indigenous culture. The economy of the area is based in agriculture, fishing and handicrafts. There are many commercial ventures as well.
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Mujeres Comerciantes” or “Women in Commerce” is located here. There are seven enthusiastic ladies in the group. Delfina is the President of the Trust Bank. She is 46 years old, married and has four years of formal education. Some years ago, she began a food-selling business that was soon transformed into a restaurant. Due to her hard work and what she has learned from the Friendship Bridge trainings, Delfina has been very successful. As she was unable to handle the workload in the restaurant by herself, she employed three women to help her. Each of them has their own families to support and so it is a wonderful “win-win” situation for all of them! Delfina is requesting a loan to purchase essential items for the restaurant including an additional stove, pots and dishes. She will have enough to cater big and special events like birthdays and weddings.
Friendship Bridge believes that the combination of small loans and education, called “Microcredit Plus”, is a combination that yields very positive results.  Delfina and the ladies in the “Mujeres Comerciantes” Trust Bank meet each month with a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer who shares timely and useful information with the ladies on a variety of subjects like health, hygiene and nutrition as well as self-esteem and violence against women.
