The ladies learn about effective business management practices as well and gain essential knowledge about business planning, budgeting, accounting, customer service, marketing and pricing.
Each of the ladies in the Trust Bank clearly envisions a future as an empowered woman eliminating poverty. The small loans and educational seminars are an effective pathway to this goal. Thank you, KIVA investors, for your kindness and generosity in providing capital for these loans.

loans.use: to purchase essential items for the restaurant including an additional stove, pots and dishes.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred is a 60-year old male who lives in Masindi, Uganda and used the previous loan to pay workers to plough his land for the next season where he managed to plant his crops but yielded less due to unpredictable weather. He does farming, teaching and cattle fattening. He started the farming so as to to mobilize finances to sustain his family. He dreams of constructing a permanent house for his family. Inadequate capital and weather variations affect his business. Alfred intends to use the loan to weed his garden.

loans.use: to weed his garden.

loans.name: Naptali

texts.en:
Naptali lives in Masindi-Uganda. He is married with four children. 

He has a tailoring shop and he began this business to cater for his family's needs. He earns a salary to boost his income. He is a hardworking man and wants a loan to buy clothing materials to sew and sell. 

He is challenged with inadequate capital and his wish is to educate his children.

loans.use: buy clothing materials to sew and sell.

loans.name: Imeleta

texts.en: Imeleta is a 26-year-old unmarried woman with two children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has five years of experience with this business. Imeleta needs a loan to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiler, a toaster, a new sandwich maker and a new display fridge. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Imeleta has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiler, a toaster, a new sandwich maker and a new display fridge.

loans.name: Eladio

texts.es:
Eladio tiene 42 años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposa e hijas de 15 y 17 años, en casa propia, en una comunidad pequeña en la zona rural de Ucupe y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos, su comunidad queda en el distrito de Lagunas, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Eladio se dedica a la actividad de crianza de ganado vacuno, a la producción y venta de leche, cuenta con 6 vacas y 1 ternero, con más de 7 años de antiguedad en el negocio, en el sector el progreso en Ucupe. Él solicita préstamo para la siembra de chala y alfalfa para el alimento de su ganado. De esta manera hacer crecer su negocio, obtener más ingresos, emjores ganancias y asi poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia
texts.en:
Eladio is 42 years old, married, and lives with his wife and daughters, ages 15 and 17 in a home of his own in a small community in the rural part of Ucupe.  He has good personal and professional references from his neighbors.  The community is located in the Lagunas district, Chiclayo province, Lambayaque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

Eladio raises cattle, sells milk, and has six cows and one bull.  He’s been doing this for more than 7 years.  He is asking for a loan to plant corn and alfalfa to use as feed for his livestock.  In this way he will be able to grow his business and obtain more income and be able to improve his and and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to plant corn and alfalfa.

loans.name: Carlos Rafael

texts.es:
Carlos de 52 años de edad, es agricultor, estudio hasta cuarto grado de nivel académico.  La esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos,  han procreado 3 hijos los cuales solo uno de ellos vive en casa, los demás están en hogares apartes; con Carlos  solo vive una hija, la esposa y una nieta.

Carlos trabaja como vigilante de una llantería que es del hermano, desde hace dos años; pero también Carlos se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde desde hace tres años en su casa.  La esposa le ayuda a este trabajo, en lo que el anda trabajando ella los cuida.

  El trabajo de vigilante está a 30 minutos y viaja en bus, el horario es de las 6:00 a.m  a las 5:00 pm en la llantería

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar 200 pollos de engorde,  5 quintales de concentrado y las vitaminas que le pondrán.  Esto le ayudara mucho ya que viene la época de donde se venden los pollos y esto le darán mucha ganancia de las ventas y así poco a poco  ir comprando  más pollos y tener una granja más grande.


Los sueños que tiene,  es poder tener una granja más grande,  tener muchos pollos para la venta y distribuirlos por todo el municipio a las tiendas más fuertes y sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carlos is 52 years old and he works in agriculture. He completed fourth grade in school. His wife performs domestic tasks. They have three children of whom only one lives at home and the others in separate homes. Only a daughter, his wife and a granddaughter live with Carlos.

Carlos has worked for two years as guard for his brother's tire shop, but he has also worked for the last three years raising broiler chickens at home. His wife helps him take care of the chickens while he is away at work. The guard work is 30 minutes away and he takes the bus, the hours are from 6 am to 5 pm at the tire shop. 

The loan he is requesting is to buy 200 chickens, five quintals of chicken feed, and vitamins for the chickens. It will greatly help him as the season to sell is approaching, and this will generate a lot of profit from the sales in order to gradually buy more chickens and enlarge the farm.

His dreams are to have a larger farm, to have many chickens for sale and distribution throughout the town to the stronger stores, and to help his children get ahead.

loans.use: to buy 200 broiler chickens, five quintals of chicken feed, and vitamins for the chickens.

loans.name: Grupo Yoxaja Agosto 2014 Group

texts.es:
Magdalena tiene 34 años de edad, ella es una mujer emprendedora y decidida por poder superar en la vida, ella no se deja vencer por los obstáculos que la vida le pone sino ella alcanza todo sus mentas y sueños, ella tiene cuatro hijos que mantener el primero ya es casado e tiene familia propia y los tres últimos son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad. (Ella se encuentra de 1ra de izquierda a derecha la que tiene puesta una blusa de color blanco).
Ella obtiene sus ingresos económicos por medio de la producción de bananos en la comunidad donde ella vive, sus padres le enseñaron dicha actividad desde hace 25 años, ella realiza la venta de su producto en el mercado y en los alrededores de su comunidad y así tener un ingreso económico para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
El uso respectivo que le dará al crédito es para el mantenimiento de banano, ya que para ella es de mucha importancia que sus plantas de bananos produzcan frutos de primera calidad y así no perder a los clientes con que ella cuenta.
Ella es un buen ejemplo en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se ha decidido a emprender el negocio junto a ella y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familias, una de las grandes aspiraciones de ella es la siembra de más plantas de bananos y ver crecer a sus hijos en el campo de la educación y convertirse en profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 34 years old. She is an entrepreneurial woman, determined to be able to achieve in life. She does not let herself be defeated by the obstacles that life presents her with, but she attains all her thoughts and dreams. She has four children to support. The oldest is already married and has his own family, and the three younger ones are excellent students in the school in their community. (Magdalena is the first one from left to right and is wearing a white blouse.)

She obtains economic income through the production of bananas in the community where she lives. Her parents taught her this work 25 years ago. She sells her product in the market and in the surroundings of her community, and thus has an economic income to improve the living conditions of her family.

The use that she will give to the loan is to maintain the banana planting, since for her it is of great importance that her banana plants produce fruit of first quality and thus not lose the customers that she has.

She is a good example in her community, and it is because of this that a group of women has decided to set up businesses alongside her and thus improve the living conditions of their families. One of her great aspirations is to plant more banana plants and see her children grow in the field of education and become professionals in life.

loans.use: to maintain her banana plantings

loans.name: Enerstina

texts.en: Enerstina is a 26 year old single woman with 2 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 4 years. Enerstina needs a loan to buy a new display fridge, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, rice, and a sack of onions. She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house and help pay for her children's education. She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new display fridge, a chest freezer, and more stock items for her general store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Fieta

texts.en: Fieta is 44 years old and single with 3 children. She owns and operates a small flea market selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 3 years. Fieta needs a loan to buy rolls of material, paint, designs, hangers, nails, iron and new rubber designs. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her families weekly expenses and help with the expansion of her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy rolls of material, paint, designs, hangers, nails, iron and new rubber designs

loans.name: Gigilyn

texts.en:
Gigilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a firewood vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stocks of firewood to sell for her firewood vending business.

Gigilyn has been in this business for 24 years. Gigilyn earns more income from a general store.

Gigilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia is 26, married and lives in Rawalpindi with her family. She has one child and looks after her house. Her husband is the one who earns for their family. He works hard to support his family in meeting their needs. He buys and sells scrap materials in the nearby market. Currently, he does not have much income to buy scrap material for his business.
Sobia requested a loan for her husband's business, which he will use to buy more scrap materials to sell. He hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream to save enough money so he can afford to pay for his child's education.

loans.use: to buy scrap material that will help her husband expand his scrap business.

loans.name: Taumainuumau

texts.en: Taumainuumau is a 67-year-old widow with six children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for four years. Taumainuumau needs a loan to buy a new wheelbarrow, chemicals, fertilizer, a sprayer, crops, overalls, a machete and new boots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Taumainuumau will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new wheelbarrow, chemicals, fertilizer, a sprayer, crops, overalls, a machete and new boots.

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en: Mareta is 45 years old and married with 2 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 6 years. Mareta needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. Mareta will use the profits from her sales to pay for her families weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm implements

loans.name: Ela

texts.en: Ela is a 44-year-old divorced woman with 7 children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Ela needs a loan to buy a large chest freezer, foam cups, Chinese candy, cordials, a cooler, sugar and rubber gloves. She plans to use her profits to pay for her families weekly expenses and help with her children's education. Ela has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy a large chest freezer, foam cups, Chinese candy, cordials, a cooler, sugar and rubber gloves

loans.name: Justimiano

texts.es:
Justimiano es una persona muy trabajadora, tiene 38 años de edad y vive en San Martin junto a su familia.
Es padre de 3 maravillosos hijos, quienes son su mayor motivación y por quienes desde muy joven se ha esforzado para poder brindarles una excelente educación.
Desde que era joven ha apoyado a sus padres en la chacra es por ello que tiene bastante experiencia en este sector. Tiene más de 10 años dedicándose al cultivo de Cacao y le va muy bien gracias a su amplio conocimiento en este rubro y a que siempre ofrece productos de calidad.
Justimiano en estos momentos tiene que pagar a los peones por el deshierbo de la chacra es por ello que está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá realizar el pago puntual a su equipo de trabajo y así contar con su apoyo más adelante. De esta manera podrá obtener una buena producción en la cosecha y así seguirá luchando para poder más adelante: "Ver a sus hijos convertidos en grandes profesionales".
texts.en:
Justimiano is a very hardworking person.  He is 38 years old and lives with his family in San Martin.  He is the father of three wonderful children who are his main motivation and for whom he has strived to provide an excellent education.  Since he was very young, he has supported his parents in the fields, so he has lots of experience in this field.  He has been raising Cacao for more than ten years and things are going well for him, thanks to his knowledge and because he always offers quality products.

Justimiano needs to pay his field hands to weed the fields so he is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because their support has allowed him to pay his work crew on time and be able to count on them in the future.  In this way he will obtain a good harvest and continue striving to get ahead.  “See his children become great professionals.”

loans.use: to pay his field hands.

loans.name: Dúo Maricruz De San Bartolo Group

texts.es: Dúo Maricruz de San Bartolo, este grupo esta conformado por la señora florentina de 57 años de edad,ella se dedica a la venta de refacciones y productos de consumo diario desde hace varios años, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mercaderia para la elaboracion de refacciones, esperando que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado, el sueño de ella es tener un lugar donde exibir sus comidas preparadas.
texts.en: The “Maricruz de San Bartolo” duo includes Florentina.  She is 57 years old and has been selling refreshments and daily consumable products for several years.  She is asking for this loan to buy merchandise to make refreshments.  She hopes you can help her with this loan.  Her dream is to have a place to show her prepared foods.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Henry Alberto

texts.es:
Henry Alberto es un joven estudiante de Ingeniería Industrial, él solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativo, esta es su historia:Soy Henry Alberto, tengo 21 año de edad resido en  Santiago R.D. nací y crecí en esta provincia de  Santiago, tengo tres hermanas, no estoy casado, mi padre  falleció  y mi madre no trabaja.
Yo estudio en UTESA la carrera de Ing. Industrial, considero que es una carrera de mucho futuro y que llena mis expectativas y sé que  podré  terminarla y poner en práctica los conocimientos.  
Ya  he tomado principio de ingeniería industrial, principio de administración, y mi asignatura favorita es matemática. 
El fondo Kiva ha llegado a mi vida como una salvación ya que, sin estos recursos no  podría terminar mi carrera y tendría que ponerme a trabajar, en  algo informar ya que actualmente no tengo conocimientos profesionales.    
Dentro de mis metas está  ser un excelente profesional, tener una hermosa familia y tener mi casa propia.
texts.en:
Henry Alberto is a young student in industrial engineering. He is applying for a loan to be able to cover his educational expenses. This is his story:

I am Henry Alberto. I am 21 years old. I live in Santiago, Dominican Republic. I was born and grew up in this province of Santiago. I have three sisters. I am not married. My father died, and my mother does not work.

I study at UTESA in the Industrial Engineering program. I feel that it is a career with a good future and that it meets my expectations, and I know I will be able to complete it and put my knowledge into practice.

I have already taken principles of industrial engineering, principles of administration, and my favorite subject is mathematics.

The Kiva funding has arrived in my life like a salvation, since without these resources I would not be able to finish my program and I would have to go to work in something informal, since now I don't have professional knowledge.

Among my goals are to be an excellent professional, to have a beautiful family, and to have my own house.

loans.use: to cover higher education costs

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en: Uzma is 27 years old and she lives in a rented house in Rawalpindi. She looks after her house and children while her husband runs a taxi. He works hard to cover their daily expenses. He has been running this taxi for 10 years and now he wants to repair it, as it is in a bad condition due to constant wear and tear. He also is short of funds for his taxi maintenance. That is why Uzma has requested for a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a KIVA partner to get the required fund for the repairing.

loans.use: to help her husband repair his taxi.

loans.name: Tutulu

texts.en: Tutulu is 22 years old and unmarried with two children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. Tutulu needs a loan to buy shovels, a rake, chemicals, a crowbar, a tiller, fertilizer and crops. She became a member of SPBD this year to gain access to capital. Tutulu will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy shovels, a rake, chemicals, a crowbar, a tiller, fertilizer and crops.

loans.name: Tuusao

texts.en: Tuusao is a 41-year-old married woman with five children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Tuusao needs a loan to buy Chinese candy, a new chest freezer, cordials, a bag of sugar, foam cups and a large cooler. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Tuusao has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy Chinese candy, a new chest freezer, cordials, a bag of sugar, foam cups and a large cooler.

loans.name: Onolata

texts.en: Onolata is a 45-year-old unmarried woman with three children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has five years of experience with this business. Onolata needs a loan to buy pies, donuts, sandwiches, cordials, soft drinks, snacks, paper plates and cups. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Onolata has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy pies, donuts, sandwiches, cordials, soft drinks, snacks, paper plates and cups.

loans.name: Laufa

texts.en: Laufa is 55 years old and married with eight children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for eight years. Laufa needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a new crowbar and boots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2006. Laufa will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a new crowbar and boots.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina is a 20-year-old unmarried woman with no children. She runs a small bakery in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Sina needs a loan to buy a brand new stove, bags of flour, cooking oil, yeast, a large frying pan and plastic bags. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Sina just became a member of SPBD this year and is so eager to get started.

loans.use: to buy a brand new stove, bags of flour, cooking oil, yeast, a large frying pan and plastic bags.

loans.name: Manuula

texts.en: Manuula is a 20-year-old woman who is unwed with one child. She runs a small tailoring business in her community. She has one year of experience with this business. Manuula has requested a loan to buy a pair of scissors, thread, rolls of material, needles and a new sewing machine. She plans to use her profits to pay for her families weekly expenses. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a pair of scissors, thread, rolls of material, needles and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Siapai

texts.en: Siapai is 46 years old and unmarried with five children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for four years. Siapai has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, rollers, rubber designs, brushes and a new cutter. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, rollers, rubber designs, brushes and a new cutter.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
A $800.00 is offered to Filomena to improve her business. She is married and and she has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as shampoo, fish, oils, sugar, salt, noodles and coffee. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2012. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.
Running a business has made Filomena independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, fish, oils, sugar, salt, noodles and coffee.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is 44 years old and unwed with four children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for six years. Rosalina needs a loan to buy sacks of onions, potatoes, bags of rice, sugar, salt, flour, snacks, canned items and a new chest freezer. She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house and help pay for her children's education. She became a member of SPBD in 2008 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of onions, potatoes, bags of rice, sugar, salt, flour, snacks, canned items and a new chest freezer.

loans.name: Taaitulagi

texts.en: Taaitulagi is 32 years old and unmarried with two children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Taaitulagi needs a loan to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose. She became a member of SPBD this year to gain access to capital. Taaitulagi will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa is taking a loan of $600.00 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, coffee, cards, fanta, body loosen, oils, bread and kitchen appliances. She opened her kiosk and has been operating it since 2007 with her own working capital of $150.00. Elisa is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, coffee, cards, fanta, body loosen, oils, bread and kitchen appliances.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is 40 years old and she is married. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking of running a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan and she is applying for her second loan of $1,500.00. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as noodles, pencils, books, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, cigarettes, bread, sewing needles, water and soy sauce.She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) that offers loans to poor people. Her husband is a farmer and she is happy with this loan because it is offered for poor people to improving their living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy noodles, pencils, books, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, cigarettes, bread, sewing needles, water and soy sauce.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is applying for a loan of $1.500.00 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 38 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, fish oils, bread, biscuits, books, pencils, rulers, soap, shampoo, candles and slippers. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for bigger loan in the future. 
Antonia is living in a town near by the school; her kiosk is located in strategic place where many people come to buy including students.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, fish,oils, bread, biscuits, books, pencils, rulers, soap, shampoo, candle and slippers.

loans.name: Lusi

texts.en: Lusi is a 51-year-old widowed woman with three children. She makes and sells ice-cakes in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Lusi needs a loan to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, Chinese candy and foam cups. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Lusi has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, Chinese candy and foam cups.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is 35 years old, married, and a mother of two sons. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Parveen has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and pay for a little bit of engine maintenance for his vehicle. This will help him to drive more smoothly and to provide better transportation services to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and bring positive changes to his business.

Parveen thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain her husband's auto rickshaw

loans.name: El Sombrero Group

texts.es:
El grupo “El Sombrero” está integrado por cinco personas muy alegres, pero sobretodo muy amables quienes desde que escucharon hablar de KIVA se entusiasmaron y fueron muy accesibles al posar para tomar la fotografía y aparecer en la página. El nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque uno de los integrantes se dedica a vender sombreros en las comunidades. 
Josefina tiene 42 años de edad y vive en unión libre desde hace cinco años con su Patricio, juntos han formado una familia con dos niños los cuales asisten a la escuela. Jose, como le dicen de cariño, se dedica a la elaboración de chalecos desde hace 16 años, cuenta que la actividad la aprendió de su papá: “desde que tengo uso de razón, mis padres siempre se han dedicado a la elaboración de chalecos y para mí no fue nada complicado iniciar con mi propio negocio”. Desde hace 16 años, Jose tiene su propio taller de costura donde elabora los chalecos, inició solo con una máquina de coser y muy poquito material, pero ahora ya cuenta con tres maquinas y además da empleo a otras personas. Afortunadamente, Jose también cuenta con clientes que compran pedidos para revender sus creaciones. 
Con su préstamo, Jose comprará tela, cierres e hilos que es el material principal de su producto, de esta manera atacará la única dificultad que se le llega a presentar: falta de materia prima y dinero para surtir. Su sueño es invertir cada vez más, tener más máquinas y más empleados para también ayudarlos económicamente.  
Los demás integrantes del grupo son: Eduardo quien  invertirá en videojuegos; Adilene y Candelaria, en su negocio de chalecos y Lauro, en la venta de sombreros. Todos ellos están muy agradecidos con KIVA y con VisionFund México por sus préstamos porque es una oportunidad de mejorar los negocios.
texts.en:
The “El Sombrero” group is made up of five very happy persons, but above all they are very friendly.  When they heard of Kiva, they got excited and were very available to take the photograph and appear on the page.  They chose the group’s name because one of the members sells hats in the local communities.

Josephina is 42 years old and has been living in a common law marriage with Patricio for the past five years.  Together they formed a family with two children who attend school.

“Jose,” as they call her, has been making vests for 16 years.  She learned this from her father.  “My parents have been making vests as long as I can remember and it was not difficult for me to start my own business.”  Jose has had her own workshop for 16 years, where she makes the vests.  She started with a single sewing machine and very little material, but now she has three machines and provides employments to others.

Fortunately, Jose also has customers who buy from her to resell her creations.  She will use the money from this loan to buy fabric, zippers, and thread, which are the main materials for her product.  This way she will be able to overcome her main challenge, lack of money and supplies.  Her dream is to invest more and more, have more sewing machines, and more employees so she can also help them financially.

The other members of the group are: Eduardo, who will invest in videogames; Adilene and Candelaria with their hog business; and Lauro who sells hats.  All of them are very grateful to Kiva and VisionFund Mexico for their loans becasue its an opportunity to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

location.town: San Cristobal de los Baños, Ixtlahuaca

loans.name: Los Castros Group

texts.es: Los Castros es un grupo solidario integrado por tres mujeres laboriosas, y es coordinado por la señora Johana, quien tiene la edad de 28 años, acompañada y madre de dos hijos de las edades de 3 y 7 años, quienes son motivos de su superación, se dedica a la comercialización de frutas en el mercado de Estelí, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de piñas, melón, sandias, papayas, pues son los productos que mayor demanda tiene en este departamento, uno de los logros que ha obtenido es el aumento y diversidad de productos ofrecidos. Otra integrante es la señora Marina de 42 años de edad, comerciante de frutas desde hace diez años en el mercado más populoso de la capital y la joven Carmita de 23 años de edad comerciante de frutas y verduras en el mercado de la municipalidad desde hace dos años y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cosecha de tamarindo.
texts.en:
“Los Castros” is a united group made up of three working women and coordinated by Johana.  She is 28 years old, married, and the mother of two children, ages 3 and 7, who are her motivation for success.  She sells fruit in the Estelí market and will use the money from this loan to buy pineapples, cantaloupes, watermelons, and papayas.  This are the products that are in greatest demand in this department.  One of her goals is to increase the variety and quantity of her products.

Marina is another one of the members.  She is 42 years old and has been selling fruit for more than ten years in the busiest market in the capital city.  Young Carmita is 23 years old and has been selling fruits and vegetables in the local market for two years.  They are asking for this loan to buy tamarind.

loans.use: to buy fruits.

loans.name: Luchando Por La Vida Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Luchando por la vida, es conformado por tres microempresarios emprendedores, lo coordina la señora Yara de 22 años de edad, casada y madre de un bebe de ocho meses quien le da fuerzas para superarse, se dedica a la comercialización de ropa y calzado en los departamentos del país, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de Camisetas, camisolas, talladores, pantalones Big time, Kalua y Lee para damas, así mismo comprara sandalias altas y bajas, sandalias para niñas, zapatos para damas, etc. Con los créditos anteriores la socia ha logrado aumentar la clientela y por ende mejorar sus ingresos. Los otros integrantes del grupo solidario es la señora María Estevana que tiene la edad de 31 años y se dedica a el hacha y venta de tortillas y refresco en su domicilio, este negocio lo impulso hace siete años y el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de quintal de maíz, flete de leña, cal, azúcar, y frutas, y el señor Cándido quien tiene la edad de 30 años y ofrece el servicio de venta de sopa y nacatamales en su domicilio desde hace cuatro años y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de maíz, yuca, quequisque, carne de res, carne de cerdo, papas, arroz, tomate, chayote, ayote, etc.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Luchando por la Vida has three  microentrepreneurs.  Yara, 22 years old, coordinates the group.  Yara is married and mother of an eight month old baby who gives her the drive to excel.  Yara earns her living by selling clothing and footware in her country's  regions. Yara is seeking a loan to buy t-shirts, camisoles, women's tops, Big time pants,and  Kalua and Lee brand clothes for women.  She will also buy high-heeled and flat sandals, sandals for children, shoes for ladies. etc.  With her previous loans, this member has been able to increase her customer base and thus her income.  

The other members of the solidarity group are Maria Estevana, who is 31 years old and works at making and selling tortillas and soft drinks from her home.  Maria began this business seven years ago and will invest the loan money in buying a quintal (100 lb.) of corn, a load of firewood, lime, sugar and fruit.  The third member is  Cándido, 30 years old, who for the past four years has been providing a service selling soup and nacatamales from his home.  He is asking for the loan to buy corn, yucca, quequisque (coco yam), beef, pork, potatoes, rice, tomatoes, squash, etc.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Don Chico Group

texts.es:
Don chico es un grupo solidario integrado por tres socios emprendedores que lo coordina la señora Paula, quien tiene la edad de 43 años, acompañada y madre de seis hijos todos dependientes de ella, se dedica a la comercialización de verduras en la municipalidad desde hace veinte años y cuenta con la ayuda de su compañero de vida y sus hijos para la compra y comercialización del producto, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de verduras como es ayote, chayote, quequique, yuca, tomate, cebolla, repollo, etc. Una de sus metas vender otros tipos de verduras que la población demanda. 
Otros de los integrantes es la señora María Esther quien tiene la edad de 48 años y comercializa cosa de horno es su comunidad desde hace tres años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de quintal de maíz, azúcar, flete de leña, cal, hojas de chagüite, y el señor Francisco que tiene la edad de 38 años y su negocio es la venta de carbón y leña desde hace veinte años en el mercado de la municipalidad y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de fletes de leñas y sacos de carbón. Este grupo es primera vez que solicitan el crédito en esta institución y una de sus metas es aumentar los productos ofrecidos para aumenta la clientela y por ende sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Don Chico is a communal bank comprised of three hard-working members. Paula is the coordinator and she is 43 years old. She is in a relationship and is the mother of six children all of whom depend on her. For the past 20 years she has worked selling vegetables in the municipality, with the assistance of her life partner and her children to buy and sell the products. She is requesting the loan to buy vegetables such as squash, chayote [vegetable pears], quequisque [taro root], yucca, tomatoes, onions, cabbage, etc. One of her goals is to sell other kinds of vegetables in demand locally. 

Another member is Maria Esther, 48 years old, who has been selling baked goods in her community for three years. She requests the loan to buy a quintal of corn, sugar, a load of firewood, lime, plantain leaves.

Francisco is 38 years old and his business is selling charcoal and wood, which he has done at the municipal market for twenty years. He requests the loan to buy loads of wood and bags of charcoal.

This is the first time that this group has requested a loan with this institution, and one of their goals is to increase the selection of products offered in order to increase the customer base and thus their income.

loans.use: to buy squash, chayote, quequisque [taro root], yucca, tomatoes, onions, cabbage, etc.

loans.name: Sandra Lisseth

texts.es: Sandra Lisseth, mayor de edad madre soltera con un hijo menor de edad bajo su responsabilidad, originaria de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, en la vida ha sido muy responsable, trabajadora con ganas de superación personal,con el objetivo de cumplir cada una de sus sueños y metas. por falta de recursos económicos no pudo seguir estudiado debido a que salio embarazada y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar, hoy en día su sueño es ver formado a su hijo en un profesional, es una microempresaria y administradora de su propio negocio el cual consiste en una pulpería donde ofrece productos de consumo diarios en pequeñas cantidades como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, queso, crema, fósforos, jugos, gaseosas, galletas, aceite, productos congelados, golosinas, detergentes, leña, sal, tomates, entre otros mas, sus compras son al contado en mercados, distribuidoras y camiones distribuidores de esta misma localidad, sus ventas son al contado, tambien vende refrescos naturales, hielo, popsicles,  ubicado en su casa de habitación, Sandra inicia su jornada diaria desde muy temprano cerrando bastante tarde brindándoles un mejor servicio a sus clientes, inicia su negocio con capital propio productos de sus ahorro, el objetivo de este financiamiento  es para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos de consumo como: granos básicos, detergentes, golosinas, productos congelados, entre otros mas,y de esa forma tener los productos mas demandantes y así obtener mayor volumen de ingresos y ofrecerles mejores precios a sus clientes,  para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos
texts.en:
Sandra Lisseth is the single mother of a minor child that she cares for.  She is from Chinandega, located in the western part of the country.  She has been very responsible, hardworking, with a desire for personal success, with the aim of achieving all of her goals.  She was not able to continue attending school due to a lack of financial resources and because she was pregnant at the time.  She saw the need to go to work and today her dream is to see her son become a professional.  

She is a small businesswoman and manages her own business, a store where she sells daily consumables such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, cheese, cream, matches, juices, soft drinks, cookies, cooking oil, frozen products, snacks, detergents, firewood, salt, tomatoes, and other things.  She makes her purchases in cash from markets, distributors, and delivery trucks in the local area.  She sells for cash and also sells natural drinks, ice, popsicles, from her home.

Sandra begins her daily shift very early and closes late, providing better service to her customers.  She began her business with her own capital that she managed to save up.  She will use the money from this loan to stock her business with basic grains, detergents, snacks, frozen products, and other things so she will have the highest demand products in greater quantity and increase her income, as well as being able to offer better prices to her customers so that she can earn greater income in the future.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Sanouya Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de quatre (4) femmes, les membres du groupe Sanouya sont équitablement  mariées et vie dans des ménages polygamiques et monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 36 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Ouenzindougou commune du Mandé dans le cercle de Kati. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe mènent  des activités génératrices de revenu  différent, notamment la vente de, chaussures, pommes de terre, œufs et encens. Dans  le souci d’élargir et d’agrandir   leurs activités, elles ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso et  sont  à leur  premier  prêt  en solidaire.
Madame Oumou (femme arrêtée en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche) a une bonne notoriété, car les chaussures sont  très prises par les femmes à Ouenzindougou. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 35 paires de chaussures en plastiques. Elles s’approvisionnent à Bamako. Elle mène ses activités au comptant  à Ouenzindougou à une clientèle de femmes. Madame compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen de 25 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour satisfaire son besoin et investir le reste dans son activité. Madame a pour objectif de fidéliser  ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’en profiter beaucoup de prêt.
texts.en:
The Sanouya Group is made up of four married women, half of them live in polygamous households and half in monogamous households.  They are, on average 36 years old and have six children.  The women live in Ouenzindougou, Mandé commune, Kati district.  They know one another through their savings groups and their businesses.  They all sell different products, such as shoes, potatoes, eggs and incense.

In order to enlarge their businesses, the group members have decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their first group loan.

Oumou (standing second from the right in the photo) has a good reputation for selling shoes which are very popular with the women of Ouenzindougou.  She plans to use her loan to buy 35 pairs of plastic shoes for resale, from Bamako.  She sells the shoes for cash to women in Ouenzindougou.

Oumou expects to make an average profit of 25,000 francs CFA per month, which will be used to meet her needs and reinvest in her business.

In the future, Oumou would like to continue working with Soro Yiriwaso and to benefit from their loans.

loans.use: to buy several varieties of plastic shoes for resale.

loans.name: Thảo

texts.en:
Thảo has a retail business selling fish. She has been involved in this business for seven years. She is 33 years old and married with two children.

She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, and has two dependents

In 2014, Thảo joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thảo has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Thảo faces in her life is not having a water tank and water filter. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Thảo hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Sele Group

texts.fr:
Mariées uniquement dans des ménages monogamiques, les quatre membres du groupe  Sele ont en moyenne 33 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune de Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenus. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, chaussures de plusieurs sortes, habits et boissons. Dans l’intention d’accroitre leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mama (femme arrêtée à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de chaussures. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 18 paires de chaussures en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes à chaussures. Madame Mama compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The four members of the Sele Group are all married and live in monogamous households.  They are, on average, 33 years old and have three children.  The women live in Kanadjiguila, Mandé commune, Kati district.  They know one another through neighbourhood and business links.  The group members sell various varieties of shoes, clothing and drinks.

In order to increase their working capital, the group work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their second group loan.

Mama (standing on the far left in the photo) is well-known for selling shoes.  She plans to use her loan to buy 18 pairs of shoes wholesale, from Bamako.  She will then sell them on foot to women customers.

Mama expects to earn a monthly average profit of 25,000 francs CFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business and provide for some of the minor expenses of her household.

loans.use: to buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Rosas Del Valle Group

texts.es: Rosa del Valle es un grupo solidario, que lo integran tres mujeres emprendedoras, y lo coordina la señora Andrea quien tiene la edad de 34 años, su estado civil es casada, y su negocio es la venta de especies en las calles de la capital, este negocio lo impulso hace trece años con ayuda financiera de su esposo, es el tercer ciclo que solicita el financiamiento a la institución para la compra de especies como es manzanilla, canela, clavo de olor, achiote, mostaza, salsa inglesa, etc. Con los créditos anteriores la socia ha logrado aumentar y diversificar los productos ofrecidos, una de sus metas es mantener su negocio, pues es el que le proporciona sus ingresos que le permite brindarle el alimento a su familia. Otra de las socias es la señora Ileana de 28 años de edad, comerciante de frutas y verduras en la ciudad de Granada desde hace dos años, y la señora Lesbia quien tiene la edad de 26 años y su negocio es la venta de especies en la capital dese hace ocho años.
texts.en:
“Rosa del Valle” is a united group made up of three enterprising women and coordinated by Andrea.  She is 34 years old, married, and sells spices on the streets of the capital city.  She started this business three years ago with her husband’s help.  This is the third cycle that she is asking for a loan through the institution so she can buy spices such as chamomile, cinnamon, cloves, achiote, mustard, English sauce, etc.  She was able to use the previous loans to increase and diversify the products she offers.  One of her goals is to maintain her business because it’s where her income to feed her family comes from.

Ileana is another one of the members.  She is 28 years old and has been selling fruits and vegetables in the city of Granada for two years.  Lesbia is 26 years old and she has also been selling spices in the capital for two years.

loans.use: to buy spices.

loans.name: Luyến

texts.en:
Luyến has a retail business selling dry food. She has been involved in this business for five years. She is 37 years old and she is married with two children.

Luyến lives with two dependents in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Luyến first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a clean water system and a sanitary latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Luyến hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids and to buy a bicycle.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Cherrie

texts.en:
Cherrie is 39 years old and married with seven children, who are in school. Cherrie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Cherrie has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Cherrie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en: Peace is a 22-year-old female who lives in Masindi, Uganda, and she has a salon business. Peace sells clothes as an additional source of income. She started the business so as to improve on her standard of living. She hopes to expand her business into a renown beauty parlor and offer bridal services as well. However, she faces a challenge of having inadequate capital. Peace is a hardworking woman who needs a loan to buy cosmetics and braids to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and braids to sell.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Flora works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling rice and fish. Flora is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell for her dried fish vending business.

Flora has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Ronaldo

texts.en:
This is Ronaldo, 32, a resident of Cavite, Philippines. He and his wife manage their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ronaldo runs an “ukay-ukay” business. “Ukay” literally means to “dig out” or “hollow out” from a stack or heap of anything. In Ronaldo’s case, he is selling used (but not yet worn out) clothes that are usually stacked up on a table or mat. Some special kinds are displayed on hangers. In the Philippines, especially in urban poor communities, many people resort to buying used clothes from “ukay-ukay” stalls. These are much cheaper compared with brand new clothes sold in malls. Since his stall is located in an urban poor public market, his business flourishes. He earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) net sales every day.

To help him expand the business, he is requesting for a PHP 10,000 loan to buy additional used-but-quality clothes. Customers are attracted to buy from an “ukay-ukay” stall with lots of clothes to choose from. He plans to add more pants or jeans and also used bags and footwear. If he can roll the profits from this loan, he can meet the customers’ demand. Through proper management of capital and profit, he can expand his business and boost his income.

Ronaldo hopes to have his own space for his business so that there is no need for him to rent. He dreams of expanding it for he desires to give his child a better future. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and were he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of merchandise needed in his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ruth works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling cashews. Ruth is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Ruth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Soperiana

texts.en:
Soperiana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell peanut business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional peanuts to sell at her business.

Soperiana has been in this business for seven years, and she earns additional income from fishing and selling native products.

Soperiana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchse additional peanuts to sell.

loans.name: Bayarjavkhlan

texts.en:
Mrs. Bayarjavkhlan, 33 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. She has been working as a seller at clothes stall since 2012. Before this, she used to raise livestock together with her husband. 

Their two children go to high school. They live in an old traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling). Now she is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to buy felt, foam, and fiberglass for the ger insulation. As winter is approaching, it is important to insulate the ger in order to burn less coal for heating. According to the national research department, burning of coal is the main contributor to air pollution in Mongolia.

loans.use: to insulate her home in order to burn less coal for heating during winter

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Estrella works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling cashews. Estrella is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Estrella has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets

loans.name: Vannoeurn

texts.en: Vannoeurn is 49 years old and a married mother blessed with three children. She is a local farmer who grows rice and cassava as the main business to secure the needs of her family. Now, she is in need of financial aid to support her daughter's vocational training in Korean languages. Therefore, she is taking an education loan to cover the tuition fees for her daughter. She hopes that her daughter can complete the course so as she can get a good job with good income in return.

loans.use: to cover the tuition fees for her daughter.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en: Mr. Bayarsaikhan, 55 years old, lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. In the last three years, all his children got married and are living on their own. He worked as a policeman for 32 years and retired three years ago. Currently, he is rendering taxi service to local people for a living. His wife grows vegetables in four greenhouses. He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy bricks, an oven, foam, cement and sand in order to modify the greenhouse for winter. As a result, his wife can grow tomatoes, carrots and cabbage during winter in the winter greenhouse. Growing vegetables domestically helps the family to save money. Vegetables absorb carbon dioxide, contributing to cleaner air in urban areas.

loans.use: to modify his greenhouse for use in the winter

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 47 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock like canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, milk, etc. to sell.

Marilyn has borrowed and repaid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice and motorcycle transport.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, milk, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty is 48 years old and married with two children.

Liberty works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Liberty has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and earns additional income from e-loading (mobile prepaid load).

Liberty aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rena

texts.en:
Rena is 31 years old and married with two children in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Rena has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Rena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth, a 43-year-old micro-entrepreneur from Cavite, Philippines, has run her processed and frozen meat retailing business for three years, and she makes a good income from this. She also operates their own variety store and she also sells soft drinks for additional income. Having a big family requires a lot of effort to provide for everyone’s needs, especially for her son. She is married and the couple is determined to work hard to provide their child with a better education than they currently have.

What she basically does is buy processed meat products from a wholesaler and then she sells them per piece/pack with a profit. Products can range from ham, hotdogs, processed pork and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

Ruth is taking out a PHP 10,000 loan assistance to buy additional frozen food products and orders for her customers. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more processed meats and fruit juices, which are necessary to increase her inventory.

In the future, Ruth hopes to grow her business, and through it she will be able to give her child the best for his education.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more stock of frozen food and other items to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 42 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy fertiilzers and other farm supplies.

Jocelyn has been farming vegetables for 11 years and earns additional income from meat vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Uugankhuu

texts.en: Mr. Uugankhuu, 33 years old, lives with his wife and child in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a manager at a private firm since 2007. His wife is a teacher at a kindergarten and currently stays at home in order to look after their three years old child. He is requesting a loan of 330,0000 MNT to buy bricks and fiberglass for house renovation. He will encase the house with bricks for extra protection against wind, storm and rain. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and then less pollutants are released into air.

loans.use: to buy bricks and fiberglass for house renovation

loans.name: Aufai

texts.en: Aufai is a 30-year-old married woman with one child. She makes and sells barbeque in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience in this business. Aufai needs a loan to buy mutton flaps, sausages, chicken leg quarters, soya sauce, onions and paper plates. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD this year to gain access to capital.

loans.use: to buy mutton flaps, sausages, chicken leg quarters, soya sauce, onions and paper plates

loans.name: Namdag

texts.en: Namdag, 42 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been selling plastics, glasses, rubber and metals to a local recycling factory since 2004. His wife sells glassware at an outdoor market. Their children both go to high school. He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy glassware in large amounts from a Chinese border city at wholesale prices to support his wife's business. During this period of the year, lots of weddings happen and the demand for glassware increases very much.

loans.use: to buy glassware in large amounts in order to meet the demands during wedding season.

loans.name: Sialatua

texts.en: Sialatua is a 53-year-old unmarried woman with seven children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Sialatua needs a loan to buy cordials, bags of sugar, a large chest freezer, foam cups and Chinese candy. She plans to use her profits to pay for her children's education. Sialatua became a member of SPBD this year to gain access to capital.

loans.use: to buy cordials, bags of sugar, a large chest freezer, foam cups and Chinese candy

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 36 years. She earns more income from buying and selling rice.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her fishing business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her fishing business.

loans.name: Luis Felipe

texts.es: Luis tiene 38 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos de 12 años y 8 años de edad. Luis es un hombre muy trabajador quien desde hace mucho tiempo se gana la vida trabando en una panadería cercana a su localidad. Luis desea mejorar las  condiciones del servicio sanitario y así poder dar a sus hijos mejores condiciones. Luis ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios como: ladrillo, cemento, arena y una nueva taza lavable. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así dar inicio a la mejora del baño lo antes posible.
texts.en: Luis is 38 years old and lives in his own house with his two children, ages 12 and 8 years old.  Luis is a hard-working man who, for a long time, has earned his living working in a bakery near his home. Luis wants to improve the condition of his bathroom and in this way give his children better living conditions. Luis has decided to ask FUSAI for a loan to invest in purchasing the needed materials such as brick, cement, sand, and a new sink. He hopes to be able to have this loan and in this way improve the bathroom as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, sand, and a new sink to improve his bathroom.

loans.name: Veronica Esmeralda

texts.es: Veronica tiene 42 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre y su hija de 14 años de edad. Veronica es una mujer que se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, emprendedora y muy carismática. Ella se gana la vida  por medio de la venta de comida rápida. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones  habitacionales ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, ladrillo de piso, arena y grava para repellar las paredes de la vivienda y para enladrillar el piso de la vivienda.
texts.en: Veronica is 42 years old and lives in her own house with her mother and her 14-year-old daughter. Veronica is a woman who is characterized as hard-working, enterprising, and very charismatic. She earns her living by selling fast food. In this way she earns her living and brings sustenance to the household. With the desire to improve her living conditions, she has decided to ask FUSAI for this loan to invest in the purchase cement, bricks for flooring, sand, and gravel to replaster the walls of her house and to put in a brick floor in the house.

loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks for flooring, sand, and gravel to replaster the walls of her house and to put in a brick floor in the house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an suitable chair to do her customer's manicures and in this way strengthen her business.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: Hector de 42 años de edad, se dedica al diseño gráfico y a la publicidad. Su  experiencia data desde hace 14 años, cuando apoyó a un familiar en campañas electorales, cuando su familiar producía publicidad para esta actividad de gobierno. Una vez aprendido este trabajo y con el fin de obtener ingresos independientes,  en el año 2000 inició su emprendimiento  ofreciendo sus productos con un anticipo del 50% de contado y el otro 50% a crédito.  En su oferta están los estampados de camisetas, volantes publicitarios, vallas pendones calcomanías etc. Para promover e impulsar sus ventas,  Hector aprovecha su arte y mediante volantes que el mismo elabora, los distribuye a su comunidad; también sus clientes actuales son sus principales voceros, porque conocen perfectamente su buen servicio. En la actualidad Hector está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará máquinas para hacer trabajos de punto y para hacer píxel;  con esta inversión ampliaría su equipo de trabajo y mejoraría la eficiencia en el servicio a su clientela, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa para su negocio. Hector tiene una importante meta que quiere cumplir y es la de tener un local, también adquirir su propia vivienda, aunque  su mayor desafío sea lograr un poco de capital de crédito, que lo apoye en el cumplimiento de sus logros.
texts.en: Hector, 42 years old, works in graphic design and advertising. His experience began 14 years ago, when he helped a family member with an election campaign, when his family member made advertising for this government activity. Once he learned the work and could earn independent income with is, in 2000, he opened his business venture, offering his products at an advance of 50% in cash, and the other 50% in credit. He offers T-shirt printing, flyers, billboards and banners, decals, etc. To promote and boost his sales, Hector takes advantage of his art and with flyers that he designs himself, he distributes them in the community.  Also, his current customers are his primary spokespeople because they know perfectly his good services.  Currently, Hector is applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan that he has taken from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will purchase machines to do embroidery and to pixelate. With this investment, he will expand his work equipment and will improve the efficiency of his customer service, making his Kiva loan successful for his business. Hector has an important goal that he wants to achieve, and that is to have a retail space. He also wants to get his own house, although his greatest challenge is get a little credit, which will support him in making it happen.

loans.use: to purchase embroidery and pixelating machines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an assortment of ice creams and ingredients to make home-made ice creams, which will allow her to begin the construction on her own house.

loans.name: Consuelo De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Consuelo desde muy joven se dedico a las funciones del campo tales como agricultura y ganadería, actividades que le enseño su padre para que saliera adelante en su vida.

Hoy en día su actividad principal es la agricultura y la ganadería y tiene como objetivo mejorar su capital comprando algunos lotes de ganado que le permitan abastecerse y generar mejores ingresos, y esta es la razón por la cual solicita un préstamo.

Es madre responsable y amorosa con sus hijos, vive en una finca con ellos y su esposo quien ha sido su más grande compañía.

Sueña con poder otorgarles a sus hijos una educación de calidad para que más adelante se puedan defender solos y sean independientes.

Todos los días asiste su negocio y procura por hacer las cosas muy bien.
texts.en:
Since Consuelo was very young, she has worked in rural jobs such as agriculture and animal husbandry, work that her father taught her so she could get ahead in her life. These days, her primary job is agriculture and animal husbandry and she has as a goal to improve her capital, purchasing some lots of cattle that will permit her to stock up and to generate more income, and this is the reason she asks for a loan. 

She is a responsible and loving mother to her children; she lives on a farm with them and with her husband who has been her greatest companion. 

She dreams of being able to offer her children a quality education so that in the future they can support themselves and be independent.

Every day, she works in her business and tries to do things very well.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to improve her business and give her children a better education.

loans.name: Sandra Yamile

texts.es:
Sandra es una mujer humilde y trabajadora que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de La Dorada desde donde se desempeña espectacularmente en la cocina ya que su negocio es la preparación de comidas por encargo como lo son los tamales, chorizos, empanadas, entre otros.

Estos alimentos los venden principalmente a vecinos del sector quienes conocen la sazón de Sandra y saben que siempre obtendrán alimentos deliciosos y muy bien preparados.

Sandra desea aumentar su venta de alimentos y desea trabajar de una manera más cómoda, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de un horno y compra de insumos e ingredientes para continuar realizando sus recetas.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia y su negocio.
texts.en:
Sandra is a humble and hard-working woman who has spent a large part of her life taking care of her children. She lives in the municipality of La Dorada, from where she performs spectacularly in the kitchen, since her business is preparing food to order such as tamales, chorizos, and empanadas, among others. 

These foods are primarily sold to neighbors in the area who know Sandra's seasonings and know that they will always get delicious and well-prepared food. 

Sandra wants to increase her food sales and wants to work in a more comfortable way, and for this reason she asks for a loan to purchase an oven and purchase the supplies and ingredients to continue making her dishes.

This loan will allow her to advance her business to, in this way, get the necessary income that will give her an opportunity to continue supporting her family and business.

loans.use: to purchase an oven for her kitchen, supplies and ingredients to continue making food and advance her business.

loans.name: Edgar Teobaldo

texts.es:
Edgar, con 48 años de edad, es padre de 4 hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. 

Nació y se crió en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agrícolas al lado de su padre; gracias a ello, hoy en día tiene cultivos de plátano, cuya cosecha es vendida y de esta manera obtiene los recursos para llevar el alimento a su hogar. 

El prestatario es un hombre pujante, luchador, dedicado a su familia y a su trabajo, eso lo motiva para trabajar largas jornadas y tratar de salir adelante; día a día lucha para sobrepasar los obstáculos que se le presentan, ha pasado por situaciones económicas difíciles debido al alto precio de los insumos agropecuarios, lo que afecta el precio de su producto. 

Edgar solicita su primer ciclo de crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas tales como abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas y semillas de plátano, con el fin de darle continuidad a su negocio y preparar sus cultivos para cosechar un producto de muy buena calidad, que le permita venderlo a un mejor precio para obtener mejores utilidades. 

Edgar sueña con mejorar sus cultivos, ampliarlos para obtener de estos una buena renta mensual, que le permita brindarles mejores condiciones de vida a su familia y una mejor educación a sus hijos, para que su futuro sea exitoso.
texts.en:
Edgar, 48 years old, is father to 4 children and lives in a common-law marriage with his partner.

He was born and raised in the countryside, where he learned the agricultural tasks at his father's side. Thanks to that, today he has banana crops, whose harvest is sold and in this way he gets resources to bring food to his home. 

The borrower is a thriving, determined man, who is dedicated to his family and to his work. This motivates him to work long days and try to get ahead; day after day he fights to overcome the obstacles that come up. He has gone through difficult economic times due to the high price of agricultural supplies, which affects the price of his product. 

Edgar asks for his first loan cycle to invest it in the purchase of agricultural supplies such as manure, fertilizer, pesticides, and banana seeds, with the end to give continuity to his business and prepare his crops to harvest a very high-quality product, which will allow him to sell it at a better price to get more profit.

Edgar dreams of improving his crops, expanding them to get a better monthly income, which will allow him to offer better living conditions to his family and a better education for his children so that their future is successful.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds, irrigation and things to prepare the land and be able to offer his children a better education.

loans.name: Yesika Yamileth

texts.es:
Yesika de 27 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 5 años, este oficio la madre se lo enseño ya que desde pequeños se han dedicado a la venta.  Yesika vende en un puesto en el mercado de lunes a domingo en la ciudad, viaja en bus a una distancia de 45 minutos.  Vende ahorita que están las cosechas de anona, aguacates y guineos, jocotes esto son las cosas que más vende. 

El crédito que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar más jocotes, anonas y guineo son las frutas que ahorita están de cosecha y abundante esto le va ayudar mucho, ya que entre más compre más vende y son mejores las ganancias que le quedan a ella y a la familia y con la ganancias ella comprara más y así pagara el crédito que ha solicitado

Los sueños de Yesika es poder seguir trabajando y sacar sus hijos adelante y que se preparen academicamnte.
texts.en:
Yesika, 27 years old, has worked selling fruits and vegetables for the past 5 years. Her mother taught her this work since they have worked selling them since they were very young. Yesika sells from a stand in the market from Monday to Sunday in the city. She goes by bus a distance of 45 minutes. She sells what is currently being harvested, such as the custard apple, avocado, banana, and jocote which are the things she sells the most. 

The loan that she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to purchase more jocotes, custard apples, and bananas, which are the fruits being harvested and are abundant right now, which will help her a lot, since when she buys more, she sells more, and the profits that are left to herself and her family are greater and, with the profit, she will purchase more and in this way pay off the loan that she has requested.

Yesika's dream is to be able to continue working and get her children ahead so they can improve themselves academically.

loans.use: to purchase more jocote, custard apples, and bananas, which are the fruits being harvested and are abundant right now, which will help her a lot.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, T-shirts, shirts, and skirts.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: para comprar:hilos, cierre, botones, agujas, alfileres, carruchas, bies, elástico,

loans.name: Chamroen's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Bakan district, Chamroen is a 41-year-old widow with two kids. The main source of the family’s income is from growing cassava, which Chamroen has been doing for twenty-three years. With her current business, she can earn about KHR 34,000 per day to spend on daily expenses.
