This is Chamroen's first loan with VisionFund, and she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland, and she hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her income and consequently improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy zinc sheeting to repair the roof on her home.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
Domingas is married and has four children. Her husband is a carpenter who repairs roofs, and they have a very simple house.

She is taking out a loan of $600 to improve her business, and she will buy materials for home repairs such as cement, sand, stone and wood. Her business helps her to generate income for her family. She started it in 2010 with her own working capital. 

She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy materials for home repairs such as cement, sand, stone and wood

loans.name: G.s Los Angelitos#3 Group

texts.es:
La Joven Iris es una persona honesta y responsable vive en un municipio en la zona  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es compra y venta de gallinas y cerdos desde hace un año.
Iris el préstamo lo necesita para surtir su negocio con una gran variedad de gallinas. Con el préstamo espera  que sus ventas aumenten gracias a que contara con más mercancía que ofrecer a los clientes que la visitan y así cubrir sus necesidades, así mismo desea  que  mejore el estilo  de vida y se vea reflejado  con esta inversión.
Iris en unos años el  sueña con extender su negocio a otros municipios en la zona de esa forma podrá tener mayor cantidad de clientes que compren su producto  y podrá seguir apoyando a  sus hijos  a que se conviertan en personas de bien para la  sociedad.
Doña. Eldenia su negocio es la venta de cerdos y gallinas  desde hace 4  años.
Doña Luz su negocio es  venta de gallinas desde hace varios años.

Choluteca, Honduras – Julio 2014
texts.en:
Iris is an honest and responsible person. She lives in a town in the southern part of Honduras.   Her business has been buying and selling chickens and pigs for a year.  

Iris needs the loan to stock her business with a wide variety of chickens.  With the loan, she hopes that her sales will increase because she will have more merchandise to offer her customers who visit her. That way, she can cover her needs. She also wants to improve her life style and for that to be reflected with this loan. 

Iris dreams of expanding her business in a few years to other towns in the area. That way, she can have a wider variety of customers who will buy her products and she will be able to keep supporting her children so they can become good members of society. 

Eldenia's business has been selling pigs and chickens for 4 years. 
Luz' business has been selling chickens for several years.

loans.use: to buy chickens for her business.

loans.name: Felisberta

texts.en:
Felisberta is taking out a loan of $800 to improve her business. She runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as candles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, coffee, sugar, salt, slippers, body lotion, fish, biscuits, bread, oils and shampoo. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $150.  

She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy candles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, coffee, sugar, salt, slippers, body lotion, fish, biscuits, bread, oils and shampoo

loans.name: Vic Bryan

texts.en:
This is Vic Bryan, 25, resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Genna, his business partner, and they have a child. He is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Vic Bryan operates a handicraft business. He buys the raw materials used in handicraft-making from a supplier and then manufactures them into different products and sells them by the piece at a profit. He uses Capiz shells, which are mother-of-pearl shells found in Visayas. The products that he produces from these shells can range from picture panels and frames to decorative balls, plates, decorative bowls, candle holders, tiles, flower vases, door hanging chimes, soap dishes and other products of the like. Capiz shell products are recognized in the world market. Using them as decorations and embellishments can turn a simple spot into a cozy, stylish and elegant place. Customers are attracted to buy due to his low prices and the many options he offers. His regular customers are the local community, and he earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. He will use the loan to buy the raw materials and supplies needed in his business. He then expects a boost in his business income as he increases his business.

Vic Bryan dreams of expanding his business and helping to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

He meets up with his co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in his business.

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en:
Bolormaa, 37 years old, lives with her husband, daughter and son in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. 

She has been working as a hairdresser at a barbershop since 2008. Her husband runs a taxi service for local people. Their daughter goes to high school while their son stays at home. 

She is requesting a loan of 1,300,000 MNT to buy planks in order to repair her fences. With time, the fences surrounding her land have become damaged and there are lots of gaps in them. After repair, the fences will prohibit any animal from entering her land and will protect the vegetables she grows.

loans.use: to repair fences in order to protect the vegetables growing on her land

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
This is Gloria, 42, resident of Capiz, Philippines. She is married and has children. She and her husband manage their own household while also operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Gloria operates a buy-and-sell business. She buys different items which she thinks are saleable, and then sells them at a small profit. Her products are glue, band-aids, batteries, ballpens and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy from her due to her low prices and the many options she offers. Aside from this, she runs a direct selling business for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she increases her sales.

Gloria hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional glue, band-aids, batteries, ballpens and other products needed in her buy-and-sell business.

loans.name: Altanbayar

texts.en:
Altanbayar, is 46 years old and lives with her husband, son and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. 

With her previous loan, she purchased a low pressure heater and cut her coal and electricity costs by half. But over the past years, her precious heater has became out of service. So she is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy a new low pressure heater which is more advanced than its predecessor. As a result, she can continue to run her rental business at low cost. Her son, who worked in Korea, came back to Mongolia and is currently working at a construction site.

loans.use: to buy a low pressure heater in order to cut electricity and coal costs.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
Ermelinda ia applying for a loan of 800 USD to improve her business. This is her first loan. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as oils, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milks, coffee, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, and fish.

Ermelinda opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of 250 USD. She is earning a good income, and she will use the income to support her family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy oils, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milks, coffee, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, and fish

loans.name: Lola

texts.ru: Лола жительница района Рудаки. Ей 26 лет. Она замужем и имеет одного ребенка. Ее муж работает продавцом на рынке. Сама Лола портниха. Она берет заказы на пошив женских национальных платьев. Лола занимается шитьем в течение 3 лет. Она любит свое дело и хочет расширить его. На сумму кредита Лола собирается приобрести новую швейную машинку. В будущем она хочет брать к себе учениц для обучения их кройки и шитью. Таким образом она увеличит прибыльность своего дела.
texts.en: Lola lives in the Rudaki district and is 26 years old. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a salesman at the market and she is a seamstress. She has been sewing for three years and takes orders for traditional women's dresses. She loves her work and wants to expand her business activities. Lola is planning to use the loan to buy a new sewing machine. In the future she wants to take on an apprentice for training and increase the profitability of her business.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Yeraldina

texts.es:
Yeraldina, una mujer carismática y amante de sus hijos siempre ha querido ser independiente y manejar sus propios ingresos.

Ha trabajado gran parte de su vida en el trabajo domestico en diferentes hogares del municipio de Puerto Triunfo, pero hoy en día desea iniciar con el montaje de una tienda de abarrotes en su propia casa buscando poder obtener unos buenos ingresos y poder estar más pendiente de sus hijos.

Para esto necesita un apoyo económico para realizar la compra de un enfriador, estanterías, vitrinas y surtido en productos básicos de la canasta familiar.

Con este préstamo podrá iniciar con su negocio y comenzar a recorrer el camino para ser independiente.

Apoya a una madre tenaz y trabajadora de Colombia con un crédito!
texts.en:
Yeraldina, a charismatic woman who loves her children, has always wanted to be independent and manage her own income.

She has worked a big part of her life in housekeeping in different homes in the town of Puerto Triunfo.  Now she wants to start setting up a grocery store in her own home, hoping to be able to earn a good income and watch over her children more.  For that she needs some economic support to purchase a cooler, shelving, display cases, and a supply of basic staples.

With this loan she'll be able to set up her business and start down the road to being independent.

Support a tenacious and hardworking mother from Colombia with a loan!

loans.use: to buy a cooler, a display case, shelving, and groceries

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 49 years old and blessed with only one child. 

She engages in buying and reselling various fruits and vegetables to help her husband in gaining income. She aims to continue and strengthen this business in order to earn sufficient income. 

Due to capital insufficiency, she would like to access financial assistance from KIVA lenders. It will amount to 20,000 PHP to buy more stocks of various fruits and vegetables to resell in another province. Being a patient and industrious mother, she believes that she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of various fruits and vegetables to resell

location.town: Brgy. Bone South, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for labor to help her clean the parcel of land where they are going to work and to buy the rest of the fertilizers, because they received an agricultural package from the government, but it was not sufficient for what they are going to plant.

loans.name: Zhazgul

texts.ru: Жазгул 34 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. У нее высшее образование, работает учителем химии в школе. Жазгул в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством , стартовав в 2010 году с суммы 10,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду, Жазгул на сегодняшний день имеет 2 коровы, 1 теленка, 2 лошади, 8 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жазгул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку корма и сена для скота. Скоро зима, скот Жазгул будет содержать в сараях, поэтому нужно заготовить корм, что также поможет Жазгул увеличить поголовье скота, так как будут все условия для его содержания. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность купить участок для постройки дома для сына.
texts.en: Zhazgul is 34, married, and the mother of four children. She has a university degree and is a high school chemistry teacher. She also raises livestock in order to earn additional income for her family. She started out in animal husbandry in 2010 with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Zhazgul currently has two cows, one calf, two horses, and eight sheep. In order to expand her business, she applied for a loan with Bai-Tushum Bank for 50,000 som (KGS) to buy feed and hay. Winter is coming soon and the animals will stay in the barn, so Zhazgul will need to be able to provide all of the necessary conditions for their well-being. She plans to use the profits from the loan to invest in the continued expansion of her business and to purchase a plot of land to build a house for her son.

loans.use: To purchase feed and hay for livestock in order to be prepared for winter

loans.name: Sikikadi Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de cinq femmes, les membres du groupe Sikikadi sont toutes  mariés dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge de 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Ouenzindougou  dans la commune du  Mandé / cercle de Kati. Elles se sont connues à travers des liaisons de parenté, de voisinage et  de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font la vente du bois de chauffe, du sable, de condiments et de parures. Dans  le souci de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur  2ème cycle de  prêt  solidaire.
Madame Salimata (femme arrêtée à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse du bois. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 chargements de camionnette. Elles s’approvisionnent dans les villages environnants de Bamako. La revente se fait au comptant ou à crédit en ambulant et parfois par commande à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Salimata compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour assurer les soins de santé des enfants. Elle a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en: Made up of five women, the Sikikadi group's members are all married in monogamous households. On average, they are 35 years old and have four children. They all live in Ouenzindougou in the Mandé commune/Kati circle. They know one another through parental, neighborhood and revenue-making business ties. The members of the group sell firewood, sand, vegetables for making sauces, and linen sets. With the goal of building up their stocks, the members of the group decided to ask Soro Yiriwaso for help and are on their second group loan. Ms. Salimata (the woman at the far left of the photo) is a large seller of wood. She expect to use her loan to buy two truckloads. She stocks up in the villages surrounding Bamako. The resale takes place for cash and for credit, and sales are made on foot and sometimes through orders, to a clientele made up mostly of women. With this loan, Ms. Salimata expects to make an average monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA, which will be used to care for the health of the children. As her objective, she wants to increase the volume of her business through this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase firewood.

loans.name: Gurragchaa

texts.en: Mr. Gurragchaa, 33 years old, lives with his wife, two sons, and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been providing taxi services to local people since 2009. His wife is a janitor and works at a private firm. Their three children all go to secondary school. He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to buy study materials such as books, pencils, and notebooks for his children, as the academic year begins next week. His children are all enthusiastic about their studies, and providing them with study materials will further support their academic success.

loans.use: to buy study materials such as books and pencils

loans.name: Tati

texts.en:
Tati, her husband, and their two children live in Ciamis, a small city in West Java province.

To support the family, Tati and her husband manage a small shop that sells snacks, drinks, mobile phone airtime credits, and electronic bill payments. She joined Ruma because she wanted to try out the mobile airtime business. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. 

As the business runs, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to do more transactions on weekends. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 28 years old and has one child in school.

She is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Jean has been pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Jean requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds for her pigs.

In the future, Jean would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti is a housewife who manages a business of mobile phones, mobile phone accessories, mobile phone airtime credits, and electronic bill payment. 

Siti’s husband is a construction worker. They live in Tangerang, a satellite city located at the south of Jakarta. 

Siti joined Ruma because she wanted to increase her family’s income. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. 

As the business runs, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to do more transactions on weekends. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Allakabo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Allakabo est uniquement composé de femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune de Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits, du lait et de condiments. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata  (femme arrêtée à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits (bazins, léger et pagnes wax) de plusieurs qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 15 mètres de bazins, 10 mètres de léger et 10 pièces de pagnes wax  en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails  à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Fatoumata  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en: The Allakabo group is solely made up of monogamous women. On average, they are 38 years old and have four children. They all live in the Kanadjiguila commune of Mandé/Kati circle and know one another through neighborhood ties. The group members run small businesses selling clothing, milk and vegetables for sauces. With the goal of increasing their business funds, the group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third group loan cycle. Ms. Fatoumata (the woman at the far left of the photo) has a great reputation in the sale of clothing (damask, light cloth, and traditional, colorful wax cloths) of various qualities. She expects to use her loan to buy 15 meters of damask, 10 meters of light cloth, and 10 traditional, colorful wax cloths at wholesale in Bamako. The resale will take place at retail to a clientele largely made up of women. With this loan, Ms. Fatoumata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA which will be used to reinvest in her business. Through her relationship with Soro Yiriwaso, her objective is to buy a plot of land to use for housing.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Suvdantsetseg

texts.en:
Suvdantsetseg, 43 years old, lives with her daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a janitor at a private firm since 2012. Her daughter studies at university and will graduate next year. 

The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years and it needs some serious repair. So she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. 

After renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and fewer pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate her house in order to burn less coal for heating.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Susan works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing and e-loading (prepaid mobile). Susan is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Susan has sustained her business activities through 27 previous loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en:
Sarun, a local farmer from Kampot province, is 39 years old and married. She is a mother blessed with two children who are in school. 

To overcome the needs of her household, she does farming and animal husbandry, and she works as a school teacher. Her family can earn extra income via a coffee-selling business. 

This is a new loan for Sarun with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she wants focus on her child’s education. Therefore, she has requested an education loan to pay for school fees and to buy school materials for her daughter, who wants to pursue a Bachelor's degree, majoring in accounting. 

She hopes that her daughter can graduate university successfully.

loans.use: To pay for school fees and to buy school materials for her daughter.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
As one way of generating income, Mary has been engaged in buying and reselling fruits and vegetables while her husband cultivates their small farm. 

She is 35 years old and blessed with three schooling children. Due to the high cost of school fees and commodities, she needs to increase her income to support the education of her children. 

To further improve her business, she would like to request a PHP 14,000 loan from Kiva lenders to buy more stocks of tomatoes, onions, ginger and cabbages to resell. She is hoping that she will receive her loan request to be able to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of tomatoes, onions, ginger and cabbages to resell.

location.town: Brgy. Bone South, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Samsuri

texts.en: Samsuri is a father of three who lives wth his family in Cianjur, a small city situated at the foot of Mount Gede-Pangrango, West Java. He manages a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, mobile phone airtime credits, and bill payment service. He was first introduced to Ruma by his friend who is also a Ruma agent. Samsuri joined Ruma because he wanted to increase his income. His transaction from selling mobile airtime and processing bill payments can take up to 75 transactions per day. As the business runs, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to do more transactions on weekends. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: An

texts.en:
An, 63, who is a lovely mother of two dependent children and four married children, lives in a small community of Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in a farming business for nearly 40 years. On her farmland she grows rice and sells the crop to the local dealers. Sometimes she sells directly to customers at the market. 

An wants to update her lifestyle by having a motorbike to use in her family. Due to a shortage of money, she would like to get a Kiva loan to buy a motorbike. With the support of this loan, An hopes that she can use her dream motorbike as the main vehicle for carrying her crop to the market and for traveling around her community. She would like to give thanks to all the lenders for their generous behaviors.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Naranbat

texts.en: Mr. Naranbat, 28 years old, lives with his wife and son in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. He has been working as a senior officer at a military division since 2009. He was holding his duties in Afghanistan and South Sudan in the last five years. His wife works at a fuel station. He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. As a result, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Grupo Barrio La Alameda Group

texts.es:
De 53 años de edad Zoila tiene 5 hijos por la que se esfuerza todos los días que le quedan de vida, ella lucha por el futuro de sus hijos para que ellos tengan la condición de vida mejor a la que ella tubo, sus tres primeros hijos ya tienen familias apartes, los dos últimos son buenos estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad donde ellos viven. (Zoila es la que se encuentra en medio del grupo que tiene puesta una blusa rozada)
La actividad que ella realiza con  todo empeño todos los días es al cultivo de maíz ya que para ella se ha convertido en un buen negocio para tener un ingresos económico, ella viene realizando dicha actividad durante 20 años a ella le ha gustado ver crecer la milpa y como llega el tiempo de cosecha, ella realiza esta actividad con su esposo y si les ha dejado buena ganancia.
Ella se ha convertido en un gran ejemplo en su comunidad donde ella vive, es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se ha decidido a reunirse con ella para emprender juntos el negocio de la venta de maíz para que ellas también tengan las condiciones de vidas adecuadas.
El motivo de la realización del préstamo es para la compra de fertilizantes para que su cosecha salgan mejores que los años anteriores, los sueños de Zoila en conjunto con su espose es poder instalar en su comunidad un depósito de venta de maíz para poder atender mejor a las personas que requieren de este producto de primera necesidad como lo es el maíz.
texts.en:
At 53 years old Zoila has five children for whom she will struggle all the days that are left for her to live. She fights for the future of her children so that they have better living conditions than those she had. Her three oldest children now have their own families. The last two are good students in the local school they attend. (Zoila is in the middle of the group with the pink blouse) Her business which she does with determination every day is growing corn. It has turned out to be a good business for producing economic income. She has been doing this for 20 years. She likes to watch the corn grow and come harvest time she does this labor with her husband and they make a good profit.

She has become an example for the community where she lives. So a group of women have decided to joined together with her to undertake the business of selling corn so that they also have adequate living conditions. The reason for this loan is to buy fertilizer so that this harvest turns out better than the previous ones. Zoila's dream is together with her husband to set up a warehouse to sell corn in her community to better serve the people who need this primary product, corn.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Belle-Dame Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Belle-dame est  majoritairement composé  de femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 34ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djicoroni l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, mèches, habits et dépôt de gaz. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mama (femme arrêtée à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des mèches de plusieurs qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 80 paquets de mèches à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails  à Djicoroni à une clientèle composée de femmes. Madame Mama espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en: The Belle-dame group is largely made up of monogamous women. On average, they are 34 years old and have 2 children. They all live in Djicoroni, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako, and know one another through neighborhood ties. The group members run small businesses selling hair extensions, clothing, and a gas station. With the goal of increasing their business funds, the group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fourth group loan cycle. Ms. Mama (the woman at the extreme left of the photo) has a great reputation in the sale of hair extensions of various quality. She expects to use her loan to buy 80 packs of hair extensions in Bamako. The resale takes place at retail in Djicoroni to a clientele made up of women. With this loan, Ms. Mama hopes to make an average monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA which will be used to reinvest in her business. Her objective through her relationship with Soro Yiriwaso is to buy a plot of land to use for housing.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions

loans.name: Rith

texts.en:
Rith, 41 years old, is a hard-working woman who lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province. She has four dependent children who are enrolling in the local school. She also has one married child. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small farm that is located near her house. On her farmland, she grows rice, which she sells to the local dealers. So far, she has been involved in this career for 14 years. The average income that she can earn is 4 USD per day.

Rith would like to keep her rice growing well by using natural fertilizers on her farmland. Due to insufficient money, she has applied for a loan to buy fertilizers to use in her farming process. With the support from this loan, she hopes her rice will growing well and bring a higher yield. She would like to thank all lenders for their financial support of poor people.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Dorys Jacinta

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Esperanza De los Bajos.
En este lugar vive la señora Doris, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 23, 18 y 16 años, el menor estudia en colegio, los dos menores aun viven con ella. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Doris es una muy buena esposa que con la finalidad de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto salir adelante y ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, zapatillas, entre otras cosas, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan alguna prenda,  ella sale a recorrer tres días de la semana más que todo en las mañanas, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Tiene 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.  Lleva dos años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un gran local.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great variety of typical products such as toquilla straw hats, known inside and outside of the country, the members of the Credit Group 'Nueva Esperanza De los Bajos' meet every 15 days. 

In this place lives Señora Dorys. She is 42 years old, is married, and from her marriage has three children ages 23, 18, and 16. The youngest studies in college, and the two youngest still live with her. Her husband is a driver. 

Doña Dorys is a very good wife. With the intention of earning something on her own, and with this getting ahead and helping her husband with the family costs, she works selling clothing of all types and shoes, among other things. Her form of selling is door to door and she also sells in her house where her customers arrive when they need an item. She goes around three days a week, more often in the mornings. She allows her customers to use credit, and she collects every 15 days. She has worked at this for 3 years, and started the business using the first credit that she received from the group.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing. She has been in the Credit Group for 2 years, and she likes it because with the first loan she began her business. Her dreams are to have a large store.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Los Jardines Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS JARDINES” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por once  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de lencería, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida, venta de api, venta de ropa, bordado de disfraces, venta de llantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Virginia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió con la ayuda de su familia, quien le prestó un capital para iniciar el negocio. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de víveres por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “LOS JARDINES” communal bank is starting their 3rd cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Senkata regional office. It is composed of eleven members lead by a board of directors with Virginia as President. The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied amongst them are: the sale of lingerie, selling cosmetics, selling meals, the sale of api (a corn drink), clothing sales, embroidering costumes and the sale of tires.

The loan will benefit all these micro-entrepreneurs, Virginia being one. She says that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer on the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. She runs a business which is a neighborhood store. She started the business with the help of her family who lend her capital to start the business.

The loan she is receiving will be used to increase her capital (buying food wholesale) which she will acquire at the markets of the city of El Alto which she will later sell in her sales place. This method of working allows her to generate resources to support her family as she is married and has three children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she likes the savings and the health services that the institute provides.

loans.use: to buy food wholesale.

loans.name: Manuchehr

texts.ru: Манучехр целеустремленный молодой человек в возрасте 23 лет. Он уже женат и живет с женой и родителями в районе Бохтар. Манучехр начинает новый бизнес. Ему помогает его тесть. Дело в том, что отец жены является бизнесменом и у него имеются две торговые точки на рынке. На одном точке он работает сам, а вторая точка пустеет. Он решил эту точку отдать своему зятю, чтобы помочь ему в начинании дела. Манучехр имеет начальный капитал, но он маленький. Поэтому он обратился за кредитом для купли товара. Манучехр будет заниматься продажей мужской одежды. Он уже сейчас верит в успешность своего нового бизнеса и ожидает поддержки от Вас. Благодаря кредиту у него наконец-то будет работа.
texts.en: Manuchehr is an ambitious young man at the age of 23. He is already married and lives with his wife and parents in the Bohtar district. Manuchehr is starting a new business and his father-in-law is helping him. The fact is that his wife's father is a businessman and has two sales locations at the market. His father-in-law works at one location while the other stays empty, so he decided to give the empty location to his son-in-law in order to help him start a business. Manuchehr has a only a small amount of start-up capital, so he applied for a loan to buy retail goods. He will sell men's clothing. He believes that his new business will be successful and awaits your support. Thanks to the loan he will finally have work.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of men's clothes and start a new business

loans.name: Nemassorola Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Nemassorola est uniquement  composé de  femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune de Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits, du lait et de chaussures. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Siewa Gogo (femme arrêtée à l’extrême  droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits (basins) de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 60m de basins en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails  à Kanadjiguila à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Siewa Gogo espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Nemassorola group is made up solely of monogamous women. They average 44 years of age with four children each, and they all live in Kanadjiguila in the municipality of Mandé, which lies in the Kati circle. The group members got to know each other as neighbors and they have small businesses selling clothing, milk and shoes. They decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso with a view to expanding their businesses and they are on their third group loan.

Siewa Gogo (who is standing on the far right of the photo) has a good reputation for selling clothing (damask fabric) of the highest quality. She is planning to use her loan to buy 60 meters of damask fabric wholesale in Bamako. She resells her goods on a retail basis in Kanadjiguila to a customer base made up mainly of women. With this loan, Siewa Gogo is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 150,000FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business. Through this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso, she aims to buy a plot of land to live on.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Yoeun

texts.en:
Yoeun, 69 years old, is a widowed woman who lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has one unmarried child, and six married children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small farmland which was located near her house. On her farmland, she grows rice and sells her agricultural product to the local dealers. So far, she has been involved in this career for nearly 50 years. 

Yoeun would like to keep her rice growing well by using natural fertilizers on her farmland. Due to insufficient of money, she has applied for a loan to buy fertilizer to use in her farming process. 

With the support from this loan, she hopes her rice will growing well and brings more crops to her. She would like to thank all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Due to the hardship of living, Luzviminda aimed to improve her business to increase her income and support the education of her four children. She engages in buying and reselling of various fruits and vegetables to help her husband in gaining income. 

Having inadequate capital, she would like to avail a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy various fruits and vegetables to sell in the local community. 

She is hoping that this financial assistance will be a great help for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy various fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Banner Alcides

texts.es:
Banner de 33 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora en la agricultura, siembra de granos básicos y hortalizas, su nivel de estudio es hasta bachillerato comenta que sus padres no pudieron seguir dándole el estudio en la universidad por la falta de dinero, él está acompañado y padre de 2 hijos de las edades de 7 años que está estudiando en la escuela y el pequeño de 3 años que se encuentra en casa, su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar  y cuidar de sus hijos en el hogar. 

Banner se dedica a la agricultura en la siembra de hortalizas y granos básicos, toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura gracias a su padre que le enseño este trabajo de cultivar la tierra, tiene aproximadamente 25 años de dedicarse a la agricultura. Además de tener esta actividad también es motorista de un camión que tiene, realiza viajes de materiales de construcción y también para trasladar los frutos de las hortalizas, comenta que el camión lo obtuvo gracias a los ahorros de toda su vida pues es otra actividad que le genera ingresos económicos extras para su familia y de esta manera tener una mejor calidad de vida. Los cultivos los tiene en una propiedad heredada por su padre a una distancia aproximadamente de un kilómetro de distancia que tiene que caminar.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar fertilizante y abono para las plantas y un tratamiento para las plagas que le está afectando sus cultivos, gracias al financiamiento le permitirá poder comprar fertilizantes he insecticidas para sus cultivos y de esta manera no se le contaminen y los pueda perder, obtener mayores ganancias con la venta de la cosecha.

En primer lugar desea para el futuro que sus dos hijos sean personas de bien en la sociedad y que puedan estudiar mucho ya que él no tuvo la oportunidad de seguir estudiando, también desea ampliar más sus cultivos ya que él ve que es una actividad que le genera grandes ganancias y también comprar otro camión ya que la demanda para trabajar jalando material es bastante y el comenta que no da abasto con un solo camión, esto lo lograra con mucho trabajo y haciendo de las ganancias una buena administración.
texts.en:
Banner, age 33, is a very hard working person who works in agriculture. He plants grains and vegetables. He studied for a bachelor's degree. He says that his parents were not able to continue providing for his university studies because they didn't have the money. He has two children, ages 7 and 3. The 7-year-old is in school and the little 3-year-old is at home. His wife does the housework and cares for the children.
Banner works in agriculture, planting vegetables and grains. He has worked in agriculture all his life, thanks to his father who taught him. He has been working in agriculture for about 25 years. He also drives a truck, which he owns. He transports construction materials, as well as his own crops. He says that he obtained the truck thanks to saving up all his life. This is another activity that generates extra income for his family and allows them to have a greater quality of life. He inherited his farmland from his father, and it is located about a kilometre away; he walks there.
The loan that he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to purchase fertilizer and manure for his plants, as well as a treatment for the pests that are affecting his crops. This loan will allow him to buy fertilizers and insecticides for his crops, so that they will not be lost or damaged. He will be able to obtain a greater income with the sales of his harvest.
For the future, first of all, he wants his children to be good people in society and to be able to study a great deal, since he did not have the opportunity to keep studying. He also wants to expand his cultivation since this is an activity that generates him much income. He wants to buy another truck because the demand for transporting construction materials is high and he says he isn't covering it with just one truck. He will achieve this with great hard work and good administration of his earnings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure for his plants, as well as a treatment against pests.

loans.name: Mukhtar

texts.en:
Mukhtar, age 45, is a responsible mother. She lives happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is her sixth loan with BRAC Pakistan and her first with Kiva.
 
Her son owns a recycling shop and deals with scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, and other materials. He buys scrap goods and sells them to the recycling factories. Due to current household expenses, he does not have enough money to buy scrap goods. He also does not have scrap to sell to make more money. Therefore, Mukhtar has requested a loan for her son, so that he can buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and save some money to meet sudden needs or incidents.
 
She is very impressed with this honorable support and has expressed an interest in taking more loans after the payment of this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner  BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy scrap goods

loans.name: Nyeleni Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les cinq membres du groupe  Nyeleni ont en moyenne 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé dans le cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits, des céréales, des condiments et de la restauration. Dans l’intention d’accroitre leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mariam (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse d’habits. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 60m de bazins en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Kanadjiguila en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Mariam compte avoir  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The majority of the five members of the Nyeleni group live in monogamous households and they average 38 years of age with four children each. They all live in Kanadjiguila in the municipality of Mandé, which lies in the Kati circle. The group members got to know each other as neighbors and through their income-generating activities at Kanadjiguila market; they all have small businesses selling clothing, cereals and condiments and practising restauration. They decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso with a view to expanding their businesses and they are on their third group loan.

Mariam (who is sitting on the far right of the photo) is a great vendor of clothing and is planning to use her loan to buy 60 meters of damask fabric wholesale in Bamako. She resells her goods door-to-door on a retail basis in Kanadjiguila to a customer base made up mainly of women. With this loan, Mariam is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 150,000FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business and to provide for her household's small needs.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel tiene 43 años de edad, vive en casa familiar, ella es madre soltera vive con sus dos hijos de edades 19 y 15 años de los cuales el segundo cursa secundaria en colegio nacional del distrito de Pucará. Cliente vive en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza María es la venta de ataúdes, trabaja con la municipalidad de Pucara y la Posta Médica, ella cuenta con 25 años de experiencia en el rubro, las compras lo realiza en Jaén y la venta en Pucará. Además se dedica a brindar servicios de costura, trabajos en casa así como también lavado de ropa; ingresos adicionales que le permiten solventar el crédito sin ningún problema. El destino del crédito será para invertir en su negocio surtiendo con nuevos modelos de ataúdes que hay en el mercado con ello le generara mejores ingresos, mayores ganancias y de esta forma podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y al de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maribel is 43 years old. She is a single mother who lives with her two children aged 15 and 19 in her family's house. They study in Secondary school at the National College of the District of Pucará. She lives in the rural part of the district of Pucará, in the province of Jaén, Cajamarca Region, in the North Andes of Peru.

Maribel 's business is selling coffins and she has 25 years experience in the field. She works with the Municipality of Pucará and the medical center. She makes her purchases in Jaén and her sales in Pucará. Besides this she offers sewing services, doing housework as well as washing clothing. These additional activities allow her to pay off the loan with no problem.

The loan will be used to stock her business with new models of coffins that are on the market. with this she will generate more income, greater profit and in this way improve the quality of living for herself and her children.

loans.use: to stock her business with new models of coffins.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela, age 38, is a married woman. She is a hardworking and brave mother, who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. Being a mother, she wants to provide better basic facilities for her children; this is the reason she is doing extraordinarily hard work to keep her children at smiling.

Shakeela started sewing clothes after the birth of her two children when she observed that her husband was failing to provide all the necessities for the children. Then she decided to start tailoring work at home, and till now, she is sewing clothes. She wants to enhance the beauty of her stitching, so she wants to buy a Juki sewing machine. Professional persons use this machine for tailoring because its speed is good and its work is very fine. She knows the techniques of tailoring very well. Her regular customers are mostly her neighbors, relatives and the local community persons. 

Shakeela has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. Shakeela is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a Juki sewing machine for sewing clothes.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 55-year-old married woman. She has been doing embroidery by her hands at home for many years to support her family. In fact, her husband remains sick most of the time and is unable to do a job. For the sake of her children, and to meet household expenses, she started embroidery at home. A supplier comes to her home and provides her all the raw materials for doing embroidery; she completed her tasks along her daughters over a wooden frame. She wants to sells her handmade embroidery directly into the market so that she can earn more profit for her family. She has become expert in her art, and wants to buy raw materials her own so that she can sell her handmade embroidery in her hometown.

Therefore, Bushra has requested a loan to buy raw materials so she can do more embroidery dresses to sell, and can generate maximum income. 

She is a mother of five daughters and two sons. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of revenue to provide a quality education to her children.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for embroidery.

loans.name: Siguidia Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de quatre femmes, les membres du groupe Siguidia sont majoritairement  mariées et vie dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 38 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djicoroni l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe mènent  des activités génératrices de revenu  différent, notamment la vente de produits cosmétiques et habits. Dans  le souci d’élargir et d’agrandir   leurs activités, elles ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso et  sont  à leur  4ème   prêt  en solidaire.
Madame Assan (femme arrêtée à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une bonne notoriété, car  les produits cosmétiques sont très pris par les femmes à  Djicoroni. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 15 cartons de parfums et 8 cartons de pommades. Elles s’approvisionnent à Bamako.  Elle mène ses activités à Djicoroni à une clientèle de femmes. Madame Assan compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen de 45 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour satisfaire son besoin et investir le reste dans son activité. Madame a pour objectif de fidéliser  ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’en profiter beaucoup de prêt.
texts.en:
The majority of the four members of the Siguidia group are married and live in monogamous households. They average 38 years of age with three children each, and they all live in Djicoroni, a district of Bamako. They got to know each other through the district's "tontines" (revolving finance systems where each member contributes periodically an agreed amount and this is passed on in rotation to other members) and their income-generating activities. The group members have different income-generating activities, notably selling cosmetics and clothing. They decided to turn to Soro Yiriwaso with a view to expanding their businesses and they are on their fourth group loan.

Assan (who is standing on the far left of the photo) has a good reputation, as her cosmetics are very popular with the women in Djicoroni. She is planning to use her loan to buy 15 cartons of perfumes and eight cartons of creams. She gets her supplies in Bamako and runs her business in Djicoroni selling to her female customer base. Assan is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 45,000FCFA, which will be used to provide for her own needs and to reinvest in her business. She aims to strengthen this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso, so that she can benefit from a large number of loans.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood and nails to repair the roof of his dwelling.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
Gulbahor is hardworking young woman; she is 21 years old. Gulbahor is not married, and lives with her parents. She began her business one year ago. She studied at the course,‘To Get Ahead’, with a woman's organization, and in this way she started her business. Now her business is going well. Gulbahor works in an atelier (workshop), and she offers a sewing service. 

Gulbahor helps her parents with managing the household. Her mother has applied to the university. She wants to get a higher education, but she has not money to pay for tuition. Gulbahor must help her mother. 

So, she is asking for a loan of 2,500 Somoni to pay for tuition of her mother. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay her mother's tuition

loans.name: Anibal Lorenzo

texts.es: Aníbal es un microempresario emprendedor, quien tiene la edad de 57 años, casado y padre de dos hijos, por quienes lucha cada día, para darle los alimentos cada día, se dedica a la comercialización de ropa nueva en el mercado de  la municipalidad, este negocio lo impulso hace veinte años, cuando decidió vender un terreno que su padre le había heredado, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de camisetas blancas, camisolas, talladores, pantalones para damas y caballeros, trajes de niños, etc. Uno de sus logros ha sido la variedad de productos ofrecidos.
texts.en:
Aníbal is an entrepreneurial micro-business owner. He is 57 years old, married and the father of two children, for whom he strives every day. To feed them every day he sells new clothing in the area’s market. He launched this business twenty years ago when he decided to sell a plot of land that his father had left to him. 

He will use the loan to buy white t-shirts, sports shirts, bras, men’s and women’s trousers, children’s outfits etc. One of his successes has been the variety of products that he offers.

loans.use: to buy white t-shirts, sports shirts, bras, men’s and women’s trousers, children’s outfits etc.

loans.name: Joveline

texts.en:
Joveline is married and has two children. She gain profits thru her duck raising business, while her husband is managing their farm. Joveline is doing her best to give enough support, morally and financially, to her children. Perhaps someday her children will finish their studies and became professionals. Joveline shared that sometimes it is hard to maintain her ducks feed because at the same time she is also providing a daily allowance of her children. 

At this point, Joveline is requesting a loan of P23,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of her ducks. By availing the loan, it was a big help for Joveline to lessen her burdens in supporting her ducks feed.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of her ducks.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 51 years old and blessed with three children. She owns and manages a small retail store, while her husband works on their farm. Due to financial hardship, she aims to improve her store in order to earn a higher income. 

Having insufficient capital, she would like to avail a loan of PHP10,000 to buy more canned goods, noodles, laundry soaps, eggs, beverages, seasonings, snack foods and soft drinks to sell. Through this financial assistance, she believes that she will further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, noodles, laundry soaps, eggs, beverages, seasonings, snack foods and soft drinks

location.town: Brgy. Bone South, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of four school-aged children from Leyte, Philippines. She runs a sari-sari or retail business selling various goods to the people in her place. Ann has been in the business for more than five years now. This is her source of income. 

Ann's business was ruined when a typhoon hit the country several months ago. At present, Ann is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, bread and snack foods, noodles, sodas, coffee and sugar, soap and toiletries. With this she will be able to augment her inventory  which will attract more buyers to her store. In the future, Ann has hopes of making her business a success. Furthermore, Ann wants to save money for the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, bread and snack foods, noodles, sodas, coffee and sugar, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Nixon

texts.en:
Nixon, 37 years of age, is a very passionate, hardworking and dedicated farmer who hails from Kusumek, a remote village in the Litein area of Kenya. He is committed to his wife with whom he is blessed to have one child. Like most small-scale farmers in rural Kenya, he has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years with milk, tea, crops, and some small personal business. He has been able to earn a decent income. He loves dairy farming and has even nicknamed one of his dairy cows “Birirmet” which is from a person’s name. He loves milking Birirmet (the name of his cow) and feeding his cow is his hobby. 

Dairy farming is very fulfilling to Nixon. Although he makes profits from selling milk he is faced with one major challenge that is dragging him behind, that is lack of a proper dairy unit. He is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. A modern dairy unit will assist him to properly feed his cows and also be able to milk them properly. Through the loan his cows will not be affected by harsh weather conditions because they will have a comfortable place to stay. All this will result to increased productivity of milk will lead to improved profits. 

Nixon is a believer that freedom from poverty is a basic human right and through the loan he will get out of the poverty bracket he is in right now. Through Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva he believes that the loan will create ripples of changes in his living conditions. Through a partnership between Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, aspiring men such as Nixon are assured of achieving their dreams through loans and technical financing.

loans.use: To construct a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.en:
Ilhomjon is 18 years old. He likes to read books. He has read a lot of books in Tajik and Russian. Ilhomjon also likes football. He graduated school and has applied to the university. He is a student of the first course. He is happy now. 

Ilhomjon must pay for tuition and that’s why he is applying for a loan from IMON and KIVA. He really needs financial support and wants to study in the university. He is asking for a loan of 800 USD to pay for tuition. He awaits your support and generosity.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Ma. Elisa

texts.en:
Ma. Elisa is a married woman and a mother of five children from Leyte, Philippines. She is owns a motorcycle which her husband uses to transport passengers in their area. Ma. Elisa is also a rice retailer in their area. 

Ma. Elisa is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for motorcycle like tires, nuts and bolts and also additional rice to sell. With this, she will be able to maintain the working condition of their motorcycle as well as augment their rice stocks which will allow her to sell more to her customers. In the future, Ma. Elisa dreams of improving their business thus augmenting their income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle like tires, nuts and bolts and also additional rice to sell

loans.name: Carmen Lina

texts.es:
Carmen es una madre de familia dedicada, tiene 35 años, es soltera y vive en Huaraz junto a su familia.
Tiene 2 maravillosos hijos quienes significan todo para ella y a quienes día a día les inculca valores para que puedan crecer como personas de bien. Desde hace más de 8 años se dedica a la venta de útiles de escritorio y le va muy bien en su negocio porque siempre ofrece productos de calidad y es muy amable con los clientes.
Carmen en estos momentos quiere comprar una laptop para que su hijo pueda realizar sus trabajos y así pueda obtener buenas calificaciones en el colegio, de esta manera ella sentirá mayor tranquilidad y seguirá esforzándose para poder sacar adelante a su familia y más adelante poder: Ver convertidos en excelentes profesionales a sus hijos".
texts.en:
Carmen is a dedicated mother. She is 35 years old, single and lives in Huaraz together with her family. She has two marvelous children who are everything to her. And day by day she instils in them values that will help them become good people. For more than eight years she has been working selling writing materials. Things are going well for her as she always offers quality products and is very friendly with her clients.

Carmen wants to buy a laptop at this time so that her son can do his schoolwork and get good marks in his school. Doing this she will feel more secure and continue to make the effort to get her family ahead and later be able to see her children become excellent professionals.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a supply of lotions in order to improve her sales and stock her business; in this way she will be able to really move forward.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 42-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. Her husband is a driver by profession, and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. 

He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Yasmeen has applied for a loan for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some engine maintenance need for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service for his passengers. 

Yasmeen is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband, and will bring positive changes to his business.
She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 57 years old and blessed with four children. She and her husband work together to support the necessities of their family. She engages herself in buying and selling fruits and vegetables to generate income. She aims to make her business profitable in order earn a higher income, but she has inadequate capital. 

For this reason, she would like to avail a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy more tomatoes, onions, beans, cabbages and more vegetables to sell. She is hoping that she will obtain her desired loan to be able for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes, onions, beans, cabbages and more vegetables

location.town: Brgy. Bone South, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Nasrullo

texts.en:
Nasrullo was born in 1993. His family is large. There are six people in his family. His is single. 

Nasrullo is a student in the third year; he studies economics. Nasrullo doesn’t work anywhere because he studies full time. 

He is asking for a loan of 800 USD to pay for tuition. He applied to the economic university three years ago because he wants to learn economics to promote the economy developing Tajikistan. 

He awaits your mercy and generosity.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es: Roberto es un microempresario exitoso, tiene la edad de 68 años, casado, se dedica a la comercialización de leña en su domicilio, este negocio lo impulso hace tres años por medio de un préstamo y ha logrado mantener su negocio, es el tercer ciclo que solicita el financiamiento en la institución y asegura que los beneficios han sido múltiples uno de ellos es la compra de este producto en cantidades mayores y por ende mayores ganancias lo que le ha permitido brindarles mejores condiciones de vida. El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de fletes de leñas, pues en su comunidad es uno de los productos que mayor demanda tiene.
texts.en:
Roberto is a successful micro-business owner. He is 68 years old, married, and works selling firewood from his home. He launched this business three years ago using a loan and has managed to maintain his business. 

This is the third loan cycle in which he has asked for finance from the institution, and he assures us that there have been multiple benefits from this. One of these is being able to buy his product in greater quantities, giving a greater income which has offered them a better quality of life.

Roberto is asking for a loan to buy firewood to sell, as it is one of the most in demand products in his community.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell.

loans.name: Saleem Akhtar

texts.en:
Saleem owns a general store in Karachi. He is 45 years old, married, and a father of five children. He has more then 20 years of experience in this business. He has been successful in running this business, and is content with the income his business has generated. But now that his family expenses are increasing day by day, he wants to be proactive and increase his sales to become more profitable. 

For this purpose he has requested for a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva partner, to buy more general store items to attract more customers and generate more revenue.

loans.use: To purchase more items for his general store

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is a 61-year-old married woman from Leyte, Philippines. She earns a living through her sari-sari store and a small eatery. She sells various goods and items, as well as home cooked foods to the people in her place. 

Several months ago, a typhoon hit the country and ruined thousands of houses and businesses, including Visitacion's store. As of this time, Visitacion has just started to rebuild her store again. 

She is now asking for a loan to pay for the repair of her store and to buy groceries to sell in her store, like canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, soda and beverages, biscuits and snack foods. With this, she will be able to sell again and augment her income.

In the future, Visitacion hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of her store and to buy groceries to sell in her store like canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, soda and beverages, biscuits and snack foods

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 37-year-old married woman. She wants to buy a new moto-rickshaw for her husband and son. Both are jobless nowadays; her husband will drive the rickshaw in the daytime and her son at night. This rickshaw is being driven over local roads and for small distances. 

Shabana belongs to an ultra poor family and wants to provide a source of income for both of them. But due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to buy a new moto-rickshaw. 

This is the reason why Shabana has requested a loan to buy a new moto-rickshaw with the contribution of savings for both of them. She hopes that now her husband and son will not be jobless anymore and can easily generate income for the family. 

Shabana thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a moto-rickshaw for her husband and son.

loans.name: Sattor

texts.ru:
Саттор 42-летний мужчина, проживающий в столице, в городе Душанбе. Хотя Саттор имеет высшее педагогическое образование, однако он не работает по профессии.  Он работает водителем и занимается перевозкой пассажиров уже 5 лет.
Саттор женат, имеет 18-летнего сына и 16-летнюю дочь. Его жена работает уборщицей в стоматологии, а дети учатся. 
Саттор сейчас хочет расширить свою деятельность. Он за счет кредита собирается купить микроавтобус марки Hyundai Starex, который имеет 9-местное сиденье. Таким образом он сможет брать больше пассажиров и получать больше дохода, что улучшит его финансовое положение. Поэтому он надеется на этот кредит.
texts.en:
Sattor is a 42-year-old man from the capital city of Dushanbe. While he has a higher education in pedagogy, he doesn't work in his field. Instead, he has been working as a driver transporting passengers for five years. Sattor is married and has an 18-year-old son and a 16-year-old daughter. His wife works as a cleaner in a dentist's office, and his children are in school.

Sattor wants to expand his business and plans to use funds from his loan to buy a Hyundai Starex van with nine seats. With this vehicle he will be able to transport more passengers and increase his revenue, which will improve his financial situation. Therefore he is hoping for this loan.

loans.use: to buy a van for his transportation business

loans.name: Doke Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de cinq femmes, les membres du groupe Dokè sont uniquement  mariées et vie dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 29 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Lafiabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe mènent  des activités génératrices de revenu  différent, notamment la vente de, fruits (oranges, bananes, pommes et melon), jus, lait en poudre et habits. Dans  le souci d’élargir et d’agrandir   leurs activités, elles ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso et  sont  à leur  2ème  prêt  en solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une bonne notoriété, car  les fruits sont très pris par les femmes à Lafiabougou. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 sacs d’orange, 1 corbeille de banane, 1 corbeille de melon et  5 cartons de pommes. Elles s’approvisionnent à  Médine.  Elle mène ses activités au comptant  à Lafiabougou à une clientèle de femmes. Madame Fatoumata compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen de 35 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour satisfaire son besoin et investir le reste dans son activité. Madame a pour objectif de fidéliser  ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’en profiter beaucoup de prêt.
texts.en:
The majority of the five members of the Dokè group are married and living in monogamous households. They average 29 years of age with two children each, and all live in Lafiabougou, a district of Bamako. They got to know each other through the district's "tontines" (revolving finance systems whereby each member periodically contributes an agreed amount and this is passed on in rotation to other members) and their income-generating activities. The group members have different income-generating activities, notably selling fruit (oranges, bananas, apples and melons), juice, powdered milk and clothing. They turned to Soro Yiriwaso with the aim of expanding their businesses and are on their second group loan.

Fatoumata (who is sitting on the far right of the photo) has a good reputation as her fruit is very popular with the women in Lafiabougou. She is planning to use her loan to buy three sacks of oranges, a basket of bananas, a basket of melons and five cartons of apples. She gets her supplies in Médine and sells for cash in Lafiabougou to a female customer base. With this loan Fatoumata expects to make an average monthly profit of 35,000FCFA, which will be used to provide for her own needs and reinvest in her business. Her aim is to build up this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so that she can benefit from a large number of loans.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Emine

texts.en:
Emine is married and the mother of two children. To support her husband, and with her mother-in-law’s help, she began selling Tupperware. She has done this job for three years, selling to her family and neighbors. When she first started her sales were limited, but still enough to support her and her children. Her goal is to become a group leader like her mother-in-law and go on trips abroad. In addition, she wants to increase her sales to earn more and support her children’s education.  With this loan she will buy goods to sell.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Emine Hanım evli iki çocuk annesi.Eşine destek olmak için kayınvalidesinin yardımıyla tupperware üye oluyor ve satış yapmaya başlıyor.  Üç yıldır bu işi yapıyor.  Müşterileri, çevresi ve ailesi .  Bu işte daha yeni olduğundan satışları sınırlı ama gene de kendi ve çocuklarımın ihtiyazçlarını karşılamaya yettiğini söylüyor.  Amacı kayınvalidesi gibi grup lideri olmak ve yurt dışı gezilerine gitmek.  Bunula birlikte satışlarını arttırıp daha çok kazanmak ve çocuklarını okutmak istiyor.  Maya'dan aldığı kredi ile malzeme alacak.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en:
Khodor is 44 years old, a Palestinian refugee, and a married father of seven children.  26 years ago, he started working as a house painter to make his living and cover his family’s expenses and needs. 

Today, Khodor is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to repair his car.  The car is a major tool in his business development, since it is highly desired for easily transporting his initial business tools from one project to another.

Khodor works hard to develop his family’s social and financial situations, although Palestinian refugees have limited access to several working domains in Lebanon. He always hopes to own a house and ensure a better future for his children.

loans.use: To repair his car, which he uses to transport his business tools

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de quatre  femmes, les membres du groupe Benkan sont toutes  mariées dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge de 42 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Sirakoro Doufing dans la commune III du district de Bamako (capitale du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liaisons de parenté, de voisinage et  de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font la vente des chaussures en plastic, du fonio précuit et de la farine de mil. Dans  le souci de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur  2ème cycle de  prêt  solidaire.
Madame Coumba (la 1ère  femme debout à l’extrême droite) est une grande vendeuse de fonio précuit et de la farine de mil. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 sacs de mil et 3 sacs de fonio. Elles s’approvisionnent en céréales au marché de Médine.
